The control is extremely inconsistent. I suspect that this is because Flixel uses a straight variable timestep(which makes physics behavior vary with framerate). The long hangtime is OK since you need it to shoot, but low horizontal dampening is not desirable for this kind of precise platformer.

Also, while I was able to figure out shooting the gun downwards, this mechanic was introduced as a requirement very suddenly. Up until that point I was having some fun with the game and liked seeing some simple puzzles mixed in, but that level put me into a rage between the new mechanics, the higher difficulty, and the control problems.
Also, I would have preferred sound effects to music given the choice since the music got pretty annoying.

First of all, I really like the graphics. Lots of great little touches, like the mega-man death explosion when you hit lasers. Also, I thought the protagonist was really well animated! The music did add tension although it was a big too simple/repetitive, especially without sound effects. The gun and recoil effects were fun. Had you imagined having enemies? I thought it was funny that the character was running around brandishing a gun at no one :)

I definitely found the game difficult. My biggest criticism is that all the important details are so small relative to the screen size. I feel like you could have upsampled your graphics to be twice as big and just made your floors/walls a bit less thick, and it would be easier to see what's going on and control.
Anyway, definitely a successful game. Good job!
Nice graphics, good controls and interesting use of the pistol. The second to last level could have use an extra checkpoint though.

Awesome awesome awesome oldschool style platformer. Very good looking graphics, would have loved to see (hear?) some sound effects. The effect with the gun push back was a great idea, I wish it had been better presented and more obstacles could have utilized it. Very tough though, I wasn't able to beat it. Love the game though!
Nice little escape runner. Not too innovative, but has a few good mechanics. Graphic are very simple, but most effects look nice.
Hard game, but fun. I also didn't figure out the shooting downwards thing. The graphics good, but it definitely needs some sound effects.
I can add very little which hasn't been said before. Staying in the middle of the screen is a must, too far back and you lose, too far forward and you run headfirst into obstacles.

description:
The web version will play immediately. If you want to play it offline, get the zip file and launch the html file locally.
You need java to play this!
author: Notch
title: Prelude of the Chambered
comments: Very cool little game that seems like a cross between Wolf3d and Chips Challenge :)
Wow, this is the best minecraft fangame I've ever seen. You should work for Mojang!
It was really fun to watch you code :) but even more fun to play the game! :D Reminds me of Wolfenstein 3D and Zelda
@Mark Overmars; you should read who the creator is. :)
Epic game. Fun to watch the development live as well.

It's pretty fun, but parts of it get extremely frustrating (GHOOOOOOST MAAAAAZE!) and the game wasn't very rewarding. It felt a lot like traversing a blocky slippery maze and it really felt like it could do with some kind of story or other appealing elements. The controls were a bit slippery, and made me kind of dizzy. I did like the game's progression, but it just didn't feel especially good. The combat was kind of superfluous feeling, although I don't know if it would have been better without it. Overall I have mixed feelings about this game, but it's definitely among the upper tenth of the ones I've tried.
lol he does work for mojang
awesome watching it being programmed live

should have had a boss at the end, I thought the ghost maze was cool but fairly difficult. that one place with the trinket and the rock guarding it felt like trial and error trying to punch it just right so it rolls out.
cant you guys tell when someone is trolling ? Hint : its almost all of them.
Nice work Notch, watching you made me not finish in time
this turned out pretty cool :D nice job!
This game made me look at the livestream more than making my own game. Great work!
The evolution of Mojang games: from punching trees to punching boulders.
Inspires me to make a raycaster for my next project!
Being a games programmer myself, watching you code was inspirational to say the least. the game is fun, and watching how you think, and how you implemented certain things was awesome.
It was an epic thing for you to do, streaming the whole thing, thank you from me, and no doubt many, many others who watched :)
This is pretty awesome! I look forward to looking at the source and the stream (if it's available). I would have watched if I wasn't busy with my own game.
Great game, but too easy if you have watched the livestream :/
I hope there will be a "sequel", since this is only a prelude 8D
Loving how simple this game looks, but how well it plays. Very doom-esque.
i liked it but it i find it too hard to beat the last boss and the end is not really special its just simply over :(

Would you mind if I made a mod to this using the source provided? I would like to get your permission and approval, and make sure I understand the terms of use. Send me a PM with a response, and I'll tell you my idea.
Please someone post the playlist Notch was listening yesterday.
@thiagocamposviana I've made an account just for you!!!
The two radio stations that I heard were Soma.fm - Groove Salad station and then di.fm Electro House channel.
Hope that helps :) They were the stations he was streaming at some point as I checked to make sure they were playing the same tracks :D
Simple but polished and fun. The difficulty level is just right, and there's a clear sense of escaping & exploration.
Basically a spot-on project for Ludum Dare, spiced with generous community involvement. The programming is ambitious for a 48h game.
Is there a prize for whoever got the most votes on their game?

It's honestly sick how productive Notch is. The game feels really Minecraftey, with the low-res graphics and all the punching - for obvious reasons, of course. But, the game is interesting enough to spend the time required to finish it, and plays off the theme well. Very impressive. I gave it 4/5 stars.
Good thing notch has quite a fan club... LD is probably squealing at the sheer numbers he is reeling in with Twitter and Google+ etc.

I wish I could have played through the whole thing but the old style wolfenstein graphics make me motion sick after a while :( I liked the progression through each weapon, but I didn't feel in control during the combat and it's annoying to have to restart if you die.
Loved the game, hated the ghost room bit...
Is anyone else getting an error message when trying to launch the offline version?  I always get this error: load: class com.mojang.escape.EscapeApplet not found.
- Coding a raycaster from scratch in 2 days is impressive.
- The level design is compact, having no dead areas or underused items.
- Controls were sluggish at times, and the game flickered occasionally. but I'm thinking my computer is to blame for that.

- The chip sounds are fine. However, the richer the visual content is, the richer the sound content should be as well, to create an aesthetic balance. So here I felt there was too little sound. If the monsters made noises, or a simple tune was playing to enhance to mood, that would be better.
Overall: A nice piece of work. Well done. :-)
ha, i'm pretty sure, mark overmars (creator of gamemaker) knows who notch is... he is just joking.

I enjoy the game... although the ghost room is really dumb.  The room itself is cool, but unless I'm missing something, I can't get the ghost to come back without getting brutally murdered.  Playing 10-15 minutes to get to that point only to die, and then trying 3 separate times, is just too rough.

Really great game.  I expect you will get many many votes, and you deserve all the success that doing well in ludum dare grants you.  Plus, there were like 10,000 people that watched you write the code, so you probably didn't cheat.
I absolutely enjoyed watching you code. Please do that more often. I learned _so_ much.
An all round great game, love the whole "doom-style" graphics thing you have going. :)
a metroidvania-wolf mix ? Good game, but only one life? :(
Excellent game, but I feel that the ghost maze was just too difficult to get through. Despite this, one of the best entries to LD48.
Its awesome, but its a little bid hard on some parts :)
Innovation... kudos for doing lock 'n' key.

Fun... I didn't get lost! Yay! I'm not here to play Super Bat Puncher though (it's a real game and it's better than it sounds)... thanks for reverting to the version which didn't spawn a crapton of bats. Having said that, the lock 'n' key aspect DID drive me to continue playing, though.
Theme... you pretty much nailed it.

Graphics... how do you do floor/ceiling mapping? This is one thing I suck at when doing this sort of engine. Having said that, apart from lacking y-shearing, you've really thrashed the hell out of the classic 2d grid caster. The actual assets look quite nice, too.
Audio... plenty of noises. Could do with more atmosphere tbqh.
Humour... well, pretty meh. Not bad, but not much.
Community... doing a stream is pretty damn good. It would be nice if you were listening to suggestions on e.g. Twitter, though.
For some reason I'm having trouble getting this to run.
My favourite mechanic is pushing boulders into the holes. I can definitely see the Link's Awakening inspiration in there as I'm playing through it myself. Thanks for streaming your process.
This has a great classic Zelda feel with a gameplay similar of King's Field, which is awesome! Great job!
This looks like its gonna be fun to mod XD
The simplistic UI is great, and the first time I climbed the ladder to the outside I was pleasantly surprised -- I didn't expect more than the single dungeon level.
I found it quite difficult to aim with the Power Glove, and think that things could be improved with a target reticle.
I stopped playing shortly after getting the pistol due to a bug.  I'd somehow managed to position a boulder at the base of a ladder, and got stuck inside it.

Hm... I really want to play this but... I am running this on OS X [snow leopard] in Chrome and I am having a lot of trouble getting it to run.. the screen flickers black every 3-4 seconds, and a few seconds into the game the character abruptly started running backward and would not stop. Has anyone successfully run this on mac?

@mcc Don't know about running backwards, but I had the same flickering problem when running it in a browser. So in the end I just downloaded it (by clicking "Windows" instead of "Web") and ran it from the command line. To run it:
It was well done, just not a whole lot of fun.
you have raised the bar, and I personally learned a lot from this entry. I find my self going back to play it again, sure sign of a winner.
The floor/ceiling mapping appears to be calculated on a per pixel basis, filling in whatever holes remain in the zbuffer. This is the most intensive part I imagine.
very good game compared to other but its hard for survive.
While i think that you deserve +9K community and +9K art, I don't feel that the game is *that* good overall, as many people have expressed (if you factor in Sound, Innovation, Theme and Humor).
This entry made me think that we really really need a *Tech* category, because in my book, you also have +9K there.
Tho I must admit that the livestream was AWESOME, and I actually left it there running as background music, and I was thoroughly entertained while having lunch.

description:
First Ludum Dare, yay ! This has been fantastic :D
So you're kind of trapped in kind of a castle, and there are kind of ghosts everywhere, and you kind of need to escape their wrath and get out of the place.
Also, some ambient sounds. Put headphones on :)
A bug which makes the game to crash can sometimes be encountered after obtaining the second key, sorry..
EDIT 23/08 : I know the game is way too hard, but to challenge myself I've tried to beat it, moving slowly and hiding myself. And I did ! Just to see that I've failed my final trigger and the ending won't launch haha, owned..
EDIT 04/09 : An improved version of the game is now up on Kongregate. Remember to vote only according to the original "Web" version though :)
Made with FlashPunk. I used a slightly modified version of the lighting engine by Noel Berry.
author: Gib
title: Poltergeist
comments: This is a very cool game. A little hard, but really fun gameplay. Congratulations to that entry!
GODDAMNIT. I spilt all my coffee when the first ghost screamed. That was some DAMN FINE audio improvisation my friend.
This is LD#21 most scary submission till now.
But I agree with the other comment, the game is really fun, albeit hard.
Congrats! CongratsX2 as this is your first time!
Horrifying audio. ;) Fun (but hard) little game!
Looks cool, but the screen scrolls at about half the speed that my character walks.  Anyone else having that problem?

The scrolling speed is not actually a bug. I just wanted to encourage the player to progress carefully and not rushing too much. Didn't have the time to tweak the scrolling speed thought, it may be a bit slow..
My heart is crashed because of the sound they make... uhh.
And it's impassible to avoid them to get the first key imho, so this is no fun for me.
Good gravy! Heard the first ghost and jumped outta my skin, accidentally hit a bunch of keys (which flipped desktop spaces on my Macbook Pro), and promptly died (in game).  Job well done!

Dude, rock on for the nice lighting effect and animated main character.  I died near instantly though to specters three or four times in a row, couldn't figure out how to avoid them.  Still though, nice entry, just ease people in a bit.

Dood this rocks! really nice entry. Nice mechanic, trying to run away from ghosts is quite scary. Good use of sounds and lighting to build a compellingly scary atmosphere. Although I like a good challenge but this game is perhaps a touch hard to start.
This is hrad, but fun. Especially the introduction (but isn't it speeled "spectre"?
The atmossphere is also well done.
My only grief with the game, is that I got killed by ghosts too many times while walking near de edge of the camera field of view. It would be better if the camera was centered on the player.
Amazing entry. The only problem is the resolution. On monitors with smaller screens, you can only view a portion of the game.
Oh the horror! :D Excellent entry, took me few times to learn to escape from ghosts (nad yeah, it might be a bit too hard)
I eventually got pretty good at avoiding the ghosts.  But is there an end to the game?  I got to the bottom right corner and you could just leave the map.  Pretty awesome lighting.  Congrats
@Canyon I edited the description of the game, I failed my final trigger, so the ending won't launch even if you reach the exit, sorry <_<
Interesting mechanics. Looks promising, but unbalanced as it is. Sounds were too loud for my liking.
And game wouldn't fit in my browser window.

description:
Hey,
first time I actually _finish_ something for Ludum Dare.
Controls:
W A S D / arrow keys  -  movement
left mouse button     -  open doors / buttons
I recommend the *web* version some changes didn't make it in the zip files in time...
Have fun :)
author: pragmascript
title: Pointless Spheres From Above
comments: Doorways were little too narrow, player collider got stuck. Never saw any spheres, maybe because I didn't even get to the first sliding platform. I couldn't proceed in the game until I got too frustrated and quit the game :(

I like how nicely these simple shapes are rendered. I know that's mostly thanks to unity but I appreciate it. It made me think of The Witness for some reason. But then it turned into a 3D plattformer.

Those spinning plates really made me motion sick. I didn't know that a game could do that to me. And I could swear that there was an invisible wall when I tried to cross the finish line for the first 4 times, but I made it in the end.
Mouse sensitivity is a bit too high for my taste.
It's a nice game, you need to polish controls a bit and add some sort of story.. reminds me Portal :D

First person platform jumping is not really a good idea. It is too hard to judge where the edge of the ledge is relative to your feet. It took way too long to get over the horizontal moving platform. When I hit the spinning plates I could not bring my self to continue for fear of facing that damn platform again.
I love the lighting and can see the similarities with The Witness.
The first moving platform moves back and forth a bit fast and the movement of the spinning plates makes jumping a bit awkward, but other than that it's very enjoyable. :D

I couldnt work out how to make the first platform start up. When I looked through a window near the starting point, I saw a red switch, but couldnt work out how to turn it on. I also tried jumping onto the platform but I hit the roof before I was halfway to it and fell.

Reminds me of the ball pit at Chuck-E-Cheese's. I really liked the building architecture and the light/shadows. The spinning plates are fun, but I wasn't skilled enough to get past them and eventually gave up. :/ Really neat gameworld up until that point though! :)
The vertical lifts clipped through me and I could jump back on them :)
The rendering would be the strong point of this entry, it gave the level a sterile and unforgiving appearance (in the good way)

description:
Don't let the little men escape your wrath. Stomp them all!
Avoid the houses at all cost.
Press "A" or "Left Arrow" to lift left foot
Press "D" or "Right Arrow" to lift right foot
Press the button again when your foot is on air to stomp it.
My highest score is around 300.
Made with Flash AS3.
Sounds generated with as3sfxr.
author: heck
title: No Escape
comments: This is very difficult! I got just 185 points. =/ Nice job!
I loved it and I'd love to see this with some hand drawn graphics!
It was too hard for me as well. Nice concept though.
Thank you for playing! I agree, it's too difficult.
I would've lower the difficulty if I wasn't running out of time xD
Lmao. Great game. It's quite tricky on the brain! I got about 50 points.
Hahaha, I am hilariously terrible at this game; I'm enjoying it a great deal because of this, but would love to not have to reach for my mouse to restart.
Nice idea, but the "movement" doesn't become clear (I thought he just stood there). The ground needs some sort of texture or noise, to make it more apparent.
Besides that, nice stomper! (I'm calling this genre now this way)
Stomped humans make satisfying splash... But that's about the only thing I liked - I got really bored quite quick with it.
Why the little people put their little houses so close from each other?!!

description:
Sometimes a man just has to get away from it all.
Some poorer documented things:
arrow keys do things too
sitting dodges bullets
police shoot past the car if you aren't in it
hold the push button and walk to push the car
author: Farfin
title: Gunz And Sedanzz
comments: I like how the main character is an office drone running from the cops.
I could only die...  Wasn't 100% sure if this was intentional or not, but I loved it anyway, amazing!  Great game!
Fun game! Who knew running from the cops could be so fun?

It was hard to figure out how to "win", I found the best tactic was to sit in front of the car and let the police shoot each other, collect a lot of gas, then drive to the end. Awesome pixel art and humor, I love the suggestive story.
Ahahahahaha brilliant presentation! I was forced into a footrace once three cops stacked up, but otherwise it was a great experience. The beginning, music switch, and ending were great!
Took me some time to understand what I'm supposed to do and then it was a bit too easy. Very nice implementation, both audio and audio
This was a fun little adventure. Run from the cops so you can drive into the river. Nice five minute game.

description:
This is a game where you have to evade the police in your get-away car as you race across the desert. Well, that's what it is supposed to be anyway. This was my first LD48 and it was quite the learning experience. I used Java with the Slick2D engine, which I had never used before. I didn't get it finished, but I am happy I got something.
Controls:Arrow keys for steering and gas/brake
The arrow at the top points to the target.
Avoid police cars and cacti.
author: Achilles
title: Get Away
comments: Well, there's not much to do :)
The game's intuitive, but the enemies are completely unchallenging.
I appreciate that you took the time to include sound, however - too many games are silent.
The sound started out kind of loud. It would have been nice to explain controls in game but otherwise good job.

I've tried three times, always just drove straight for the end (only once i got hit by police car which promptly disappeared). After I hit the target game tells me I've escaped and then crashes. Boring, there's no challenge.

Very simple. Controls are not well done, acceleration and turning is very slow. View range is also too short. Terrain could use some variety. Engine sound is very annoying. No real challenge but to drive straight off once you know where cops are.

description:
**Windows binary has been fixed (hopefully)!**
Only includes a Windows binary, but Mac and Linux users should be able to download love2d (http://love2d.org/) and run the included source.
Being a geomancer is rewarding work, but sometimes demand for your services is slow. Between jobs, you work as the local shepherd. Being out in the pasture gives you plenty of opportunity to practice your wizardry however. In a freak subduction accident, you have unwittingly unleashed a hailstorm of fire! Use your powers to drive as many of the sheep as you can to their pen, gather some inexplicable stars for some reason, then escape to your portal!
Controls:
w: jump
a: left
d: right
mouse: magic target location
left click: pull ground
right click: push ground
As a geomancer, you have the power to manipulate earth. You power is stronger the closer you are to the target. The green circle shows you the strength at the current location. Careful, shaping the ground into odd arrangements may disturb the precarious balance of geomancy, leading to disappearing triangles, etc.! Shape the ground to guide sheep into the pen and reach stars. Position yourself and the ground to achieve this as quickly as possible. Be warned, fire spawns increasingly quickly, and touching it will cause you to restart the level. Complete the level by reaching the portal. There are two levels.
Scoring
per sheep in pen: 50 points
per star collected: 10 points
time: 0 (just pretend it matters, aim for a low time with as many points possible!)
author: elcow
title: Geomancer Shepherd
comments: when i try to run the game (in the game window) it displays an error
OK, it should be fixed now. For some reason, other computers couldn't find the library when it was bundled in the executable. It's now bundled loose in the zip file, and it seems to work that way.
Interesting, innovative, i like it. I saw the OpenAL dll there but heard no sound, maybe it was not working for me.
The escape argument was too forced, that rates down for me.

description:
FuhFuhFire! by Robert Yang (@radiatoryang)
WASD to move, SPACEBAR to jump.
MOUSE to look, LEFT-CLICK to do stuff.
>>> You're the type of guy who starts fires, just so you can save people from them and be a hero. First you'll set your Fire Bomb, then you'll rescue your Victims. Maybe your plan will go awry (it probably will) and you'll just have to ESCAPE by yourself, leaving the rest behind in their screaming agony?
- 8 different endings
- dynamic fire propagating system
- dynamic level destruction! wow!
- totally unrealistic model of firefighting
- ... and more!
Made with Unity3D, some super simple models in Maya, some sounds recorded on a Singstar USB mic + Audacity, and some simple textures in Photoshop.
author: Radiatoryang
title: FuhFuhFire!
comments: Interesting idea (although you have to get behind the evil character first).
Also, you forgot to mention "hulk-like-super-jump" in the features :-)
Nice screaming and the idea that you first start fire and then play hero is interesting.

It's a shame I only got one ending, in other cases there was no text, just "headlines of tomorrow wallpapers.." and nothing more. But the one I got was rather funny. Screams are bloody annoying, makes you want to escape from those whiny cowards.
Fun, but the audio made it INCREDIBLY annoying.

Nice!, I can see you put alot of effort into this. I think the atmosphere is great, definitely gets across the idea of claustrophobia and anxiety. My thing with voice acting is that more often than not it detracts from the game unless done well and yours was done well so good job!

My one big critique would be that everything you did could have been done on a level twice as small, by spreading it all out so much (in my opinion) the atmosphere I described above tends to dissipate a bit and isn't as effective. What that did for me, atleast, is not make it as exciting to be running around, putting out fire and getting victims to the exit; I'm sure if the gamefield was smaller it would have been much more tense (just my opinion though).
Overall though great game and innovative concept!

I had difficulty with both the extinguisher, and finding the victims, but I did really enjoy the graphics and the audio. I think something like a minimap to help me find the next person would be really awesome. Great job!
Sometimes I had the idea to let them burning.  They were too annoying...
Interesting concept, but I couldn't really figure out what to do with all the people.  Also, am I supposed to be playing as an arsonist or a firefighter?

description:
Three characters have gotten themselves into very dire situations, and it's your job to guide them out... rapid-fire! The arrow keys is all you'll need, play it in your browser.
Libraries
=========
- FlashPunk
- TweenLite
Software
========
- FlashDevelop
- Photoshop
- Audacity
author: ChevyRay
title: Flee Buster
comments: Sweet idea!  The three different games thing was totally awesome.  The highest I got in a couple of tries was 36 tokens.
PS That splash screen is the best.  Ever.
I like the idea. But it is very frustrating when your about to die in one game and you can't avoid it ...

Played this three or four times. Damn hard! Collected about 50 tokens and eventually made it to 3 or 4 "cycles" of the 3 mini games.  Definitely tough when you are in a shitty spot when the minigame switches and having to restart completely made me not play for too long.  I like the visual style and the differences between the minigames mechanics/controls.
71 tokens. Nice game! It kept me playing :)
Cool game, nice idea! Loved it, (And completed it, but didn't get all the tokens). Quite hard and frustrating! :P I love the graphics and the rainbow colours! And the splash screen is really great.
Best one I've played so far :)

Thanks for the comments, folks. Yeah sorry it's so hard, it turned out way more difficult than I intended. The switching between games turned out super hard! I made it a bit easier in that it will only switch once the platformer characters are on the ground, and also made it display that meter on the bottom so you can time thing correctly, but it's still a really difficult game.
If anybody has any specific suggestions of how I could tweak it to make it a bit more beginner friendly, I'd love to hear them!

I like how the switching mechanic forces you to think where to leave your character, then quickly adjust again. The controls feel fair and the one life policy keeps the player on their toes. Addicting stuff, I'll get all the tokens eventually!
pretty great take on the micro game. I like it a ton.
Wow, great idea, great execution. The gameplay is tight, the controls work perfectly. I'm saving this one. Do like.

50 Tokens! The concept and the execution are so good that I can't stop from retrying. What's more, it fits the theme perfectly, and in an innovative way by playing multiple fun games at the same time. The graphics are awesome, the sound effects are good (the game might have benefited from a chiptune background music). ChevyRay's journal has only one post, which is sad, but it's nothing compared to the fun of the games.
Loved it, Chevy. :D I got to 73 tokens and want to keep playing, but I have another 520 games to review so I need to keep moving. ;)
I'm going to look into the source for this one for sure! Love the monochrome aesthetics.
I've refresh the page five times juste to see the preloader again and again.
Also, great game. The frog part is my fav.
very cool! some of the graphics felt very cactus inspired for some reason, but overall good work!

Just Wow... I don't test all the game for now but your game is Awesome, i tried a prototype you put on the channel, i found it really fun but now he is really REALLY good. you have make my girlfriend laugh.
I really love this game and its "tarantino movie style". I hope this one win contest!
@Fififox Thanks! Yeah unfortunately I always get so distracted and forget to post in the journal on the site... and when I do remember, I never really know what to put up.
Next time I'll try to be a bit more involved and share WIP stuff as I go along, since that's always fun to see.
I got 76 tokens. This is addictive. I like the retro graphics a lot.
This is amazing. Definitely my favorite one so far.
Now this is fun! Thank you!
91 and I'm tired... must... sleep... can't... must... play... :)

Sweet, really adictive. The only way I think it could be made more casual friendly, would be to reset the game to the last instance of "dude running away from flying saucer", instead of the very first one.
Nice graphics.  I wasn't a fan of the sudden context-switching or frog-mode.  Good sound.
Very nice game. Simple graphics, but they looked good. The game mechanic of switching between "experiences" is great; it adds a suspense sort of feeling to it.
The thing I don't like is the difficulty, largely caused by the fact that you have to restart all three if you die in one; not sure if there's a way round that though.
Finally, I think it would've been good to have two slightly different sounds for the tokens to add some more audial variety.
I have no idea what is going on in there, but the gameplay is increedibly understanable and compelling.
Also, it's great how the "chevy ray"-page works as a sort-of tutorial and explains the cuboid monsters :-)
What's with this trend of making more games than required? You've got three, and Rolpege made like 20. I guess LD has gotten too easy...

Fun though, and very stressful. It definitely works well in that you memorize the state of each game so you hopefully know what to do when it comes around again. At one point I was a hair away from dying in the frog game (which I love/hate btw due to sticking on the ground and very fluid feel of jumping) but remembered it next time so I could immediately leap and survive.
My best so far is 88, with only two or three missed along the way. I'll have to rest before trying the whole thing again from the top.

really fun! great feel to the platforming, I think the only thing I'd like to add is checkpoints so if you die you don't have to restart the entire thing. after 3 goes getting quite far (I think) I gave up when I died again
Switching between the three escapees was cool, and I really liked the audio. LoFi goodness.

that is a frustratingly fun game, I love adapting the way you control each game mode and remembering its state. The rapid fire context switching keeps you on your toes. Good entry! The frog is a love/hate for me as well.

Wow! So much fun to play. I love the graphics and sound and the personality they give the game. The controls on the ship game are sweet, too - super responsive. The switching between minigames really adds to the sense of urgency whilst escaping (also, knowing you only have one chance to do it!) Great stuff.
Cool stuff, the screenshots totally doesn't do the game justice. love the colorfade :D
Absolutely fantastic game and idea, wish LD would let me vote for you!
Man Chevy, you're always being a champ! The controls feel great in all three and the graphics and audio are quite good.
Perfect for us ADD types out there!  Loved it.

I love the graphics, and I love the idea, and it's fun for a short while, but the controls ruin it for me. The ship controls feel fight, but the frog and runner feel more frustrating than fun. But overall definitely one of my favorites that I've played. :)
At first I thought that you wanted to avoid the tokens. Because of the sound they made and that what looked liked the health bar shrunk when you touched them. Lol. Besides that, Great game!
Interesting idea, the game is a bit too hard though. A little pause/slow-mo when switching games could help.
Really great game, I got to 48 token.  It'd be awesome if you use the Journal more next time.  Great work
very nice! though as soon as i played it i instantly thought of give up robot
Not much that I can say that hasn't already been said: cool, challenging, fun, nice style and sound. Good stuff!
Wow. Graphics and sound really work great with this game. The sudden change of scenery and playstayle is a neat idea.
Nice one! I liked the mixing of the 3 games! I had the same idea but with just 2 and a bit differently while writing my entry (its not an arcade game).
Awesome game! Really hard... But I'll get all of the 130 tokens! It's a duty!
Well this was a pleasant surprise. At least you didn't need to control all three of them at once. The timing was fine and didn't need any changes.

Great game. Has me yelling at my screen though. One specific thing I noticed is that it seems like to land on a platform with the frog you seem to have to jump higher than feels like should be required. Other than that, I guess it just gets pretty difficult. Actually, especially the frog parts do.

Excellent - among the dozens of generic platformers (although in your case platformer is just one third of the game :D) I've tried by now yours shine spectacularly... It's quite fun to play (not easy, but also not superhard as some others) and I didn't mind that much that I died here and there and had to restart (which is to say something...:) Art reminded me zx spectrum (color changing was excelent idea) and your sounds are good and fitting, especially considering you made them on your mouth :)

description: You are standing in a hallway. There is a dragon. To escape from the dragon, type the magic number, and press enter.
author: kasper
title: Escape!!
comments: Pretty fun game, for a while. Was a fairly generic concept, but the endless aspect of it made it neat (It was endless, right?)
It was fun, until I checked the source and I realized I'd be sitting there for another hour. XD. Very well thought up idea for a game!
I haven't played a game quite like this one before :)
you should try typing I will eat it.
I liked the way you used the themeing to make something otherwise a bit tiresome much more engaging.  I really would have preferred it if I'd reached an ending before I gave up.
If there was a Ludum Dare 1 hour contest, you'd probably win :)

Interesting dressing for guess a number game but there didn't seem to be a difficulty ramp or penalty for guessing wrong.  As the player progresses maybe mix it up with much higher numbers, negative numbers, decimals etc.
I agree with Jonathan, what a great way to take an otherwise boring game and make it a bit more interesting.
It's an interesting way to take a simple concept and drag it out for hours. But once you learn the trick, it's pretty fast to get through. Jag Ã¥t allt :).

When it said "You are standing in a hallway. There is a dragon. To escape from the dragon, type the magic number, and press enter," I typed in "the magic number," and it said "Please enter an integer number!" I was sort of disappointed :P.
But yes, like everyone said, very fun :)

description:
You wake up on a spaceship. Your HUD informs you that you're accelerating towards the planet. You must reactivate the engines to reach escape velocity before atmospheric pressure causes the ship to explode.
Controls: WASD/Arrow Keys, ESC opens menus, Pause key pauses, and Enter Fixes/Collects materials.
Note: On XNA4.0/.NET 4.0
author: Agemennon
title: Escape Velocity
comments: easy share is a pain for downloading, cannot you put on a dropbox folder please?
Yet another game I can't play, because of proprietary technology =(
I agree with Gornova, put it on a dropbox folder, couldn't play it.
Took me longer to download then to finish :(
Can't download, sorry but not rating.
Sorry, can't rate it because I cant start it
I'm not sure what just happened... but I won?

description:
Please read the title screen! It explains the basics of the game.
Thank you for checking it out!
Escape Prevention require .NET 4 and XNA 4.
.NET 4: http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/confirmation.aspx?id=17718
XNA 4: http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/confirmation.aspx?id=20914
author: wraith
title: Escape Prevention
comments: it was very polished, but very difficult to control and far too easy to accidentally hit the escape portal yourself to end the game. nice little game though, just needs a few tweaks!
XNA =( (I am on Linux) But by your journal, it seems pretty good =)
"very difficult to control and far too easy to accidentally hit the escape portal yourself to end the game"
Just wanted to point out, if you read the title screen, it mentions a brake key (Shift). I find this a pretty important part of the game and makes the controls more manageable.
Thanks a lot for your feedback!
It's pretty polished, tho i did not like the controls they were too unintuitive (even if I knew about using the shift key for braking).

description: Not only is "Escape or Die" my first Ludum Dare submission, it's also the first game I've completed. And it shows!
author: Team Zarkoman
title: Escape or Die
comments: I like your approach to sound effects. I like it a lot.
Simple, short, but at least playable, if a bit silly.
Nice sound effects, it really lets you know exactly what you're doing at the time. =)
Not that bad for your first game... and compared with some other entries I've tried it's at least playable :)

Nice hifi sound effects, and a nice double-pronged threat in the form of both health and time - I like the pressure and haphazard gameplay forced upon the player by the time limit, only increased by, well, playing.

Charming entry. It just needed a little more variety of sound effects (which were great, btw) and some incentive to keep playing; like a few more levels, or even just showing the time at the end to function as a high score.
Congrats on your first finished game!
I think you're off to a very good start even though the game itself could have more gameplay.

description:
I set out to do a lot more with this project than I usually do. I pushed out of my comfort zones and went all out with it to try some new things, and some worked well. Others I'm not quite as happy with, but in the end I think its overall pretty good.
EOF is semi-platformer with an upgrade system, multiple attached levels, standard key puzzles (Everyone loves key puzzles!) boss stages and more. It also has two endings; try to find them both!
REQUIREMENTS:
Windows XP, Vista, or 7
XNA Framework 4.0: http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=20914
.NET Framework 4.0: http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=17851
The game will crash at launch if either is missing!
Timelapse: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BecVpDfQLog
Tools used:
C# / XNA (Via FlatRedBall)
sfxr / bfxr
Audiotool
XACT
GraphicsGale + GIMP + Corel Draw 3 (Not really)
author: FireSlash
title: End of file
comments: I don't know if it's intentional or a bug, but your cooldown for you laser drops (the same amount as when you fire a shot) every few seconds, making it very hard to cool down your guns. Only with a ton of gun upgrades was I able to play without waiting a good 30 seconds between killing each badguy.
Other than that though, great game, love the art and the mechanics. Plus you get 5 star in community for the whole XNA Reach thing (had no idea).
It's a bullet-fest where even the bullets shoot bullets. I especially liked the upgrade system and thought it worked well. Nicely done for a 48 hour code concerto.

I realize now I didn't explain the energy mechanic. Your shields use energy to recharge, so that's what you're seeing. This creates a direct penalty to taking shield damage as it really messes with your ROF at lower reactor levels. Get it up to 4 or 5 and you can spam all day in armor.
Wow, really enjoyed this! Especially liked the replicating bullet bosses. The ending was unexpected too.
can I improve the rate shields generate at? as it is I just alt-tab and do something else to let them fill up
I don't think you can describe this as a platformer in any way
the fact that enemies respawn makes it feel like I have no impact on anything
there was one enemy that I couldn't kill because of how the blocks around it were positioned, that bothers me for some reason

description: 5 Levels!
author: Danvil
title: Danvil's Escape
comments: Sorry i don't understand your game... can you tell us the controls?
I'm kind of stumped as well. Judging from your description of the game, I'm assuming this isn't a question of escaping the title screen :P
The login screen is the first level. Try to think simple :)
And having managed to actually complete the game, here are the solutions. Press enter on first screen to make player icon approach red picture.
Then after entering dungeons, mash escape repeatedly to make player run to the green picture.
This idea not only is not original or fun, but tedious, poorly explained, and having to hit escape a bunch instead of hold it down just leaves me sour.

description:
Escape is unrelenting. To truly accomplish this task, you must ceaselessly, tirelessly run.
(Instructions included in the linked page.)
author: 31eee384
title: Ceaseless
comments: Really good idea. Looks like an optical illusion...
This is highly addictive and cute.
Love the concept, the shape reminds me of a toy i had once where you had to get 2 balls to the centre of a circular maze.
Sweet! You should give this game a nice graphic and cool sound, and publish it! :)
great, love it. definately got potential, although it gets repetitive rather quickly. in the begining you're able to just go around in circles and be fine most of the time.
it love to see some gameplay varieties, like barriers speeding things up temporarily if you move through, or invert the flow of circles.
also, very hypnotic, please dont add colors, i might play it all day long :P
Cool and original concept.  You should add "levels" so the player gets a break every now and then.
I like the game idea. It's mesmerizing. Its gameplay is not very complex. Still, overall good.
This would have been way more mesmerizing with some kind of hypno-toad tones!  Very easy to just mindlessly play for long periods of time even as it is.

in the beginning it's really nice, but at some point it's just "continue to press <- for the next 5 rings" and "now switch to -> for some time" ... and since the radar ball drops through the holes in the rings so easily, there's not much a player can do wrong - like getting stuck on an edge due to wrong timing.
I'd also like some more variety, maybe alternating distances between the rings or some speed up phases.
Anyway, it was fun to play :)

Really fun, but easy mode may be a little too easy.  I had a blast in hard mode!  I do wish that you'd just picked a control scheme for the player rather than asking them all of that up front.  The mouse was my personal favorite because the feel meshed well with the radar-ish graphics.  I like the clean look of the game, too :).
Magnificent mechanics, great use of Flash tweens as well. Kept playing it again and again getting more dizzy by each playthrough. Argh.
Posted a response to comments so far. Can view it through the journal link, or click (?) here: http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2011/08/24/my-ld21-game-ceaseless-comment-responses/

Very interesting mechanic! Graphics are simple but that feels appropriate aesthetically. The main menu could be a little more user-friendly but beyond that I really enjoyed playing this, nice work adding in a hi-score table too!
Loved it! Although the "UI" is kinda confusing.
I didn't submit a highscore since I pretty much sucked at it, lol. But it's quite a good game.
nice idea, confusing UI though. I good game that quite relaxing to play for a length of time. Good submission
wow, neat puzzle(?) game. very good idea executed well.

description:
Cave escape!
Press F6 For the rules,
I made this in game maker 8, Its not that good,  :|
author: Natedog9145
title: Cave Escape!
comments: I can't get F6 to display the rules, so there might be something I'm missing, but from what I can see the biggest problem, and it's a huge problem, is that the level generator is totally random, and usually makes impossible levels. Try making a procedural generator that assures that the level can be done.
Try using bounding box collisions rather than pixel-perfect ones. Also, yes, the random level generator produces 75% unbeatable levels.

The random level generation is your biggest downfall.  Probably would have been better to build a lot of different levels and select each at random so that they're all at least beatable.  Otherwise, it's a good start and I hope to see your next #LD48 game :)
Level generator is not good and the colors are ugly.
Ya this was rushed in a night,
Anyways i learned ALOT more code so imma have a comeback in december.  :)
Imma do my sprites in paint.net next time to be more colorful
Could have used a lot more work. Really needs a better level generator.
Level generator is total killer, but even if it was working it wouldn't be very good game. About the only thing I kinda liked was music.
*Note to self: Dont use a random generator for LD22*

I concur with the rest: most levels were unplayable.  I also couldn't see the rules hitting F6, it instead created a new level.  The collision also was somewhat weird as the player could be left floating in the middle of a block.

description:
An attempt at a kind of strategy roguelike, but I was way too ambitious and it's missing all the complexity that would make it interesting.
Take control of a group of animals escaped from a safari park and try to evade your captors for long enough that they eventually forget about you and you can finally live free in the countryside.
No sound. Partly because it doesn't seem particularly necessary, mainly because I ran out of time.
author: NiallM
title: Safari Park Escape
comments: Won't launch for me, I'm afraid. Just minimises to task bar and sits there.
Interesting gameplay, I really liked the graphics.
Great entry! It still needs work but you have a pretty unique idea here with some pretty great artwork. Keep working on this!
I couldn't figure out how to win and got all my animals captured. I liked the graphics and the gameplay shows potential.
This could use a little more of a tutorial - I wasn't really sure what I was doing, but clicking to move my animals seemed to work eventually.
@zed: Did you have firefox running and minimised, by any chance? I've had issues in the past with firefox forcing SDL apps to minimise on Vista. The solution is just to unminimise or quit firefox.

@Andrew: There's two ways to win: Avoid capture with at least one of your animals till turn 50, or defeat all the humans in battle. How easy that will be depends on which animals you selected to escape with. Elephants are really tough and can do a lot of damage if you gang up 2 of them on a human, hippos and owls can go on lake tiles where humans can't capture them...
The animals' different stats were supposed to make each one useful in its own way, but running out of time meant some of them are more useful than others.

The graphics were well done, I know you didn't finish everything you wanted to but I can see where you were going, that would've been cool :D A critique though was that there wasn't much direction given to the player; when the game started I wasn't sure where it was that I was supposed to go  to, etc. I liked the idea of different stats applied to different characters which added some strategy to the mix, good job!

Nice art and idea (I was considering escape from zoo too for a few moments too before discarding it for not knowing how to do it interesting), but it really is too unfinished (and buggy - in one attempt  generated level meant that my hippo could just stand on the place and be attacked almost every turn, as he couldn't walk through the trees and he could only return to the park. Also losing turn for trying to walk wrong way doesn't seem much fair.

description:
E to interact
Space to jump
Escape.
A game by Adam Rademacher and Marie Lazar.
author: offwhitefox
title: Reveal
comments: I'm in a room full of posters and don't know where to go. :(
What do you once the floor has fell? The screen just stays black for me :S
I fell and all went black. Is it supposed?
Using the mouse click instead of using E would have been nicer (and faster).
After the floor fell, the screen went black, and after some seconds, I got stuck falling and looking at the ceiling (or going up and looking at the floor).
Talk about desconstruction of a genre huh? Nice artistic expression here, but not much of a game. I just wish you could have done a proper ending...
The ending is exactly as proper as it was meant to be.  If you're upset by it, it's working as intended ^^
so we were escaping from a serial killer? Or the pressures of modern society on women?  Glad I found out the ending in the comments, and didn't keep tearing out boards ;)
Nice job! Totally felt like I was about to be killed if I didn't get out of there.

Nothing special :( ...and very short + after 30 posters big stereotype. + that planks were copied .... on every wall they were falling to same direction ...so on one wall to player , on another to side and on another away from player. And you should add some message in the end.. like "You escaped". But good idea with that crowbar. (sorry for my english)
My only real thing I can think of that I think would be an improvement was to make the crowbar quicker so it felt more panicked. Very good game with an excellent atmosphere.
the atmosphere is really enticing. I was always curious what I might reveal.
OH SHIT! The game is called "Reveal"
The atmosphere was great.  A little boring tearing down boards after a while, but I found the game satisfying if artsy.
Pretty nice game, but it would have been 5x as good if I could interact with a mouse click. Toward the end I was tempted to turn it off because I was so sick of spamming 'E'.
This is a nice looking entry, though. Interesting take on the theme, too. Well done!
Interesting idea, though way to much grind.

Nice work, great atmosphere! There's something very satisfying about ripping and breaking things. The ending is is very appropriate. The de-planking part may have taken a bit too long though. A HL2-style crowbar would have worked better.
I found the beginning really compelling.  The posters and wallpaper were pitch perfect and the audio was fantastic for the experience.

description:
This was my first Ludum Dare. I'm happy I was able to finish a game in time! (This is Windows only right now. I may eventually port it.)
Try to escape from the prison.
Update: A new, improved version is out! (See above, source/everything included, POST-COMPO)
author: Jacic
title: Prisoner
comments: He is very slow, which I was sorta willing to accept until I had to beat a clock! No chance.

I had just 1 second to spare, and I had to move mostly in diagonal because he moved (or at least seemed to move) faster.  Also, stopping me dead on *any* collision to the walls is not nice, because sometimes I just hit the corner and I lost some precious time.
Thanks for the feedback everyone! I've increased his speed for the next build of the game, which will probably be available soon.
Yeah, the compo was too slow. V1.1 is fun but the gameplay feels a little lacking. The puzzles weren't too hard; I beat it the first time with 15 seconds left.

The tutorial levels are really tedious and I felt my main incentive for finishing the game was to ensure I didn't play them again. I hope you respawn the player from the 90 second mark (I didn't check).

description: A game about an escaping idea.
author: nr505
title: pblob
comments: Wrote the wrong name... i am too tired to have extended deadlines =(
If you didn't compose/record the music yourself, you shouldn't use it for the 48h competition entry.
The screenshot had me worried, but this is a very clever and refreshing take on 2D platforming. Nicely done.
Bah... I misread the rules. Guess I'm out of the competition then =( . Thanks for the comment =)
Cute little platformer. love the shapeshifting idea. made some cool puzzles there :) enjoyed it!
I got stuck on one of the later levels, but I really liked it. Clever!
Neat idea, although I seem to hit bugs where I turn into a circle and fall through the level. But I like the feel and look of it. I'm sorry that you misunderstood the rules :(
Fun game, but I think I found a glitch. On the level that has an unreachable blue spot with blocks on all sides, I got stuck in there somehow.

I couldn't figure out how to get past the second level.  The game seemed to keep glitching out and turning me into a ball, whereupon I would immediately fall to the bottom of the screen and roll around down there.  I like the idea though, and it seems like a promising concept.
Very fun to play!  Would have liked to see even more shape-shifting options.  Solid game idea, good puzzle progression through the levels.
Good job on the puzzle design.
I was rather disheartened by having misread the rules, but all your positive comments made it a lot better: Thanks everyone! =)

description:
This is an inverted Tower-Defense game, with aliens spawning in the mlddle and attempting (by randomly shuffling about)to escape to the outside world to infect humans with their stupidity rays.
If an Alien escapes, the game ends.
This game was made in about 14 hours, due to a complete and total mess-up of the first attempt, I'm glad I managed to pull through anyway, and I hope this game will provide some people with at least a few moments of fun.
If you have trouble running the game, contact me at sugardood@gmail.com
Shout-Outs to Chibi-Neko, my sister, and her BF, Yucca, thanks for having me over for the holidays!
Shout-Outs to the LD community too, you guys are awesome, can't wait to try out your games.
author: Gaeel
title: OMFG Aliens!
comments: Sadly the game crashes upon opening so I wasn't able to try it out (Windows Server 2008 R2 SP1). No error message, just a generic windows crash.  Was really looking forward to this one, because I loved the title ^_^
I can't figure out how to compile this on my 32-bit ubuntu 10.10 box. I can see that I have to install libsfml-dev but I seem to be missing something else.
If you have sfml development files the following command should compile it for you :
Then run ./OMFGAliens to try the game
Let me know if this doesn't work, and what error you got.
I was stupidly waiting for the start screen to clear out, pressing any key I could think of.  Until I found out that I had to hit "escape".  You should add this to the readme.
It was fun, although I suck as this game.  The towers felt to have some kind of annoying range: sometimes they could hit an alien, but they couldn't hit an alien that was seemingly in the same range.
Their range is a 50 pixel (5 square) circle, calculated using good old Pythagoras' theorem.

description:
Wow. I literally just wrote code, 3d-modelled, composed music pretty much non-stop for 48 hours. I had some problems building the Windows version in the end, so posting this a little late (thank god for the extension!).
The game is a little smaller than I originally planned, but I'm pretty proud of it and I hope that you enjoy it!
I used a framework called Polycode (which I am also the developer of and which you can find at polycode.org).
Aside from that I used Blender for 3d modelling and animation, Photoshop for  all graphical needs, Reason 4 for music and SFXR for sounds.
The code is a real mess, so don't take it too seriously. I had to jam a ton of quick fixes in the last few hours, so it's really really ugly.
HOPE YOU LIKE IT!!
author: toastie
title: Number 23 Escapes!
comments: Neat graphics, but there were a lot of little bugs and then gameplay got quite repetitive later in the game. It seemed to me that the guards couldn't hit the protagonist at all, and it was impossible to predict their movements. Using the buttons to change the active barrier was a bit annoying because standing on the button made the barriers toggle very fast, thus making it impossible to be sure that the desired barrier is on when you leave the button. I got nearly to the end, until in one room trying to leave through a door made the character fall off the world instead.
The soundtrack is also quite fitting.

Nice music, art syle, and zelda-puzzleish mechanics. Controls were a bit wonky, relative to the character rather tahn typical isometric controls. Also would be nice to see the guards' projectiles, or have the counter stop. You did some nice work here.

So first off, in terms of graphics, sound, style and scope this is an amazing achievementâ�¦ definitely an EXCELLENT advertisement for Polycode. Not joking-- while playing I kept thinking "Wow, Unity sure does let you do a lot in a brief time" before remembering this wasn't a Unity game!

The problems I did have: The gameplay seemed very slow (the guy didn't seem to move very quick) and the AI's behavior seemed nearly random. Sometimes the enemies couldn't seem to hit anything, sometimes they would zap me on the first try (four or five times I got sniped as I was entering through a door). Sometimes they would decide to run in circles forever instead of shooting (a couple times I had an enemy run into me and just keep running instead of try to shoot) and sometimes they'd run out of the room and not come back. Because I never figured out things like what would make enemies likely to start shooting at me or not, what would make them more or less likely to be able to hit me, even where they were aiming or their bullets were landing most of the time, or what the rules were for when the "Alarm" would restart after 30 seconds vs stopping... because of all this whether I got through any one situation felt like mostly a matter of luck. Meanwhile, since in a lot of the rooms I *could* get through just by charging through and hoping I didn't get shot, I felt like I didn't have a lot of incentive to play "correctly" vs barreling through. Some of the rooms looked like they had interesting level geometry to them that could be used to get through by stealth, but it seemed like if I tried to play that way I'd be increasing the chances a random AI behavior would kill me whereas if I just ran for the exits eventually I'd get a run where the enemy would either miss me or voluntarily run out of the room or something. Because rooms were small and saves were frequent this all wasn't really a problem for most of the game, but then I got to the last four rooms, died I lost count how many times in a row trying every variation of strategy I could think of, couldn't get through and gave up :(

I feel like, if you were willing to keep working on this a few small changes could have a really dramatic impact. I like the way you implemented a stealth game that feels like an arcade game, that seems unique (basically, I'd really like to play a version of this that had predictable enough AI to support playing it like a stealth game). One obvious thing that would help a lot is a save function. Another thing that stood out to me, the fact that sometimes enemies did run off the edge of a screen seemed to suggest the idea that it would change the game a lot if enemies could chase you in to other rooms. There was this one room that didn't seem to serve a gameplay function, but looking at it it was easy to imagine a version of the game where if you're in "alarm" mode the enemies can chase you into the next room, and then you'd need rooms like this one (full of nice big hiding places) in order to lose them.

I ran into a handful of bugs, but only one big one. Every time I saved, there was a phantom "save tile" shimmer at a seemingly random point in the roomâ�¦ in this room, the switches fire continuously, not just when you step on themâ�¦ and there seemed to be a lot of slowdown which at first happened only when there was a lot of stuff in the room but toward the end seemed to sometimes occur even in empty rooms. The one big bug: If you hit "M" while running, the dude will keep running as long as the map is showingâ�¦ andâ�¦ if the dude goes through a door in this stateâ�¦ he will fall OUT OF THE LEVEL and the game will effectively be frozen. I got halfway through the game my first time and then ran into this and had to start over..

I guess I'm posting a lot of criticism here, I do want to stress that the only reason I'm able to find so many areas for potential improvement is that the game had so much ambition! This is really incredible for an LD48 game.

Two more tiny thoughts: Sometimes I'd be running between two enemies and they'd both shoot sort of "at each other" as I was just between them, it would be funny if the guards could shoot each other. Also, the isometry means there's a lot of hard edges to the lines in this game, I would be VERY curious what this looked like with something like 2x FSAA.
OK, things I learned just now - don't use HTML on a comment on the ludum dare site - don't use ellipsis characters ^_^;
Good one (I considered doing similar game for my entry :), but there are two big problems with the gameplay:

description:
Simple maze game with a twist : you have to turn off the lights to go through colored walls ... and to turn them back on to walk on colored floor !
If a level's too hard, just hit ESCAPE.
Apologies for programmer graphics.
Made with : FlashDevelop (code), Flash CS4 (some assets), sfxr (crappy sound effects).
author: Lia
title: Light Maze
comments: Thought it didn't work at first.. whoops ad blocker's fault. Nice game though, interesting concept and could easily be built upon to make a much fuller game =)

I think you had a good concept, but there are a lot of collision bugs and you should test your levels more next time... I played through the first few and was really bored because I only had to use 1 switch to get to the exit... 90% of the map is unnecessary!

Not so much collision bugs as just crappy collisions. Didn't want to make the first levels too hard (and they're randomly generated), guess I was wrong ;) I'll probably take the time to upgrade it though.
Nice game, just a few remarks:
As said, difficulty raises too slow, but later levels get quite interesting.
Distinguishing between walls and bottom is quite difficult in some situations, maybe making the bottom a bit (more) darker would help.

description:
Run away from the dangerously upright lava tsunami!
Should be runnable in any modern browser with html5 and canvas support. Flash may be required for the sound engine.
I REALLY recommend running this in an up to date version of Google Chrome. It's the only browser I've tested it in properly and know it works.
----------------------
How to play:
A = move left
D = move right
Shift = sprint
S = duck/slide
Space = jump
Point and click to shoot!
You can destroy floating damaged blocks, double jump and propel yourself slightly with the force of your 6-shot revolver. It won't reload until all 6 shots have been fired!
----------------------
Libraries and tools used:
jQuery for javascript handiness
(http://jquery.com/)
Audiotool.com for background "music" generation
(http://www.audiotool.com/)
bfxr.net for sound effect generation
(http://www.bfxr.net/)
soundManager for better than native javascript sound support
(http://www.schillmania.com/projects/soundmanager2/)
chronolapse for timelapse screenshots and video generation
(http://keeyai.com/projects-and-releases/chronolapse/)
Photoshop for graphics!
author: Shot
title: Lava Tsunami of Doom
comments: Nice!  It was fun.  It's a lot easier if you hold shift and down constantly.
The game bugged for me big time, it didn't take my input for ~80% of the time and every now and then the graphics disappeared apart from the background.
Controls seem broken for me, couldn't get jumping over anything to work.

Really, really well-done. I didn't quite see the whole point of the gun (recoil didn't seem to help too much, maybe you were going to add enemies but didn't have enough time, which I understand given the rest) but I found great fun in shooting the lava wall when I knew my time had come. The random platform generation was quite well-done, although situations would arise that were literally impossible to pass. I loved the fact that you ran at full speed when crounching and everything, I mostly played crouched down in mid-air like some sort of hindu god, which again was quite humorous. The occasional write-ins that would appear the bottom were quite whimsical, as well. All-in-all, a quite funny game with some points unintentionally so. Good show.

There should be some penalty for holding down Shift all the time... still, decent level gen and I like the gun shooting as jumping boost thingy. Needs more sounds for audio feedback (e.g. a "click" reload sound for every bullet). A bit too floaty for my tastes too...
>There should be some penalty for holding down Shift all the time...
I feel exactly the same way. A shame this can't run on Firefox in a smooth manner =/
pro-tip: You can shoot the cracked blocks with the gun to destroy them.
Had major performance problems, also whenever I left clicked the level mysteriously vanished for a split second.
Pretty fun little platformer and very theme-appropriate. Nice work!
FYI: This didn't work in IE9 for me (but did work in Chrome).

description:
This is my first game ever.
It includes the first three themes of the compo : Escape, Self-replication and Adaptation.
I'm not a native english speaker, so, I suppose there are plenty of english mistakes. Sorry.
It should be playable on Mac with Boot Camp.
Left click to walk and interact. You also can use arrows keys to walk.
[Edit 22/08 : There are two ending (Fail/Win).
The game was made with Adventure Game Studio with the "KeyboardMovement" module, GraphicsGale and Audacity.
author: Pierrec
title: I am Ourobouros
comments: Nice game mate, even if i'm not a adventure game fan, i'm a sucker for meta stuff (you know, stuff like this: http://www.mpls.tv/2011/08/18/ive-never-meta-pizza-i-didnt-like/)

Neat game, though it could use some sound.  I'm not really sure what you're trying to say with it...it feels a little like "Every Day the Same Dream" mixed with cynicism about gamedev...Keep working on it and make it even better :)
Thank you very much for these encouragements.

As you said, I might have been inspired by everyday the same dream, a game I really love, but my main inspiration was the Adaptation movie. This is a great and quite boring movie, and I wondered if I could make a great and quite boring game. Finally, I'm not sure it's really great ^^.
Yeah, I'd like to add more sounds (there are few of them if you find the correct ending) but I'm not good at it. But I think i'm gonna work again on the project, I like it.
This is pretty cool. I think it has a strong connection to everyone participating in the competition. Congrats on making your first game ever.
Launching went to a black screen, that had a window, the contents of which were also black. Mouse didn't work. I had to mash the keyboard until I found whatever key got me out of there.

@Siebharinn : I'm sorry. A friend reported me the exact same problem and I don't know where it is from. Can you play some other AGS games ? like this one : http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/ludum-dare-21/?action=preview&uid=5587 ? My friend couldn't either...so it may come from the software...

description:
This is a platformer where you must avoid the the ever present danger of laser beams. Get to the energy shields to protect yourself, so you may somehow escape.
WSAD or Arrow Keys to move.
author: uncade
title: Frickin' Laser Beams
comments: Great job, man! I really like this stylish graphic and the sound is nice enough. I wish you luck - keep on going!
grrreat! reminds me kind of d-generation!
This is wicked. I hope you make more levels, cause I love it!

Nice work. The graphics are well done and you have the distinction of being the first entry I've played to have decent sound. The game itself is good, and I like that the mechanics are somewhat forgiving - I don't die without at least a 1 second exposure to the frickin' beams. That was well thought out.
Niice, this was addicting and pretty well balanced.  Great level design too.
nice style and music, but i'm kinda too stupid for the controls... :(
Very sharp game. Walking under iso view is cool! Cheers on using unity!
Like the game, and the concept, but those controls are just weird for me :P  Good job!
Nice and smooth, good graphical style and cool idea. well done!

I thought it was pretty fun, but honestly I found the controls really difficult, and I'm not sure why. He just wouldn't walk exactly where I wanted him to, so I felt the difficulty was entirely within getting him to do what I want and not within fast-twitchyness like it should have been. Seriously, though, great job overall. I just didn't understand the choice of control scheme.

The isometric camera makes it really hard to imagine the play space in your head. The screenshot above exemplifies that pretty well. It might seem like in that situation the player could walk to the left and end up on the platform below, but he would actually fall off the world. In that particular level it's not really a problem, but it becomes a major issue later. I think using a regular perspective camera on this might actually help the player understand the spatial relationships between platforms. Also the isometric directional controls get pretty confusing.
I had some difficulty with the controls.  I had to keep checking which key moved to where.  I guess this is the perspective view...
Nonetheless, I did have a lot of fun!
if there's one thing ludum dare has taught me, its that i need to learn unity. very nice game.

description: Everything you need to know is on the crappy page I made for it :P.
author: Elegwa
title: Foxtrot
comments: I'm not sure why the pictures have artifacts :( Sorry.
Couldn't really work out whats going out or how to score.
Awful gameplay, I can't see the traps so how do I avoid them, why should I have to bash X if I get hurt anyway, why are the flower sin perfect squares, this game is pretty damn bad, sorry to say.
I've add a more detailed description on how to play, and the point of the game. As well as what my idea for the game originally was, this is simply what I got done.
I already know it's crap, it's got some work to be done. Wish I knew how to do tile maps and stuff, would have made everything a lot easier! It's bad, but only for now.
The fun is not there yet and the nothing new with the concept. I didn't mean to bash you or anything. I'd say keep trying and be better!

I like the idea, I can see how this could have gotten a lot more to it with trying to escape from the farmer and such with more time spent on it.  Also if you are interested in learning the basics of tiles in flash, I found these tutorials really helpful when I started out http://tbg.tonypa.pri.ee/start.html
I escaped from some traps but died in the end anyways.
It's a lot like life, this game.

description:
Your fireflies have escaped! Bring them back!
Incomplete game, but I'm quite pleased with what's there...
author: Winterblood
title: Fireflies
comments: Got stuck bouncing to the bushes on the right, left to the platform. Guess the bushes, that made player character bounce, were just too wide. Got stuck walking top of the hill, because there's a smallest little overhang. Liked looks very much :)
I love the art style. It looks great! I got stuck on the bushes as well, and it's possible to jump up the cliffs on the edges of the level. xD
Great art, good luck for the full featured version =)
There's something about games which play with light that I instantly like. It's a shame you didn't get to implement the things you mentioned in the blog post.
Lovely graphics and feel. Very short but nice.
Grrrrrr getting stuck on bushes near the platform.
Really is a very pretty little thing.

A nice game, but unfortunately I guess it's more of a tech demo than a full game! I really like the graphical style, but as you admit yourself it's rather light on the content. I managed to escape from the level on both sides, too. Keep going with it, though!
Ths graphics are quite neat in their lo-fi way. I also like the firefly-idea.
Also, I fell of the level. Unity-colliders have the habit of being scaleable at very steep hills :-)
I liked the graphics, it really added to theme. The controls were also very tight, and was fun to control the guy.
It's a shame there's only one level, I would've really liked to see others.
The graphics are very nice.  The main character looks great.  I can see this would have turned out to something nice with a bit more time.
Would have been nice to see more involved in catching the fireflies, perhaps some have to be chased or something. The visuals have potential, and theres a couple of nice graphics tricks in play.

nice graphics, i always like silhouette style games. the first time i played the game i couldn't move, opened it up again and it could. i jump off the world into oblivion!!, the walls on the side of the gameplay around can be jumped up and outof play
Although I'd mostly characterize this as an impressive tech demo, it was an engaging experience, nonetheless. I was actually sad when I realised there was only three fireflies :P I want moar!
Despite the brevity and marked lack of audio this was a beautiful entry, methinks.
Nice. I think a jump up & jump down anim could add a lot. With a light content like this, You can find the escape feeling by jumping the slope and falling forever ^_^

Got stuck on the bush, same as stRana. Very nice art style, too bad that what there is can be done in about ten seconds (you could at least add "fireflies collected" message or something) and consists just from simple walking.

description:
Did not have as much time as I wanted to this weekend.  The game is lacking many features I had planned to put in.  It is at least playable.
Your submarine has sprung a leak in it's ballast.  Attempt to collect air from passing bubbles and make it to the surface.  Save your men!
Left/Right arrow keys for movement.
Up key to let air out from the ballast.
Collect air to rise, avoid the Depth Charges from above.
author: vipah
title: Escape from the Depths
comments: It was ok. Very simple, no bugs.
yep I liked it :) got to the top on second try so its a quick one
Appreciated guys.  There was much more planned (of course) but I only had half the weekend.  Next time will be *much* better.
I really liked the concept! Simple and well-executed. Seems to get easier as you progress, though.
This is pretty sweet take on the avoider-games.

Great idea for gameplay, but it would have been nice to have it be a bit longer with some varied obstacles. Sharks maybe? The graphics and sound could use some work, but they did just fine. Good entry.

description:
Can you crack the code and escape?
Controls: Mouse
Tools: Game Maker, Musagi and Bfxr
Thanks: YOU!
author: playmoderately
title: escape
comments: Liked the music. Otherwise there's not all that much to it, I guess!
How can you ever find out what the code is :S
You have to figure that out in order to escape :)
Well.. I didn't find the code, I hope I didn't miss something important ?
think about what the theme is
Nice music and use of the theme, otherwise I wouldn't call this a game.
It's actually a good puzzle. Easy enough to understand, and just enough possible answers to figure it out.
The big reveal I guess is that the numbers just go to 26 :-)

description: My first LD attempt! Thanks for checking it out!
author: disgustings
title: Epic Escape
comments: Nice game, I got surprised when the enemies started chasing me and actually received a speed boost.
Maybe you could have told an intro story or something, but it was very good (despite short) nonetheless.
Being to hard from the beginning makes it frustrating at times. Lacks story. Good start though.
Game is fun, but terribly short. A decent first entry.
cool game- i just would have liked some kind of indication how far the guards can see

Not bad for a first attempt... Otherwise not very good but I think you realize it by yourself. It would need at least few more levels. Enemies chasing you more quickly then on normal walk suprised me a bit (I underestimated you :)
Nice first LD entry - congrats! You should definitely think on extending this, adding more features, stuff like that :)
The poor pink figure was waaay behind and had plenty of grey squares between it and me. I can only assume that I escaped without it :(
Very minimalistic, easy and short. Basic concept works.

description:
This was my first LD so I'm happy to even finish!  Made with pygame.  Escape from abstract levels as a green blob. . .
You have a special ability you can use once per level to temporarily overpower the enemies.
Linux and OSX version are same as source.  If you have pygame, they should run for you.
title: Effugere
comments: Hey, the game idea/concept was pretty cool, but quick tip when distributing python (source) for Linux adding shebang line to the top of the main file would be nice.
Thanks for checking it out, puffi.  And, yeah, that's a really good point that I would have realized if I'd done a proper linux build.  I'll make an update later today for any other Linux/OSX users.
Cool idea - more levels would have been nice. :)

Thanks, and you're totally right.  I was shooting for 5 levels, but had to cut it to three.  I was actually having trouble coming up with interesting levels-I'm very much a novice designer.  Maybe some more game elements would have made more variety easier to create.
Congrats on finishing! Obviously, more levels would've been nice. I appreciated the voice instructions, since it wasn't immediately obvious what I had to do.
Ah, I'm a fan of Metal Gear Solid so I really liked the idea. I was also positively surprised by the voice instructions, however it wasn't really challenging enough :)
Voice instructions! That was a neat surprise. I would like more levels though - and maybe sharpen up the graphics a little :)

This seemed like a really teared down version of Metal Gear Solid. The 3rd level was really similar to a VR mission of aforementioned game... More levels would benefit the game. And I laughed at the end with "That isn't so hard"... Please improve this game! More levels would be enough for me :P
