This seems very interesting. I like these kind of games where you are stranded on an island. Can you give some extended instructions? I mined some ore - I am sure I should melt it somehow. Tabbing out of the game gave me a black playing field.

right... so to make some things, you have to click on the item in your inventory. for example, clicking on trees makes wood, clicking on clay makes bricks, and clicking on wood makes a crafting table.

then you can make other things by using a 3x3 crafting table, like a furnace, which is eight bricks. you can also make lamps, etc, on the table. furnaces can be used to turn sand into glass and clay into tile.
the point of the game was to mine around underground and look for the four objects that finish the spaceship. then once you click on the spaceship, you win (with my crappy win screen).

description: A maze hack and slash game made by two twelve yearolds. You wake up in a huge dark dungeon, you can only see a few feet in front you but you can tell that the floor is covered with moss and that it looks like no one has been down here for a very long time. You have to find a way out of here...
author: shard123
title: Claustrophobia
comments: Nice :) I like the fog / restricted view.
Got stuck a few times as the collision is a little bit weird.
The fog in the menu is a nice gag.
I like it! The fog is a good twist on the maze (man are there a lot of mazes in this compo) and the sword, checkpoints etc also add a lot to the standard maze formula.

Wow guys, this is impressive stuff. Some of the movement and collision was janky, but this is a quality game. Keep sharpening your skills, and move on to more serious frameworks as you get better, and you guys could be making some serious games in no time. I'm impressed.
Great presentation and Scoping (multiple levels congrats!), keep it up! I hope we see more from you on the next LD!

description:
Made using:
Coding:
Game Maker 8.1
Music and sounds:
Guitar Pro
ChordPulse
Mixcraft
Graphics:
Charas Project
Paint (Win7)
Paint.net
Plot: "Help Carol to escape from the Haunted Castle"
I didn't have enough time to create more rooms, puzzles or songs, but I'm almost satisfied with the 2.5D coding and the look and feel of the game.
The main "song" (actually a couple of chords) was made using Guitar Pro, hope you like it.
Hope you like the game too... use arrows to move and space to jump :) ... F4: fullscreen
2011-08-23 FIX: Please don't consider this for the compo, but I just realized that the characters are not centered when playing the game in a notebook with integrated GPU. The issue was that textures dimensions are not power of 2. I change it in a new version. So if you experiment the graphic issue please try the new version. (I didn't add anything just change the texture dimensions). More info in my journal
author: jfroco
title: Carol and The Haunted Castle
comments: 2.5D view is excellent, overall art and music feel is very very good. Problem is that I'm completely lost, I somehow managed to open door in the first level, but in the second... I just don't know what to do :) Some hint would be nice, I'd like to see what more is there. (Won't rate for now, will get back later)
Hello Shigor... thank you for your words. It seems that I alwasy make my game harder than it should be :( I'm glad you like the 2.5D view and the music. Best regards
I love it too! But I'm stuck too. I managed to go to the thirs "room" but I can't jump across the guards...:(

I reached the end(?), but the second level was very frustrating.  Although I love the music and the 2.5D view, the collision detection is very, very off.  Every time I though the ghost wouldn't touch me at all, I just died.  I even died midair when I was way over the ghost and it couldn't possibly touch me in any way.  I guess the collision is grid based.  So much blood everywhere...  and the scream.  That scream... oh, boy!
I rated this high, though, because I liked the atmosphere.
The gameplay itself i did not like, but the ART man the ART was AWESOME

Short but very good. Took me some time to figure out that I can jump and walk on walls. The jumping was quite tricky eith the tile-based movement. I like the lo-fi black, white and red look of the game.

description:
Light version of the game, without the installer:
http://dl.dropbox.com/u/4570720/LudumDare/Caramelo-Light.zip
Zip version source code:
http://dl.dropbox.com/u/4570720/LudumDare/LudumDareHD.zip
It's heavier because of the svn files and all the assets. I recommend to check the SVN out.
Platform: Microsoft XNA.
Type: Platform runner.
Goal: Try to escape from Deisy the Walrus.
Player: Caramelo (The last piece of candie of its kind)
Created by: Henry D. Fernandez B.
author: gokuhd
title: Caramelo
comments: Coin placement is a bit strange and lives are probably a bit too generous considering the easy difficulty. Looks nice though and was pretty fun.
Oh! thank you very much for playing. Yes, the algorithm was done very quickcly because of the time. I think I'm gonna fix that (not for the contest but to get a better experience).
Liked the style of the graphics. Game feels a bit slow and it's a bit too easy.

I think should made it harder, at the beginning I thought if it would be very hard people wouldn't like to play it but at the end maybe it was too easy. Thank you for playing and commenting :), I'll try to make a more interesting level.
I thought the difficulty was just right. I loved the look and feel of the game - just wish there was more to it. (PS: Thanks for including the light version link!)

Hey!, thank you for playing, I'm glad you like the graphics :), I'll try to do something better with levels next time, I tried to aim something very simple to achieve the goal, was not so good or innovative but kinda worked. About the light version, I know it's a pain in the ass if you have to download the game and install it, at least tried to make the process a little bit easier :).

I really dig that handmade style. Thought not particularly original, it definitely fitted your game. Cut emusic and sound effects and everything was just nice. Movement felt a bit heavy and difficult at times and your walrus looks a lot like Slowpoke ;)

The truth is, this walrus is a Slowpoke's cousin, you know ;). No, obviously I based my design on Slowpoke, just drawn it again and tried to change some features, I'm still learning how to draw and animate, it's quite hard I have to say, but... I'll try harder. Thank you so much for your post, the video and for playing my game, I'm very glad :).

description:
Robotron-inspired... avoid-em-up? Plot pretty much stolen from Smash TV :)
Put the mouse on your dude to stop, move the mouse to run toward it. Avoid the arenatrons, get the key, and get to the door!
author: ExciteMike
title: Arenatron
comments: I love killing things with the key.
it was enjoyable but those explosion sounds were really loud! kept making me jump.
Loved this game! Keep it up!
Pretty nifty. Could do with a wider field of view, since zipping around makes it really hard to avoid stuff that sometimes appears out of nowhere, due to how closely zoomed-in you are.
I still hate the missile arenatrons.  Damn you, missiles!
Beaten! This is a fun game! A little easy though but it's entertaining and addictive. Just make some more stages and other fluff. Thank you for making this!
A cool, functional, fun little dodgemup! Could do with more graphical work and variety, but it's smooth as is and all that would just be icing on the cake.
Really liked the pixelated color aberration and vignette
Original and well executed, I agree with the field of view comment. Good little game. :D
Very nice music, but the game was too simple/boring for me.
Could've done for more enemy types, the big ones just seemed like helpful meat-shield (or rather meat-walls) for the missiles. Still a great game, I love the graphics style.

description:
Made using Construct 2,photoshop for visuals with sfxr/audacity/wolfram tones for audio.
First finished project.
first time ever entered.
author: onzephyr
title: Ambrose leaves
comments: Got very confused trying to play this, wasn't sure what was going on. Worked wonderfully in the browser though.
I don't really get why he is collecting buckets of bricks and streetlight.
It's a bit too dark to doge black walls. Works fine in Chrome except for the audio.
The dark block is very hard to see. Need more contrast against the background.

A little bit uninintuitve at first, took a few deaths to learn but quite good once I did, and it looked nice. I gained bricks much faster then I lost them though, might have been cool if I had to lose bricks to get past certain areas or some such.
I got to the end, expecting an explanation of why I needed the lights and/or bricks, but none came, so I'm not quite sure whats happening here.
Really nice music.  You build a good atmosphere here, although I found the actual "pick things up" game mechanic very hard to pull off.
Not very intuitive, more like very confusing. Wanted to commend you on music, but then I noticed it's generated from wolfram tones :)
It's definitely innovative. I get that the bricks are health but never figured out how the light helps. The graphics are too dark and the black walls are very hard to make out.

Apparently nobody can scroll down and read instructions, though it would be nice if those had been included in the game itself instead of underneath it.  It seems nobody looks down there, which is good to know.
I did't find it particularly difficult or confusing at all, though.  Was a bit sad it was over so quickly, would love to see this expanded on down the line.  c:
Good music and graphics, but I'm not sure about what I was trying to accomplish. I colelcted bricks and light, but I'm not sure what to do with them.

description:
Hi! This is my first Ludum Dare entry. I'm pretty happy with how it turned out. In Abscond, you play as a serf who must feed his family and pay his lord. You're unhappy. You must construct a boat to escape from the island.
Your ending will be different based on how you complete the game.
Controls and further details are included in the game. Don't forget to vote!
Tools used:
FlashDevelop
Bitbucket/Mercurial
Paint.NET
inudge
bfxr
Audacity
Libraries used:
Flixel
Contact/follow me at:
http://harrism.com
author: Hanoran
title: Abscond
comments: When you get the wood from the tree it looks a lot like an erection. Just sayin'
The game was fun though kept me playing until I got the boat.
Couldn't quite keep playing til I got the boat, but very cool idea. Nice way of allow the player to keep involved while balance the resource management game out. Nice one!
So far the best entry I've seen.  Really addictive.  With enough polish to the sound and graphics, I'd play this on my android all day.
I too have to agree with the 'woody' comment and am awarding points to Humour as a result. Nice game :)
This game was really fun to play. I'm really impressed with how well you managed to balance in that short time!!!
Nice little game. Seems like it offers the player a few ways to play. For example, I didn't really plant anything but carrots, and I didn't see the need to get movement speed upgrades.

Fun game, fairly addictive, I liked the idea with the alternate endings, but it would be better to make the game shorter, then I would be inclined to play again to find some more endings. As it is, I feel like I've finished a marathon!
Interesting variation on Wasabi. Although it could use a bit more variation. I didn't plant anything but carrots either.
Very well done!  Intelligent, fresh, fun and interesting.

Very interesting concept, would love to see this expanded ( like with dungeons to explore and stuff). It does get a bit tedious and repetitive over time so I didn't manage to complete it. Anyways , good job!

Very nice idea, nice implementation, but I have to say I did not feel the need to play the game after two rounds of growing. I knew I could make both my family and my lord happy while cutting some wood every turn (put some rest here and there). Do I have the patience to do that the number of times needed to create the boat? No. And I can be picky because your game is complete, we are talking gameplay issues and balance here.
Full disclosure: I do not like "micro"management games :)
Anyways, good job, maybe add some variation to give more incentive to escape.

author: thirdtruck
title: A Warrior's Forest
comments: Seemed like I was only asked one question during the click through. Obviously a lot of work gone into this.
Too much text before first question/action point. Too much text before second one, didn't get that far until got frustrated and quit game. What I read was nicely written, though.

It's less of a game and more of an interactive story with 1 option. I'm afraid I can't fully appreciate the work that went into this, as I don't think I can commit to reading so much, sorry :) I see some nice images and coloring, would love more of that.
One choice? That doesn't do anything, just changes one sentence (I've checked the source)? That is all?
You were supposed to make a game you know, not write a shortstory with some quick illustrations.
Nice to see another graphical adventure entry with music. :-)

description:
The only two things in life that are guaranteed are Death and Taxes.
Can you avoid them?
Use the up, down, left, right and space buttons!
I see ive incorrectly linked the source the correct link is here
https://sites.google.com/site/jiykohost/game/AndTaxesSource.zip
You can check the modified dates, there has been no changes since the dare ended
author: Jiyko
title: ...andTaxes
comments: Nice game, but apparently your source file doesn't really contain the source.
Got an 'And Taxes has stopped working' error.  Windows 7 on netbook
"Death always goes after your love first" my kind of morbid :).  Could really use some audio though.  Otherwise, good job ^^
I incorrectly linked the Source it's on the below link, my bad. You can check the modified dates, there has been no changes since the dare ended
I wonder, is it cynical or philanthropic to suggest you love as many people as possible? :P
This, I consider a confounding question garnered from your game. Thank you.

description:
You play a guy who makes a miserable mistake an traps himself. Now he must escape this "trap".
The File is quite big, so it might take a few seconds to load.
You walk with the arrow keys and jump with the space key.
author: gufftan
title: The Trap
comments: The controls weren't quite as tight as I would have liked for a platformer... my main grievance is that holding space continues to jump, which causes some frustrating circumstances when jumping between platforms.

Overall fun, would have liked to see a bit more variation in the kind of puzzles (More use of "push button, die, respawn" mechanic perhaps to encourage experimentation more?) but the level design was overall solid and entertaining. Ending was a bit anti-climactic though :P
Feels like you were going for a portal vibe, but it felt good! It's one of the better examples of 'Escape!' I have seen; I felt like a prisoner inside the facitily.
Good job on the audio, and I had fun running through the rooms. There were a few deaths I felt were undeserved and were more of a fault on the platforming mechanics, but no big deal.
Nice little game :) Agree with FireSlash that the controls could have needed some more work since the main game mechanism is jumping and landing (hopefully). But overall pretty fun little title!

A nice little platformer! I like the sound effects and the droning background music - made it feel nicely claustrophobic. The pink laser beams were a little unforgiving in their collision detection. The jumping puzzles and level design were good, although the overall setting felt a little contrived / unexplained - why is there a secret underground lair that only contains spike pits and pools of deadly acid?! The ending was a bit abrupt, too, but I guess that's short time limits for you. Nice work! :)
I like the graphics and the idea but the game was a bit boring to me. However, you used the theme well.
Really solid platformer. Gameplay is fun, and story somewhat interesting.
What pulls it down, however, is the sometimes pixel-perfect jumping needed, the fact you NEED to die at several points (not good) and the text-messages stopping the game.
The way of follow portal was a chance, but you made it all through. Some humor, nice graphics and suitable sound.
Good fun! I actually liked the fact that some puzzles were only solvable via a respawn, it gave the game a unique gameplay mechanic, on the two occasions that I noticed it!

The graphics start out cute, but get a little messy/bland in factory (contrast, colors, variety). Some objects looks like they're platforms/foreground. Space for jump could use higher jump and less delay before high jump. Otherwise controls are pretty decent. Needs more checkpoints, I sometimes fell to death because I had no idea what's below. Sound makes a nice atmosphere.
I like the messages the facility gives you. Ending was a bit abrupt but understandable. Nice solid platformer.
Enjoyable little platformer. Good visual and audio too. Too bad the ending was a bit bland compared to the whole dialog you build.

description:
ESCAPE THE WOLF!
Run AWAY!
...but if you run too long, you get tired.
And where is that dang cabin anyway? This forest is HUGE!
---------------------------------------------------------
Created with the OHRRPGCE (although I ended up scripting almost everything)
For the Linux OHRRPGCE player, go here:
http://rpg.hamsterrepublic.com/ohrrpgce/Linux_Notes
Just use the escapewolf.rpg data file from either the Windows or the Mac zip file.
(although escapewolf.exe works in wine if you are lazy)
Game data is escapewolf.rpg
Game scripts are escapewolf.hss
author: James Paige
title: Escape the Wolf: OHR
comments: Quite well-done, and I loved the soundtrack. "dun-dundundun-duhduhuh-dundun-dedede..." You could have left a couple hints as to where the cabin was, otherwise it's essentially randonmly rompng about. Really, really, cute, though.
Some idea of where to go would have been nice.  I liked the graphical style and the mood setting music.  Good job!
Coll tune there. Would be nice with some indication to where you're supposed to go.
I love the music!  The visuals are great as well, and I really liked the way she(?) moved around the trees instead of just stopping.  Very well done.
I love how it subtely changes into action-music :-)
I loved the good ending. How the wolf tries to get red out of the house is priceless.
Very nicely done, the soundtrack is surprisingly good. Graphics are cute, but trees do get in the way, though moving around trees is nicely done.
fantastic ! I love the tune, especially the "wolf is getting closer" theme :)
Very good mood, the ambience, the music fits. The wolf comming does create a sense of urgency :).Especially when you're in a thick part of the woods and can hardly see yourself.
I never understood how to "escape" though. I tried going in 1 direction for a long time.. then I tried another direction, niether seemed to get me anywhere. It seemed neverending.

description:
'The Great Volcano Escape'
by @bluescrn, Made in under 48hrs for Ludum Dare #21
Sorry, there's no sound. (I'm currently looking for a free/cheap/lightweight
sound system that's suitable for little 2D PC projects...)
Please don't rate this game if your computer is too slow to run it! It should
run at 60fps on any reasonable gaming PC, but is unlikely to be playable on
netbooks or laptops with weak GPUs. So I've included an LD48_LowSpec.exe that
just turns off the bloom and mist layers, which might help some people.
Controls:
Arrow keys - Lean forwards/back
Z          - Accelerate
X          - Brake (yes, you'll need this)
Space      - Restart level
Goal: Get to safetly without killing yourself...
Levels
They're procedurally generated, but with fixed seeds. They get harder, and will become impossible
after a while...
The first 15 levels are definitely doable, after that... maybe not :)
Base Code Used:
The contents of code\base is my 'standard base code'. I've used it for
several Ludum Dare entries. It handles D3D/DInput setup, texture loading,
maths (vector/matrix), fonts, and drawing polygons. It also contains the
bloom effect.
Feel free to copy+paste any useful bits you might find in there...
All code in Code\LD48 and textures in \data were hacked together during the compo
Main Tools Used:
Visual Studio 2011, C++, DirectX9
Chipmunk (2D Physics engine)
Genetica (generating clouds + rock textures)
Photoshop CS5 (Drawing the bike+biker)
author: bluescrn
title: The Great Volcano Escape
comments: Great game! Btw, the Ludum Dare tools page (http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/tools/) has some good sound editors and generators.

Now this, I love graphic wise - plenty of polish and it runs buttery smooth on a 2 year old, just above average PC under wine. Plus, it really reminds me of those nostalgic bike games all over the internet- just a lot better.
great game. audio would have been a definite plus though.
I really liked this one, especially  physics-wise. Randomly generated levels are also fun, too.
Being able to set a different seed (thru some config file or so would be enough) would be a plus, as well as audio, but it's a great game anyway!
Wah, nice graphics man, and smooth game play, not very innovative though.
An addictive little game. Nice graphics. Missed some sound. Found a bug that made the end of level text stay on screen if you start the next level too quickly.
i love physics based 2d racers this was a fun one :)
Maybe not the most original, but this was really fun to play.
Did anyone else find themselves trying to see how many flips they could do while still beating levels successfully?
One bug I hit was that after beating one level and losing quickly on the next, the "safe, for now" message never went away (and it never said I lost).
Totally fell right down a pit once. I'm going back to play more now...
Nice game. It looks really nice and the physics and control of the bike feel right.

description:
This was my second Ludum Dare ever, and I have learned ALOT! I hope you enjoy my final game - it took a long, long time to complete!
TOOLS USED:
Flashpunk
Flashdevelop
GIMP 2.0
WolframTones
CONTROLS:
W, A, S, D to move
Mouse to look (not really needed)
Aim: Get out of THE COMPLEX!
P.S. If you've seen my earlier post, you'll have noticed that I had a lighting system going on. I had to ditch it because of memory problems I'm afraid. Sorry 'bout that!
author: Erifdex
title: The Complex
comments: pretty awesome, it would have been cool to have checkpoints so that you don't go all the way back when you die.

I really like this game. Its fun and addicting! One nice thing would be if the player looked like he was walking down instead of sideways when you went up or down on the map. Overall I liked this tho. I think you should continue this game and make it even better! :)
A pretty fun and challenging little game. A checkpoint after each room would probably be a good idea though.
Needs checkpoints. I like the level design, controls are also nice and smooth. I'm not sure what the point of the crosshair is though. Is this something to do with the lighting system you mentioned?
Very nice, but as mentioned, needs checkpoints.
Really liked the tips on the floor... made it a lot more fun
Not groundbreaking, but well, I had fun playing it :D Would be even better with that lighting.
Agree with the checkpoints. I ended up dying in the same spot four times. Quadruple bleh!

description:
You are trapped in an instable dimension. If you don't hurry, it will collapse and you will be lost in the vast nothingness.
Controls:
Mouse + Escape key
If it's too hard, you're just not good enough >:)
Thanks for playing :)
For those experiencing crash on startup: If you're interested to help find out whats wrong, please give me a notice on twitter (@redwatergames) or irc://irc.afternet.org/ludumdare , i'll be there as wzl or redwater\wzl. thanks, its most appreciated :D
author: RedWater\wzl
title: The Collapse
comments: I couldn't get past the level with the green bumpers, which kind of ruined it for me. I really liked the graphics of the game though!
sad to hear :( yeah the game is quite difficult at times. sometimes skill is involved, the bumpers have a bit more luck involved i guess. i had no time to balance the levels, bear with me :)
I got the same problem, I couldn't pass the green bumpers. The effect of level construction and deconstruction was awesome, and also was the music.
Great graphics, but the green bumpers level is impossible.
The music was gret. Again, good animations there and great game though
maybe try watching the gameplay video for some pointers, it took me some tries there, but its definately possible :)
good to know that the balancing is WAY off though

I couldn't get this game to work. I downloaded the one linked here and the one on your blog but I get two popup boxes. The first is blank and the second says "error". Then the game just sits on a purple screen. =[

Graphics were functional but simple, but did the job nicely. Levels were a bit too narrow and frustrating at times, but I could see where you were going with it. Some more polish and it could be promising.
Couldnt get the game working but heard the epic music so you get stars for that.
This game's challenge is "here are some walls. don't touch them. also, your controls suck. good luck"
I frustrated myself endlessly on the last level before having to give up. I suggest: Press left mouse to freeze the ball's movement. Maybe put that on a cooldown, I dunno.
Yeah you made a good point there :)
i keep tweaking the controls in the future, add more mobility features and stuff... thanks for the input :)
Didn't work in Win7 64... just heard the music :(
damn, jfroco, i hoped i fixed that. still work todo then :(

Great work, love the graphical style. The difficulty is a bit on the hard side with a sprinkle of luck. The green walls are introduced in massive amounts and make the first encounter with them frustrating. Great work on contrast. The timer bar could be more obvious though, I didn't even notice it until level 3. Controls are decent, but the ball follows the difference from centre and its impossible to tell where it is. It also moves even if i try to centre and stop it. An indicator of which way the mouse is exerting force on the ball would help somewhat.
Thanks for the input rudy. one of the problems with that is, that is is adding a constant amount (the normalized direction vector) to the player sphere. i'm going to fix this in a later version

description:
Source included in main zip.
Sound effects generated by sfxr with audacity editing
Graphics done in MS Paint
Level editor included
author: Miasmir
title: Sunrise
comments: Good concept, but the sunrise was too slow to be a menace and I was dying constantly due to slippery controls on the little platforms. Still managed to finish it :)
Thanks!  That little smile at the end is what makes it all worth it.  If the sunrise doesn't scare you you should try hard mode :)
I greatly enjoyed it, but agree that the controls become the biggest problem, and get a bit tiresome to fight against.
Everything just seemed to be a wee bit too small to see properly, but still fun.

Sigh, another platformer which is too hard for me to properly enjoy (even on easy... I must really suck, playing games for almost 30 years must have fried my brain :)... Tiny tiny tiny view without possibility to use fullscreen with dark blue over almost black just adds to confusion.
I just get an "illegal" address when I try and run the application. Please add more information on what is needed to play this so that others can give it a try :)
You will definitely get an illegal address when running the level editor if you do not set some things up properly as mentioned in the Readme.

If you're getting that error when running the actual game, it's possible that the game can't find some required files (the sounds, graphics, and level data) so please make sure to unzip everything before trying to run the game.
Aside from that... I got that error when trying to run the game in WINE in Ubuntu 10.10.  What environment are you running the game in?
Good concept. Controls were tough, but I did like the wall jumping. Bigger graphics would have helped.

description:
Wow! My first real attempt on ld48
Enjoy..
Tools: FlashDevelop4, Flixel, paint.net, photoshop
author: eralpkaraduman
title: Stuff From the Past
comments: Note: Those cave men won't attack you until you get the sword.
Luring bloodthirsty cavemen into pits was far more satisfying than hacking at them.
Heh, I liked watching those cavemen jump to their deaths. The game over taunt was neat as well. The platformer engine was a bit annoying due to the sliding and floatiness of the jump.
I really liked the moment when I grabbed the sword and all the cavemen went nuts trying to kill me.
I would love to see the other 40% :)
I totally agree that the platformer controls are bad, I wil re-write them.
@Dark Acre jack : This weekend I will make more.. better storytelling and more levels more, lost weapon, different time periods, sfx are on the way!

description:
Decided to go for a bit of parody based on the name with a corny movie reference(and then actual corn).
Spacebar/X shoots.  Arrow keys move.
You're Snake Plissken, surfing to escape from various locales!  Shoot floating barrels to drop them on enemies below or dodge them and hope they wipe out the foes behind you.
If you want, you can skip to any of the 4 levels by pressing that number while in game.  The final stage ramps up in difficulty rather steeply, but I didn't put in a victory screen for winning so you're not missing anything if you don't beat it, except glory.
author: vandriver
title: Snake Plissken: Surfin' U.S.A.
comments: i laughed, i cried, i shot a cow.
Also, I think this is the first Kurt-Russel based game here at Ludum Dare.
This was a fun game to play! Cows are life-savers.
nice little game! would be great with some dick dale-esque soundtrack. seriously playing miserlou in the background increased my enjoyment of this game tenfold. try it! great work!
oh my god, miserlou is perfect.  hahaha.  i need to figure out how to 8bit-ize that song and throw it in there.
Fun game, and pretty good game mechanics

Fun! Hit box seems a bit too large for how fast those double shots spread. I was able to finish the last level with only taking one hit though, so I can't complain. Also, level 3: wtf? Yellowstone and bears are comedy gold in Ludum Dare.
Really nice game, movement could be faster though, and make bullets or your hitbox smaller. With some music this would be one of the best games in the compo (of the 30-ish I rated at least).

Haha that was great! Feels very classic nes in terms of graphics which I love. You did a really good job keeping the game fun although wow was it hard! In terms of critiques I would suggest toning down the difficulty just a bit, beyond that awesome writing and setting.

Shame no sound or music. The graphics are amazing. Everything is so well-polished, except for the top of the wave which is too pointy. Even with that, though, this game looks like it was ripped right from an NES screen!
edsploration: that's better than even I can do. i'm impressed.

description:
You find your self in a strange room with strange objects.
Direction Keys to move, Z to Jump, X to attack and Down to Use items.
author: bmfs
title: Room Escape
comments: Really enjoyed this. Almost gave up twice, cause I didn't realize what my special abilities were in the first two sequences. Then when I did I felt dumb :)
I was frustrated at first because I had no idea how to play.   Once I understood the controls however, it was smooth sailing.
Anyways, when I finally beat the game it took me a minute to understand the application of the theme, but when I finally got it I understood the sound effects used.
Could of used a little bit more instruction wise, had to guess alot of it other then that i enjoyed it, im afraid i didn't quite follow the ending.

That being said the height of the character threw me off quite a bit when it came to jumping, also the lack of a variable jump height and the fact that you reach terminal velocity almost instantly made the movment a little disorienting for me.
Also the low res art worked for you quite well except for the trees in the second level, i honestly think they should of been a bit more detailed.

Fun game, it did take me quite awhile to figure out that pressing Z a second time did anything on the first level.. but once I did the game really took off from there. I have to agree about the instant velocity feeling too twitchy, but the game was still fun, especially once I figured out I could wall jump =)
Ok, so i think it might have broken for me - i ended up in the original room with nothing more to do...
Nice, well polished! Amazing for 48 hours, good job! Lacks some instruction at the beginning. I almost quit because i did not understand what to do.

I thought it was pretty cool how each level had a different mechanic to it. It confused me at first though, because I didn't know how the jacket worked, and I wasn't sure if the floating things were enemies or collectibles.

The ending was a bit off-putting perhaps. Not sure what happened there. Also the sound that appeared in the second level... I suppose that could be something you could leave hints about in the levels in secret places or something for replay value.

I had problem to find the jacket hability and I almost gave up. I had no sounds at all except at the second time in the the bedroom, but the sound was looping forever until the end of the game. After the three levels, back in the bedroom, I could not find what to do. I liked the ambiance of the game and the simple but efficient art.

description: Created with Flashpunk
author: surreal_whale
title: Robot Run
comments: Quite fun! I hope you spend a little more time once the compo is over to keep working on this
Interesting reverse TD. It would be nice if you could hold down the mouse button to draw the path rather than clicking many times.

I found the controls confusing.  Took a number of minutes of me clicking randomly for me to figure out how to place a path.  I didn't know that orange and blue were start and end pieces.  Maybe some instructions would help.
Nice little game. Good solid coding work for 48 hours; there are a lot of details here.
I must say though, the mechanics feel a little backward. I get money from my own robot's deaths? Why? Doesn't it cost me money to make them in the first place?

I think this has serious potentional for a proper version, you should continue developing it. It was a bit confusing at first, because the interface is so spartan. The levels also lacked much options for strategy, you just built the road and then clicked healing points until you got through. But with more interesting levels and some further development into the gameplay rules, this could turn out to be a gem.
i didnt read the bit at the start, and it was hard to work out how to place a path. some tooltips or introduction level, along with more polished graphics and this game could go places :)
Nice game. Took a while to figure out how to lay the path, and being able to add loads of health made it a bit easy.

description:
It was nerve-wrecking, and after all that I'm not sure I delivered the ending properly. Please tell me how I did!
Also, the31 was kind enough to let me put my files on his website. Thank you very much, the31!
Due to the site being whatever it was, I couldn't log my progress :(. But I DID write a huge postmortem.
author: Mikhail Rudoy
title: Real Live Avatars INC
comments: Cool that it was random, but especially on level 2 I fell in a hole and couldn't do anything until I got caught.
Also seemed to be a little buggy on the jumps and sometimes I would get a lot of x velocity.
A little bit buggy on the physics but otherwise quite a fun little game. (I did think a level where you can jump was a bit of a waste of time though, holding right is an almost perfect strategy...)
I had a few clipping errors. My biggest concern is level 2- since you can't jump you're basically just holding down the right arrow and waiting for the level to end.

pretty fun! I really question the fact that if you jump against a wall in level 1 you get sent flying backwards :) likewise in 2, it's quite random if you make it or fall into a hole and wait for the beam to catch up. finally in level 3, if I didn't accidentally find out about the wall-push I don't think I could complete it. despite these gripes, I had a good bit of fun :). level 1 was the most fun, sliding about and jumping to avoid obstacles
Very fun games. Physics were good, but control was a little thick.
The physics felt kinda random but when they worked the skiing mechanic felt great!
I got stuck on level 2. Nice game but it needs more polishing.
really stiff physics i felt, and some of the collision detection was pretty buggy... in spite of that, its still a pretty cool little game, so well done!

Clever ending :), however it seems the game's controls and physics need some fine-tuning (I got stuck on top of a ramp instead of flying off once). The second level was the one that was most fun: it was fast-paced yet not too challenging, reminded me a bit of the oldschool 2d sonic. The last level was the least entertaining; in my opinion the game works best when it has the same mechanics/setup as the second level. Overall not bad!

description:
You must escape the terrifying Rainbow Jail island.
On you way you can rescue others prisoners or use them to protect yourself.
- Move you character with the arrow keys or WASD
- Walk in single blocks to push them
- Walk in multiples blocks to destroy them
/!\ When you destroy a block, you destroy all the blocks of the same color in your area !
/!\ If you make a move in a sentry Area, you're dead meat.
If you leave the jail or achieve to collect the 16 diamonds, please post hero so I know if Rainbow Jail is actually finishable or not ^__^
( I hope it is because I lost too much time on this ending sequence... *sigh* )
author: Benjamin
title: Rainbow Jail
comments: I haven't beaten this. Dunno if that means it's impossible because I suck at puzzle games, I just wanted to say that the concept and mechanics of this one are AWESOME. The graphics and sfx are great too and everything just meshes together really well. Wonderful job!

Nice game, very fun and creative, the mechanics and the concept are very innovative and nice, and the graphics and sfx are very neat! Unfortunately I suck at puzzles, so I couldn't complete it. Anyways, great work!
The first level is quite hard and a more progressive beginning would be welcome, but when you get the trick the game turns into something really interesting and challenging.
The game looks like an arcade at first look, but in fact, it's definitely a great puzzle game!

I played it but had to beat the game due to time with only 13/16 diamonds and missing an item. I think it must be possible to get all the diamonds, but I wonder if it's possible to save all the prisoners as well.

Love this one, although it took me a little while off the bat to figure out what was happening. I'm also not so sure about the dark rooms, feels to be working against the games greatest strength. Other than that I love the game, characters and animations are awesome, and it's really cool that it is an adventure / puzzle.
Really really cool, but extremely hard. Get's a bit tedious after failing a few times.
The first level was a very good introduction to the concept. The rest made me feel stupid. I just couldn't thing enough steps in advance to avoid getting screwed.
Fantastic game. Its rare that you see a tile based puzzler that seems to be something new. Nice idea and expertly executed. Good job.
That's a great game I've played for fun, yesterday.
Pick Axe (Not necessary, but that's cool !)
You don't need to save all the prisoners ... They are used like ... shields ... Three of them must die to finish the game.
And ... Sorry, I didn't get all the diamonds ...
(I wish I'll take a printscreen, next time ...)
Nice idea and concept and execution! Really top notch!
But it really is too hard, from the beginning. (Or it isn't too hard but just "too much" - try to reduce the amount of blocks in the first levels, that should help.)
Gorgeous, fun game! Very well done.
Brilliant idea with wonderful attention to detail. Outstanding work on design, implementation and polish. Sound a bit weak, though, in an otherwise incredible effort.
This was definitely a solid gem to play and probably a top runner for the competition. Needing to both push and break blocks in proper order was an amazing mechanic.
First of all, let me say this is an amazing game.

But I encountered a weird bug that crashed it.  I was walking around with a prisoner in-tow, and he walked on top of a solitary block.  Well, I needed to push that block, and when I did my character and the prisoner we on the same tile.  The game didn't like that very much and froze.
Very nice game! Can't believe I just spent an hour playing this...
This is great!  Love the thought that went into the level design.
Nice work! Graphics are cool, gameplay is punchy, and effects fit.
This is, however, badly in need of some balancing. You spend a lot of time failing and trying to figure out what to do.

top notch, a very compelling and fun game. Really well done and feels very polished. One of the best so far, I liked how hard it was, failing a lot was ok because of the check points, with out them it would be unplayable. High scores all round.

This game is great! I agree with the previous comment that tension between destroying blocks and saving them to be pushed is great. The large levels are fun. It would be nice to have some instructions about goals and how the other prisoners work, but I figured it out pretty quickly. Great game! 5 stars!
Like the art style and love the idea, main character is funny. It's a puzzle game though and nor central to the theme. Would really love an undo button.
Great game. Quite challenging but really well designed.. Cheers!
This might be my favorite game of the compo.  I'd buy it if it were a mobile game.
Difficult, but really cool. Love the graphics, animations, the style and the gameplay mechanic! Brilliant stuff!

description:
Qua-tzar is a simultaneous turn based multiplayer game. The object of the game is to get your BITs to your spaceship on the other side of the game board. Each player has three action points to use on movement during their turn. Once both players have input their commands both sets of commands happen simultaneously.
Do not look at the screen when your opponent is entering their commands. Try to predict where your opponent's pieces will move to block and capture them.
author: tzar
title: Qua
comments: Kinda hard to test the gameplay without someone close to test the hot seat multiplayer :(
And undo for your move would be very welcome.
Interesting concept, though undo would indeed be welcome. Feature request: implement a friend. *sheds a tear*
Tried it with a friend, found severall bugs:
whe a TZAR steps on a field, a BIT just left, it still captures the BIT (sometimes).
BITs and TZAR can travel through each other at a border between two fields.
Interesting concept, though. Some thoughts for improvement:
I would probably have given each player 4 or 5 points and limited the movement of each token.
You should consider to forbid DOMs to step on the field right in front of the door instead of turning collision off, it looks like BITs just vanish, but they are still there.

description:
My first finished game ever. I had a bit of trouble getting the theme 'escape' into the game after my original idea didn't work out so well.
The game itself is not that easy, there is stuff that trys to kill you everywhere, so watch out!
author: JH
title: Protoscape
comments: I liked the idea, is pretty cool, but i did not played it for too long because it was kind of hard from the beginning.

If a wait a little longer than usual, when i grab the gun it does not display any message and i have to guess how to shoot. The ship's movement should have more friction, otherwise the development of the game is slow and does not give any sense of control over the character. That is my critic. Otherwise, great game! Music could engage a little more to play.

Not bad, asteroids in the maze style game, but it quickly became too annoying - unless you really try to blaze through the maze you'll get killed by the closing doors. After few dozens of  attempts I gave up.
Y and Z. Brilliant. Why can't all devs do this.

description: I did it with lazarus (thanks notch ;) )
author: skyazid
title: Mini PacMan
comments: It's a great achievement to finish a game in the time, but I do think you could have stretched yourself a bit more with the originality.. I mean, it's pacman but with less going on :P. and it's a closed maze you can't escape from!
It would have been nice if you added something a bit different to the game, but great job finishing!
This game sucks, you suck and Notch sucks.
Oh! I forgot something, I rock!!! :D

description:
COMMENTS ARE BROKEN ON THIS PAGE (off and on).
If you can't leave a comment here, you can leave a comment on my blog at http://stozstudios.blogspot.com/2011/08/goat-milk.html.
Many weeks ago, the Dow Jones Industrial Average suddenly plunged by 500 points. Jerry the dairy farmer's retirement savings were destroyed, and he went into a profit-driven frenzy to recoup the loss. Searching for new sources of milk, Farmer Jerry turned to the nearest thing he could find: Barry the mountain goat.
You play as Barry. Your goal: don't get milked!
All this running from Farmer Jerry makes you tired, though, so you must make the occasional stop to eat grass, goatberries, and coffee beans, all while avoiding bottomless pits, mud holes, tumbling boulders, high winds, and burning hot magma.
Goat Milk features six action-packed levels of Goatberry-munching glory.
Music generated at http://www.earslap.com/projectslab/otomata
Sounds made by voice and sfxr.
Created with Game Maker. Graphics and animations created using Inkscape.
SETUP:
Windows only. The zipped folder contains a .exe file. Extract the .exe file into its own folder -- this is where it will store your saved progress. Double-click the .exe file to begin! Controls are explained on the menu screen.
author: stoz
title: Goat Milk
comments: I love the interactive menu and the animation when you eat. Very well done
Awesome job! Good amount of polish in this one and a fun story line. Good graphics & audio as well.
Nice polish on this one and funny story.  I was scared as hell of the old man.  I didn't get very far though, got stuck on Level 2 after trying several times.
I really loved this game! It has humor and very polished graphics.
The combination of the sound effects, the background music and the fact that our playable character is an adorable goat who cries when you lose made my day.

Can't Play. It told me "No sound device detected. Sounds might not play." in an infinite loop. I see this message from time to time (and sounds always do play) but never see it in a loop like that :(.
Nice, an awesome platformer, with a nice difficulty/new mechanics curve.
Plus, funny. Especially loved the farmer's audio!
Funny, eye and ear pleasing, but maybe a wee bit too hard.
Reached level 5. Simple, yet fun game with some strategy. If you planned your jumps you could reach the end faster and so on.
The "music" was truly horrendous though :). And the sounds the farmer made when he was getting closed creeped me out.
Actually the music was sort of ambivalent enough to enhance the already somewhat inappropriate theme. I liked it ;)

description:
This piece was heavily influenced by PSTW Action RPG.
Win .exe and source zipped together. You might need to click the flash before it receives keyboard input, when viewing in the browser.
author: makc
title: Escape Adventure
comments: Using only the Escape key was a brilliant idea !
Of course, this mean no challenge at all, but nice game, Very funny when you use the red key in heaven ^^
This game is really too hard.
Awesome.  I just barely made the jump though!
Got to be honest, I struggled with this one...
Nice idea! Not enough challenge but it's a fun experience anyway!
Awesome :)  Just awesome!  I love one-button games, and this Escape take on it works really well :D
I like the pun on ESC as well as the different challenges and animations. Well done!
Haha, that was awesome. I laughed, I cried (at level 5... but not really). Awesome.
As mentioned before simple but funny :)
I liked the last two levels, especially the ending. The others could have been shortened a bit. The PSTW influence was nice.
A very nice game! Simple but funny! Awesome execution!
Pretty hilarious. Was it inspired by this? -> http://www.newgrounds.com/portal/view/495903
Quite funny actually, not just the same escape pun. It's not really a game though, more of an animation.
heh actually got stuck on the jumping bit. fun little distraction!
Ok, there was one place where there I had to do something resembling game... otherwise it might have just been animation...

description:
So this was a bit of a pain to put together. At least more than I thought it would be.
You play Stubbs, who has to escape from a tower slowly filling with water. There... really isn't any backstory to this. JUST MAKE BELIEVE. Ride the water upwards and try to avoid the platforms. If you hit one, catch up with the water or make it to an exit before Stubbs' tiny little lungs run out of air!
Arrow keys to move above, on and below water.
It was put together in AS3 using Flashpunk (if I'd had more time and not been about to fall asleep on my keyboard, I'd have included the flashpunk splash page). I used GraphicsGale for pixel art, Ableton Live 8 for music, OgmoEditor for maps.
I don't really know how fun it is to play. I'm really just glad that I managed to get it finished!
NOTE: There is a bug where once you reach the top of the level, you can't swim below the top half of the screen. Because of that you won't be able to get to a couple of the exits (the map sections switch around when the map is loaded, so you might not come across this problem). There's a bugfix version that I've linked to where this is fixed, but the competition version comes with the bug.
author: oatsbarley
title: Damn My Stubby Little Legs
comments: I've played through a few times and there are surprisingly few bugs for something that I finished coding just 40 minutes before the deadline. There is one issue with the map though, where one of the sections physically won't let you get to the exit.
Also I really probably should have added some sort of instruction or something as to what you're supposed to do, although it's kind of obvious after your first playthrough.

Oh and this can get ridiculously hard (perhaps sometimes impossible?) so if I was to put some real time into this I'd take a look at tweaking various things to make it a bit less punishing. Although I find that part of the fun is pushing to the last second of the breath meter and finally popping out of the water or reaching the exit.
I'm going to write a journal entry on how things went for me, so check it out there.
I spent countless attempts trying to dodge the notoriously evil blocks. Once you're just a dozen pixels under the water it's almost impossible to catch up.
As you noted yourself, though, it's very polished, the minimalist soundscape and slick graphics creating the essential focus of the game.
I like it! Well done little game!
Thank you both for your comments and for trying out my game!
Good game! I only miss a way of storing my hi-score =( Port this to the iOS or Android, and start making some pocket money =P
Oh, this is very cool. I like how the gameplay concept is much deeper than it looks at first. Music is very good.
You might want to upload somewhere a version without the exit bug, I hit it on my first serious playthrough and it lead me to suspect the game was just unwinnable (hey, Ludum Dare, you never know).

You actually seriously might want to consider this an iOS/Android port, it seems amenable to touch/tilt controls and this is the kind of game (randomly generated arcade game with simple controls) that gets rewarded there. I feel like in that case it would help if some kind of metagame to encourage you to keep playing multiple times-- like, maybe you have a global score on total distance traveled, or % of games which you won, or maybe each time you got to the exit it would send you to a new "tower" and your "score" was how many towers you made it through before you lost. An approach like that might that might turn what seems like the one downside of the game currently (ie that the distance before you hit the exit is random) into something like a bonus.
Interesting take on the endless vertical jumping genre. The music is very nice too.
Too bad that you didn't show the score at game over screen. I believe it's mandatory for this kind of game.

description:
Close your eyes so that nothing can get you.
Move using arrows or WASD. Close eyes with X or K.
Made using:
Flashpunk
swfmill
Pain.NET
GarageBand iPad
author: Coriander
title: Close Your Eyes
comments: I like how the monsters are mini-platforms, not always hazards. I wish I knew how / where / when monsters spawned though, which could allow for better level design and more intricate strategies.

I actually ran through the whole thing and finished it before I realised there was the eye-closing mechanic that I should have been using. It wasn't really necessary, but if it had been then I would have found this a lot more challenging!

I really liked to concept! However, I didn't find the eye closing thing very necessary to use either. Maybe if they hurt you when you hit them it would be a bit better, It'd be more important to close your eyes often then. Nice game overall though :)
Nice concept.  Unfortunately the game mechanics are not polished enough to make it effective.
I also thought the monsters would kill me with my eyes open, and was disappointed to find out they only block me and don't eat me alive.  You know, like the Ravenous Bugblatter Beast of Traal. :)
Awesome concept, i loved how eyes closed and opened both had their advantages and drawbacks.
Maybe it's just my crappy platforming skills, but i fell down a lot... might be good to look at tightening up the controls a bit?
Also, there were a few times when the level design made it so i had to take a blind leap. to find the next ledge.
Good graphics and controls, but it was way too short.

description:
You're trapped in a hostile world, with only one way out: find the eight cerulean circles.
Instructions:
Download the zip file and extract it. Run ld21_localcoder.exe and read the instructions on-screen.
Tools used:
Java + Slick (+ LWJGL) + Eclipse
Paint.NET
Cerulean is [inspired by\a clone of] Meritous by Lancer-X/ASCEAI.
author: localcoder
title: Cerulean
comments: I'm having trouble launching the game. I click the exe and nothing happens.
Hi ToxicLogic, I fixed it - please try again :)
I was using a library that only supported 32-bit java. I have replaced it with a newer version which supports 32-bit and 64-bit java.
Must explore ALL the rooms. I did stop at around 220 though. It became too easy when I figured out you can stop in the door charge your weapons and kill a whole room, but otherwise It was fun.

Wow, for the simplicity of the game and mechanics I got a surprisingly good gaming experience out of that. The gameplay was captivating, even if it was so simple - I'm an explorer, I guess ;) And the post-disc-collection events were surprising and incredibly satisfactory :) Well done!

Thanks for getting it fixed... it ran fine. A fun little game - I enjoy exploration as well, so pushed through to 200 or so rooms. (Then cheated and checked your source to see if there was actually an escape or end game condition. Haha.)

Egads! 908 rooms!? The combat quickly degraded into just holding space in every doorway. I played until I got 4 of the circles but at that point it was getting too repetitive. Having such a huge space to explore is pretty cool though. With some more variety in room appearance, enemy behavior, and maybe weapons this could be pretty compelling!
Oh you guys, the game is much more fun if you don't hide in the doorways! Live a little!
(I was supposed to give the shots a little explosion radius, so the doorways weren't safe, but I never got around to it :/ )
When I first looked at the rooms I was kind of amazed, but I found the gameplay just a bit repetitive. If there were more items that would help you, it would be better :)
That was very very repetitive and at the end very boring... I got to 700 rooms and I didn't find the exit :'(

description:
Caved In was inspired by Minecraft, Terraria, Dwarf Fortress, and dungeon crawlers. The goal of the game is to ascend all five levels to the surface. Along the way you can collect treasures and save a few stranded ladies. Lava and water flow to fill gaps and will kill you if you stay in them too long. Full instructions in-game.
As regards to everyone have problems with walls:
You must hold either SHIFT or Z and then press UP/DOWN/LEFT/RIGHT or W/A/S/D for the respective direction. If you have 2 or more bricks (which are gained from mining stone blocks) a wall will be created. You can't create a wall if you are too close to another object. Hope that helps. =]
author: alexlarioza
title: Caved In
comments: Got 528! Kinda cute game. Length and complexity suitable for a compo.
The limited visibility and the expanding water and lava make this very interesting. But I eventualy got frustrated when I could not find the exit ladder.

I unfortunately can't tell you where to find it as it's randomly generated each time. =P But I'll give you a hint; each level is divided in thirds length-wise so that the player spawn, the woman, and the ladder occupy a random spot in their own third of the level. So if you spawn on the right, the ladder/woman is either in the middle or left of the level. Hope that helps with any frustrations. =] I wanted to add some kind of tool/indicator for finding the ladder but didn't have time (or an idea of what) to implement it.
You lost points because you collected "women".  You could have said "victims" or "miners".
I like the sense of tension when you hear the explosions. You know there's a river of death somewhere, but you don't know where/when it's going to get you.
Solid effort, enjoyed it a lot, played it a few times. This is definitely one of my favs.

This is a pretty solid game, there are a lot of elements to it considering how quickly it was made. Only thing I didn't quite get was how building walls worked - actually got stuck in one and then I died :(
@SusanTheCat My girlfriend wanted to be worked into the game some how and that was my way of doing so. xD
@kato9 There are still some bugs with making walls, I thought I had them all fixed but I guess not. =[

It was fun and I liked it, although I think it would've been better if instead of score the items just helped you find the exit. Something like gems and gold tell you a few places where the exit isn't (uncover random tiles) and maybe the woman could point in the exits direction. This might just be my personal dislike for score speaking though.
I love this!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! So charming, a tiny rogue-ish romp through a cave that I honestly don't want to leave.
Nice little game. Love digging around.
I think it could've really benefited from some sort of increasing difficulty as I found it quite hard to even get past stage 1 without any hints! :)
Overall: An amazing little title with some pretty creative elements.

I really like this game - love the graphical style, and it's a fun, quick play. My only problem is I've still not managed to build a wall (just doesn't seem to work!), which has meant each of my play sessions has been fairly short if a cave-in sets off lava or water!
Hmm, did just build some walls, but it seemed random when it worked and when it didn't! Got to level 3 that time, and I want to keep playing :)
As regards to everyone have problems with walls:

You must hold either SHIFT or Z and then press UP/DOWN/LEFT/RIGHT or W/A/S/D for the respective direction. If you have 2 or more bricks (which are gained from mining stone blocks) a wall will be created. You can't create a wall if you are too close to another object. Hope that helps. =]
I though it was fun. Very polished, nice pixel graphics and good sounds. I enjoyed tunneling, building walls, collecting gold, etc.

I hit a weird bug a few times where I was paralyzed and couldn't move. Also, I don't think having "women" be game objects that you collect is a great idea. Finally, it would be nice to use lighter colors for areas that the player has been to. Sometimes I had a hard time figuring out the path that water/lava would take.
There's quite a bit to this game and all the gameplay elements work pretty nicely together. This is definitely one of the best I've played so far.
One bug: Not sure how I got into this state, but at one point I couldn't move. I could dig out the walls around me and put down walls, but I couldn't move out of the space I was one.

description: Escape the sea.
author: morganquirk
title: Brine
comments: Pretty good. Love the presentation and gameplay, and the animations are great.
The embed code isn't working in Opera, by the way. You should look into that.
Love the graphics. "hide" seems a bit ambiguous at times, and the pickups aren't explained at all as far as I got. (What do I do with the cells/missiles?)
This was really good.  The water effects and environment are pretty excellent.
The hiding mechanics were a bit inscrutable, and it would have been better if they were more obvious, but in ways the lack of clarity did add to the tension.
The scattered but obviously meaningless pickups annoyed me, though the end game payoff did lessen my annoyance at that considerably.

A well formed game with good graphics and nice gameplay. Although, the problem laid in where and how to hide. It wa snot clear that there was a "boss-fight" in the end, but when getting those weapons and be able to fire it at the "fish" gave hope of such a thing.
You should look into the html code as tim.swf is not deep.swf.
Good visuals and atmosphere. I felt a bit uneasy in there, maybe that was the point? A bit monotonous at times too, but overall pretty cool. :)
The hide mechanic killed this for me. I really want to like this but dying for what felt like arbitrary reasons made this too tough to like.
I appreciate all the feedback about the hide mechanic. I'm having trouble deciding what the right solution is, but I'm confident that the wrong answer is a hiding indicator.

description:
Escape from Professor Kitty von Doom's
Laboratory of Bounce-onium!
The concept I came up with was "reverse pinball" where YOU ARE THE BALL and you are trying to "escape" through the bottom of the playfield.  In the game, you star as a lowly laboratory mouse who wants to escape the clutches of the evil Professor Kitty von Doom.
The professor has invented a top secret formula called Bounce-onium that he has given to the mouse in his lab which makes any animal able to bounce like a ball! Using his new powers, the mouse decides to make an escape attempt.
Use the arrow keys (or A and D) to give the "mouse" (ball) some English - like tilting the table.  Try to grab the red security key-card and then touch the red door labelled "authorized staff only" to make a break for it!
Programmed using HTML5 in javascript. Uses box2dweb and soundmanager2. Sound effects created by BSFXR. All art was drawn by hand using paper and markers, scanned and tinted in Photoshop.
This game runs at 480x800 resolution because it is designed to work on smartphones.  It runs wonderfully on my Android HTC Desire Z phone, for example.  If you have a non-HD (low resolution) monitor it will be too big to fit.  For example, it definitely won't fit on older netbook screens which only have 600 pixels of height.  I hope to make a smaller version for the people who still have low def screens.  Might just produce a half-size version.
Currently does not work in IE.  What a huge surprise.  Try Chrome, or pretty much anything other than IE.
If anyone cares to test the game on their phone I'd be most grateful to hear whether it works.  Thanks!
author: onium!
title: Bounce
comments: That's a sweet idea. I also like the presentation (although the difficulty ramps up very quickly)
Cool concept! The only thing I didn't like I was the lack of difficulty. Maybe Prof. Von Doom could shoot things to prevent the mouse from escaping, as you progress?
Also after a while it seems to be playing the same map level over again, in which case I gave up. It could be a bug, but it could also be showing how the mouse's escape attempt is futile :p
BUT THIS GAME IS WINNING ITSELF WITHOU ME PARTICIPATING
You've either taken casual gaming to next level or something went terribly wrong. Also, from lvl 4 or 5, there's one level in a loop, at least up to level 13 or so.
My laptop screen isn't big enough to play this in its default resolution, but I found that I was able to zoom out and make it playable. :)
I like the artwork and sound effects, but have to echo the other comments about it being a bit too easy.  Enemies or some other way to lose (like spikes on the walls) would be a nice touch.
I wish i could give you a community +6 rating mate :-)

About the game: Good concept, you only need to polish the art assets, and maybe get some level designers to help you (it's somewhat bizarre that Mathias thinks it's too hard, and others think that it's too easy, myself being on the second camp)
Love the idea, but it was kind of boring. Would also be easier if the bouncing didn't have so much delay sometimes...
I almost couldn't play for not having enough vertical height in my monitor, but the chrome fullscreen saved the day.
Have I told you I want more levels?

Levels were pretty easy, but the idea is oddly compelling. I played until the one level started looping.  It took me several levels for me to realize I was playing the same one over and over again. lol!
The weirdest pinball game I think I have ever seen. For that you should be very proud!
Haha, bring me back memories of when I played Sonic Spinball on Genesis! Lovely game, albeit rather easy for my tastes. Well done!
Loved the art work, just wish the swf wasn't so tall! =[
Great concept and interesting level design.
Great concept, good fun. Could use some extra hazards or multiple keycards to add variety later on. Nice job!
Thanks for all the kind words, people!  There is a new post-compo version with over 25 levels, along with far better level design including: SPIKES! LAVA! LASERS!

The game is actually an Android app and runs really smoothly on my HTC Desire Z (and this is why it is so big: the resolution of my phone is 480x800).  I'm planning tomake a smaller version for people without HD monitors.  I'll be posting version 1.1 by the end of the week - finally it will be a more fully fleshed out game as this compo editing is admittedly rather sparse with only 5 levels.
Not much depth here - was fun up to I think level 5,  beyond which all levels are the same. Is missing something, probably a failure condition.

Nice job! I actually like the bite-sized levels, and I could definitely see people playing a couple at a time on their phone as they're waiting in line, on the bus, etc. As people have said, it would be even better if it had enemies/traps/danger to avoid or destroy, but you probably already knew that!

description:
Overview:
You've accidentally started a chain reaction that may destroy the entire universe.
You've got to go warn everyone of your mistake!
Your ship's booster's aren't enough to outrun the explosive reaction you've caused.  Use different planets' gravities to slingshot yourself faster to outrun the reaction you're responsible for.  Crashing into space debris will slow you down, and may allow the supernova to catch up with you!
Instructions:
Press Right or Left to control your ship.
Press Down to brake.
Fly into blue planets to increase your speed.
Crashing into red debris slows you down.
Increase your speed enough to move to the next level and warn your compatriots!
author: =Solar Escape=
comments: Me likey! Made me want to smash up my keyboard a little bit though :) - couldn't get up to escape velocity (is it possible??)
Fun game! I'm reasonably certain it's impossible to win though...
Really enjoyed the quick play, 31k distance. Bit short lived but a very cool concept - I wonder if it could be expanded into something more. It could certainly be a mobile game,
The red asteroids are difficult to spot at higher speeds, to the point of making the game frustrating. Hitting planets for speed was also fairly counter intuitive at first.
I like the slingshot effect (though at first I was worried I would be atmo braking).  agree that the asteroids are hard to avoid at high speeds- maybe some indicators before they arrive?
cute graphics. the victory condition is kind of interesting, it provides a natural difficulty curve. it is too hard to win or lose though.
Ha! this reminds me of www.kongregate.com/games/FreakyZoid/run-from-the-sun but in a more simplified control way.

I like the natural difficulty of the planets getting harder to hit the faster you are, but man does it get really really hard up there toward esc velocity. maybe increase the rate of earths as the velocity goes higher?
I beat this game fifty times.
It's a nice concept, but too pale imho. And I couldn't win =(
The way the objects teleport onto the screen rather than scroll into it is rather annoying.

Fun to play, good match with the theme of the competition.  You may want to be careful about the asteroid placement though - they are very often right on top of the planets, which makes it feel like there is no way to win.  Early warning systems (or blue planet indicators) would help a lot.
54710, yeah! Fun to play, but I'd really like to see someone beat the level, as I'm quite certain it's impossible. :]
Also, the source link is broken. Should be (ha! the power of deduction):

description: Can you escape through the trenches?
author: MaskedPixel
title: Trenches
comments: Nice! The controls feel good, and it's quite difficult. I like it. I don't know if there's an ending (got through those tunnels at some point, but didn't get further).

My only criticism is that you can't go back to the main menu. You're forced to restart the game to change difficulty level. An indication of how far you are or have gotten (score, percentage traveled, whatever) would be nice to have as well.
I agree with Frib! Great controls on a really tough little platformer. I really like the vertical wrapping feature you introduce on level 2.
I am glad you all liked the game :)  Good looking out on the feedback too.  It didn't even occur to me to make a way to get back to the menu(I just refreshed ha!).

The movement was slick and felt great! It was too hard for me too get past level 2 even after a bunch of tries, but it felt like that was my problem and not the games problem, so thats alright. I would say make it more obvious that I can double jump, because it became a lot easier and more enjoyable once I realised. I know you sya so in the instructions but I just sort of forgot when I got in game.

Not bad! Solid mechanics, simple gameplay, nice audio. The initial moment was slightly frustrating as I tried to use the arrow keys, not WASD, which didn't work and I'd immediately die. A bit more explanation on controls would benefit this game. Well done though :)
Controls do feel pretty good :) Did not manage to pass first level so far, will return to it later I guess.

description:
You're trapped in some kind of endless corridor, with two hooks and lava chasing you. Best story ever, right?
Try to escape the advancing lava with your hooks and swing around obstacles in your way, as the wave gets faster and faster, until just a single mistake seals your fate as you are engulfed in the hot doom.
Think you got a good score? Submit it to the online highscores and compete with all the players!
In-Game Controls:
A/Left - Fire black hook
D/Right - Fire blue hook
The hooks are fired at your mouse cursor. They only stick to the black walls!
K - Suicide (improved version only)
author: Superyoshi
title: The Hooks, the Lava and Me
comments: Oooh this is a nice game! Sounds, music and everything!
Amazing, just amazing. Best LD game I've played yet.
Um, whats going on here then?
Great work! The most fun LD game I've tried so far.

It's quite a good entry. Too bad I got stuck at one moment in a blue rectangle, but this was a little my fault (I drove myself into it in such a way that firing hooks seemed impossible). Good game though.
really good stuff, nice mechanic and well executed. Lots of fun.
Really liked the concept, I think the first escape could have been a bit easier/clearer to help with getting players into the game.
Had to take some shots in the dark to walls I couldn't see but  that only added to the excitement.
The title at the top of the web page says LD #20 :)
Quite a fun game. Rather addictive. I also got stuck in the corner of a rectangle (and couldn't do anything anymore).
Fun concept, really liked it! The highscore submission seems to be broken... =/

description:
The game is made in flash so it will run in your browser. There are alot of stuff on the screen so it might lag a bit. Enjoy the game!
There are about 4 playable levels, but currently the game has no proper ending. The background will simply go black after the meteor rain. You'll know what im talking about.
author: klobb
title: The great escape of Dr. Diabito!
comments: I like the Asteroids-style + mouse aim controls, but the game itself seems winnable by simply going slow and waiting for missiles to recharge.  I had fun trying to go as fast as I could, but it would be nice if you could force the player to do that.  A wall of fire, while generic, might do the trick.  He is running from an exploding earth, after all.

em, i got to 'open space' and some fire rained down from the sky, then the background went black and I kept flying. Did I escape? what about his wife and kids?? PS I gave you an extra community point 'cos your name is great. hope you never get in a fight with someone called RCP90
TyrusPeace: I was planning on making a wall of fire(resembling the shock-wave of the earth exploding) but ran out of time before i could set my plans to work. :(

RichMakeGame: Yeah... About that... As i mentioned earlier i sort of ran out of time before i could make a proper ending. At one point in time the fire rain would kill you and that would be the end, but i restricted the comets from killing you since they were suck a pain while playing. Ty for the community point! Who is RCP90 btw? :S

description:
Controls:
A - run left
D - run right
Space - jump
Menu Controls
W - Up
S - Down
Enter - Select
You've fallen down a hole, you need to get yourself out. Nothing like What I'd originally intended to make, hopefully it'll provide some fun. Good luck using the 'weapon'.
Discovered that the finish condition isn't working properly in the build... If you escape, just assume the game congratulates you... Otherwise you can jump in to nothingness if you like.
author: Dezzles
title: The Escape
comments: Great fun!  Toughest I've played so far (maybe it's because I am not very good at jumpy stuff :) )
No, it's not just you... As the game stands in the LD release the game is quite difficult...
Sliding after landing combined with tiny platforms made this more difficult than it needed to be, but the swinging sword(?) mechanic was pretty cool.
Yeap swinging sword :D. I've been trying to fix the sliding after landing but box2D doesn't seem to want to let me do that without allowing wall jumping

description:
(this paragraph relates to 8/21/11) I was only aware of this particular dare about 18 hours ago, if that. I started working on it at about noon, with some barebones things done in the morning. I personally found it fun to make, although I assure my next submissions will have more time spent on them.
So pretty much, your city's about to be nuked or something of the sorts, and logically it'd be best suited to high-tail it out of there. Of course, nothing's stopping you from grabbing some loot along the way - call it reparations, cash it in for your troubles. A non-linear goal of simply "get outside the city" and plenty of different ways to interact with the game world allow for all sorts of different solutions, not just one. For example, you can:
-Drive a tank through a strip-mall
-Assassinate a general and raid his military base
-Rob a bank using mines
And so forth and so on. Source is included in the zip, and I even put an .mp3 of the soundtrack in case someone finds it catchy.
Have fun!
author: panzermancer
title: Siren's Wail
comments: Even with the simple graphics, this game was still quite fun. I spent at least 20 minutes playing this game!
Nice game! The only thing I don't really like is that in the narrow corridors, it can be too easy to get hit by a bullet.
Nice! There's definitely a lot of mazes in this LD, but this one actually has stuff to find!

description:
It's a game about trying to escape routine and dodge responsabilities in order to find and define yourself.
You must swim into space, away from your numb room.
Your body must avoid your mind, and both must avoid obstacles.
ARROWS or WASD to move the player. SPACE to tug on the player's head/brain.
It can be a bit frustrating at first, but it's a short game, easy to grasp mechanics and winnable in a bunch of tries.
Thanks for playing!!
-MartiÂ­n
----------- Development ----------
The world is procedurally generated, but it's always the same. It can be won (at around distance 3000).
Tools/SDK used: Flixel 2.34, GraphicsGale, Audacity, FlashDevelop, Flex 4.0.0.14159
The (lame) "music" was recorded hitting the notebook and desktop with my hands for the beats, and with a Yamaha PSR-200 crappy keyboard. Grunts are me grunting. Clinks are a lighter hitting an ashtray.
Everything recorded with the notebook's internal microphone recorded and tweaked with audacity.
----------- Foods & drinks ----------
Day 1
Drinks: 2 liters of beer, Fernet w/Coke, Mate
Foods: Caprese-flavoured baked bread snacks, sauted beans w/paprika, instant pea soup, crackers w/cream cheese.
Day 2
Drinks: Mate, Coke, Ginger Lemonade w/crushed ice.
Foods: Quinoa w/tomatoes.
author: nitram_cero
title: Routine
comments: Ya lo habia jugado antes y habia llegado a los 11000 y no ganaba mas jaj! Muy bueno che, jodidisimo comome gustan a mi .Estaria que no tenga un limite y se guarden los scores en la pagina para ver quien llegomaslejor,pero bue.. pido mucho. Saludos y jugate al mio! (A memory)
maxx, I thought of that: least time scores (my best time was 10.22 seconds). Also an "infinite" mode (score = most distance) once you beat it normally.
Nice little game concept. Enjoyed pulling my head around space :)
It can be a little hard to control at times which can make it pretty unpredictable and more random than it's actually about being good.
It was challenging, but the 10-15 mins I spent on it flew by! Great job!
