I only realized that this wasn't super obvious after the compo - oops. (And depending on which screen it is, there's almost always a point, and it always involves gold...) Thanks for covering me in your video :)
Fell through the scenery at one point and the game crashed. Innovative, fun idea.

description:
Esc Ape is a game where you need to help your fellow monkeys escape, using a primitive flying machine. Avoid crashing into obstacles and eeevil birds (they eat monkeys, really!). Try not to drop monkeys too far from the ground. Watch your energy, carried monkeys' energies and the timer!
And remember: slower is better.
Controls:
arrows - movement (adjusts acceleration)
Z - catch a nearby monkey
X - release one caught monkey
Not many levels, because I have no more time. You can build more using Ogmo Editor (see source). Coded in FlashPunk.
This was my first LD, yo!
----
code - FlashPunk
graphics - GraphicsGale/ Paint .NET
audio - bfxr/ Audacity
levels - Ogmo Editor
See my journal for a post mortem and many more!
Game promo video:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bLype7kWoGM
----
author: marudziik
title: EscApe
comments: Looks quite polished. I like the flying monkey animation and the lemmings reference with the exit.
The controls felt a little wonky, too bouncy and slippery. Still very nice and complete feeling game.

No ending? :( I get to a point where it's the same level over and over again. Still, it was fun! I wish the monkeys wouldn't die from falling when I drop them over the hut. Other than that, solid game :p

Mechanics-wise (controls, and the idea in general) I tried to emulate a game I used to play a lot when I was a kid - "Ugh!" - but I didn't have more time to spend on balancing. Controls take some getting used to, but game should be totally beatable... (see below)

...but, unfortunately, I didn't have time nor strength to add a proper ending, so the last (10th) level loops. :) Wanted to add more levels first. But it's really nice to see someone got that far! Congrats!
The monkey-copter is hilarious. The death animation is also spectacular - it reminds me of the death sequences in Doom.
For someone who "cannot draw" you've made some very entertaining sprites :)
Very solid game. The controls felt a little wonky to me too, but I still enjoyed it overall. nice job.
Nice polished little game. Really nice graphics. My only problem was that the controls were so slidey that it ended up being kind of frustrating. Still, nice work.
Again, thank you all for playing and for your comments!
Here's a full playthrough video if you want to see all the levels, but have problems with beating the game: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WCgw09ZlRhY
Lovely, getting an arcade/Lemmings vibe from this. Quite challenging too, but not unfair.
And congratulations on your bronze coolness medal.
Nice idea. The Flying-controls are also quite fun.
Nice game, cute graphics! The controls are too bouncy and it gets hard quick. Navigating 3 block spaces gets frustrating, didn't have the patience to finish.

Fun game! I agree that the controls felt too sensitive to me too, but I got used to it after a little while. Nice gameplay mechanics and physics though, I could see this being a very successful game with some more polish.

Good job! The graphics and animation are nice, and the story is fun. Honestly, I find the game really hard to play due to the bouncy controls. Also, it took me awhile to figure out that 0 energy killed me (in addition to 0 health), especially since I often run out of energy bouncing around. But very well done, especially for your first LD game!

Really impressive - especially considering it's your first graphical game, first time with AS3 and flashpunk, and first time with Ogmo! Great stuff! I'd agree with others tha tthe controls are a little twitchy - makes it very hard to get around the level without knocking your health down, but otherwise it's great :) I recognised the big Ugh! influence! I used to love that game.
Controls definitely oversensitive, it would have still been challenging with more forgiving maneuverability. That said, it's a great and pretty well-balanced game that I really enjoyed. Good work!

Normally I'd say "nah, just a clone of Ugh", but after playing several dozens of often very generic platformers I applaud :) Apart from more levels (but the number you have is IMO more then acceptable for the 48 hours) and some more audio I think it just needs a TINY tweaking in controls - flying monkey is probably drunk monkey dipped in some  grease (although how the grease would work in the air is beyond me).

description:
You are a member of an elite team of ... dinosaur liberators.  Seems like an awfully specialized group, but hey, it's your passion.
Infilitrate the InGen corporate facility and help those poor baby dinosaurs escape!
Made using Flixel and Tiled, with Mochi leaderboards and BFXR sounds (mostly).
author: lilserf
title: Dinosaur Liberation Front
comments: It's surprisingly fun to chuck those dinosaurs around. Cute sprites, too. Well done!
This game is like the opposite of this picture:
Very fun. The last level had me take the easy route. Haha.
Fun! Took me a bit of practise to hit the pro exit on the last level :)
That was surprisingly fun! I could definitely see myself playing more of this with some variations and more challenging levels, great game you made here =)
Man, I wish there were more levels! Great game, lots of fun!
It felt like a bazaar combination of Mario World and Basketball. The humor was very appropriate as well.
Thanks for the kind words everybody. Like nearly everyone, I've myself a little list of ideas for the future... I'll have to see if I can put together an extended version some time.

description:
Captive
Captive is a game created in Blitz3D (www.blitzbasic.com) for the competition Ludum Dare 21.
It was created by Martin Cooke on behalf of Drytree Studios. I worked solo, created all my assets in 48 hours, and have included source.
Enjoy :)
author: cakemonitor
title: Captive
comments: I did it! I've always liked this kind of game. Was the original called Boulder Dash? A solid implementation and nice sounds :)
Nice job :)  It's a little difficult to predict how rocks are going to fall when you move and that can end up causing some silly mistakes that just end up getting frustrating though :/
Ack! Got to the door, and it wouldn't open.

The game has good feel, and I like boulder dash type games. A digging sound effect would have been nice, as would some music. I though the opening level was maybe a little bit too hard also (I feel like the original didn't have impassable walls besides boulders). Overall the game is definitely playable! :)
Same with offwhitefox. Hard to predict where and how the rock will fall so I resort to trial and error. A really neat game though. I like puzzles like these.
I kinda miss the 'usual' beginner levels, where you learn about all the physics, like how rocks move etc... and I miss a "reset" key - always ESC and restarting after getting stuck aint fun.

Nice little game - I like puzzles. My only problem: the rocks seemed to fall in totally random or irrational ways. I could not intuit their manner of falling at all. That made for some frustrating gameplay.

Functional boulder dash clone. If I wasn't so accustomed to Supaplex and it's controls, still by far the best game of this genre, I'd enjoy it much more, this way I was getting constantly killed by boulders.
Good entry. It could have used: music / more sound variety, levels with ramping difficulty, reset key.

After I realized boulders can stay on my head until I move and (round) boulders will roll off one another if they can, I was able to beat it with some diligence :). It's a "fair" game once you know the mechanics, so the puzzles were very rewarding. Still, this would've been a better experience for all if there were some easy levels.

description:
~~~ Controls:
Arrows = Move
Z = sprint
X = Shoot
A/S = Rotate Camera
~~~ Story:
The year is 2027, you're just a kid, but you committed a serious crime, you tried to organise a water fight on twitter. now you're in prison, and you must escape!
find your water pistol, and try to get by the bobbies!
~~~ Blah:
the game is winnable, but there's only 3 levels for now, also it's silent. I have sounds, and more ideas for levels, but I blew all my energy in the first two days and burnt out. I'll finish up whenever I feel like coming back to this.
thanks for checking it out :)
author: Sophie Houlden
title: BRITAIN:2027
comments: Fantastic!  Makes me want to definitely use Unity for the next compo.

Really cool!  Love the enemy design, everything feels really solid.  Didn't seem to need any stealth or planning, just kinda rushed in spraying and didn't have any trouble, but I'm sure you can address that with later levels when you continue this project.
This is great. The meachanics have a good amount of heft, the graphics are fun, and the level-layout is quite puzzly.
A downside is however the serious difficulty, but I guess all our games are in need of some days of polishing :-)
Great cartoony treatment of topical theme interpretation! Bit tricky though, felt like I won by luck rather than tactics or skill.
I like the game mechanic, although the levels definitely could be more tactical.
I think I cheated on the last level (I only bashed one of the first set of gates and the hid behind it while recharging).

Not a huge fan of the controls personally, but the gameplay was good, fun, innovative, and well done. The graphics were great, love the falling animation for the guards! PS. Can't wait to see what you have in store for Lottie's Dungeon.
This only needs audio and a few more levels, really fun concept (and art direction is top notch)
Great game mechanic. Sadly it is very short and there is no sound at all.
Great game, keep working on it
Great game. But to short. Would like to play more of this.
It ended too soon. That's a good thing I guess since it means I was having fun.
Superb. Wonderful character modelling and animation as always :D

I realy like how the water can both stun the cops and make them slip. Also your use of color is fantasitc. Purple is a under used color in video games, yet it makes the cops and the player very visible. This game could have used some sounds. Even simplistic synth sounds, or human noises could have added a lot to this entry.

Nicely done!  That's quite a bit of Unity work to crank out in three days, and it really fits the theme perfectly.  The slippery water may be a liiittle too powerful, but I imagine that more enemies and more complicated levels could change that.  I'll keep an eye out for future releases of this.
Wish there was Unity for Linux :(

Very neat, and some nice mechanics at work. Also, great take on the theme. I will say there didn't seem to be any incentive not to just charge around, because taking it slow didn't seem to give me any advantage. Nevertheless, refine this and keep working on it, as it is funny and has potential.
Few good ideas (really liked the idea of rusting the doors), it's really pity it can be finished under minute :(
Very nice work! It was very short, but the gameplay was very fun while it lasted. I really like a lot of the mechanics. The graphics and animations are also quite good for a game made in 72 hours!
Nicely done, great mechanics. Rusty gates was very innovative. Very short though, I really wanted some new cool tricks with water. I guess it sort of fits the theme, but is not central though.
I love the feel of this one, really well done!
Graphics were great!  But the game was way too short.
It was pretty short. Other than that pretty neat. The graphics are really good. The UI could use some indicators to help you keep track of the bobbies especially when they're out of your camera view.
Nice innovative game. Impressed that you were able to do all the animations in such a short time, with those nice character designs.
This is a very nice, complete game. There are only 2 flaws: lack of audio and that it's too short! I want more!

description: When you finish level 4, you'll be returned to the first level. There is no escape.
author: Bleck
title: Blockhead Can't Escape
comments: this turned out awesome dude, even if its prety short :) just make 200 more levels and you'll be all set!!
Wow, fun game. I hope you make more levels eventually!
shucking fort, aahm, f***ing short! but awesome in design and gameplay.. like the mustachios :~)
More levels! And a timelapse/post mortem would be nice.
Some fun gameplay, and nice graphics.

As said by the others, it's really short, but add lots more levels and it'll be much better. I would also recommend displaying text only once; when I backtracked the text displayed again (I'm not talking about the game restarting either).
I think this is the only compo game I beat twice! :D

Needs moar levels! also, a winning condition. I believe all games should have a failure and a winning condition, otherwise they are interactive stories. Not that this is necessarily a bad thing, but this game is too short to qualify as an interactive story.

Graphics are nice, and so is the level design. I think there is only one sound though, the sound of the spikes coming up? That bit on the last level is a bit evil, i crapped myself running in a circle to avoid being skewered.
I enjoyed this game a lot! Needs more levels though, and the ability to win!
Nice, the only thing lacking is the length...
Though i like the idea of a game that loops, especially if you're going for 'no escape'

description: In this game, you are the Scapegoat. Not any scapegoat, but the Bit-Scapegoat. And you are stuck inside some strange cave. Find your way through the puzzle to break free!
author: daandruff
title: BitScape Goat
comments: Looks fun. Doesn't run in WINE; too lazy to compile as there is nothing that says Makefile. :P
How come you need wine? There is binarys for Linux and Mac to? (And a web-version) You only need java :)
One of the best graphical styles in this LD.
Awesome job! Loved the music and the style! Nice puzzles too...
*Ahem*, unique. Now my room is moving in sine waves.
Energy limit  is a bit frustrating at times since you can't possibly know the level layout in advance or plan for it. Love the art style. isometric controls are a bit awkward at first.

Somewhat annoying that you have to start again from the beginning - but hey, I didn't have time to implement it in my game... Love the graphics and the game itself. My vision was all swirly after I played it too...
Oh wow! Really nice quality, good polish and really cool style.
Really polished, the audio got a little too repetitive for my taste (not the music, the music was good, but the accute sound everytime you moved got a little annoying).
Loved the sinewave. Sinewaves make think of happy things (dunno why).

Great job! The art style is very nice and clean and the game play is intuitive. I did find the energy bar frustrating considering you are given such a limited viewing range. I also found that the signs were in the way sometimes and the only way to clear them was to commit a precious move. Overall fun and pretty though :)
Lovely astehtics, with the low-fi environements, comic-graphics and bobbing player :-)
Epic win! I think this game is so simple that it doesn't need any repairing only some other features, music, more levels and a level designer to make a complete sellable game. Nicely done. Thanks!
P.S.: Those cubes and there moving...aren't you into demoscene?
The time limit reduces this to trial and error for the first (and maybe second and third) try and having to restart all the way is frustrating.
Art and audio style is crazy => well done! :D

I found it annoying to randomly press switches without knowing their effect; that's not my cup of puzzle.  The sound was kinda glitchy, especially when running fast (Windows version, the web version was even worse for that).  And I don't mean the glitchiness/grittyness of the tune.

description:
This is my first time entering a Ludum Dare contest. My game is simple but still difficult (players will lose about 2/3 of the time in fact).
And I got it done in time!
author: A Drum Duel
title: Three Doors
comments: After looking around at the other entries I wish that I had put in a reference to LD21 in my code as supporting evidence that I *did* actually code this from scratch for Ludum Dare (which I did!). Oh well, too late now. That's on my list for next time!
Thanks for the kudos! I hope you enjoyed the game.
I hope this didn't take you 48 hours to create ;)
I'll give you this: your game has very small load times... :/

description:
UPDATE: I have added a PyExe version for Windows users
This is my entry for LD21, called 'Terminal Escape'
I have used Python and Pyglet, plus the A* implementation found at http://code.activestate.com/recipes/577519-a-star-shortest-path-algorithm/
Synopsis:
You are the computer hacker known as mr. Red. Mr. Green is caught while attempting to infiltrate a building and needs your help getting out by unlocking and locking the doors in the complex. Try to trap the red guard units into spare rooms, so mr. Green has a clean passage.
Running the game:
Windows users: use 'run.bat' to start the game (this will set the necessary environment variables)
Linux and Mac OSX: You need Python 2.7 with the pyglet library to run this game. Execute 'python main.py' to start the game.
Controls:
Your main control system is the terminal on the left of the screen. There you can enter commands to manipulate the systems on the network. Type 'help' at any time to find out the commands that are at your disposal. On the right is the blueprint of the current level. Mr. Green is indicated as a green dot. Enemy guard units are indicated with red.
As soon as enough information is available, mr. Green will plot out his intended route to his destination. You can guide him by opening and closing doors.
Tutorial:
Enter the 'relays' command to discover all doors on the current level. The blueprint will show the door code names. Perform a 'scan' to get a hint which systems are on the network. You can 'connect' to each system using either its ip address or its canonical name. Doors can be 'locked' and 'unlocked', either allowing or preventing mr. Green to pass them.
Known bugs:
Sadly, some bugs make this game quite uninteresting.
- The guards are really not that observant, so most of the time you can just run them over without them ever noticing you.
- Another bug is in the third level, where the level switch event is not triggered.
- Sometimes (observed in the second level), a guard will just run through a closed door.
In-game story (not fleshed out in game, due to time constraints):
You always knew something was off with this last job. Maybe it was the jittery behaviour of your contact or the fact that there was virtually no information available on the target. The pay was also substantially bigger than usual. Anyway, when mr. Green (a codename, of course) handed back the intel folder, you could not believe your ears when he told you he was in. Ordinarily, it was him that turned down potentially risky jobs. After all, it was his life on the line when the job went south. You were always safe, far away from the action. Well, if mr. Green wants to take the risk, you're game.
The first door was easy. The guard units were milling around, not really paying any attention to the intruder. Then again, the scramble software always did its job properly.
...
Mr. Green: See? Nothing to it. Just an easy snatch and grab.
Mr. Red: It still does not sit right with me. Have you any idea what this company does or what we are stealing?
Mr. Green: No, I am only interested in remembering the building blueprints and the briefcase on LVL2.
Mr. Red: Just be quick about it. I want to be out of here rather sooner than later.
Mr. Green: Gee, what do your think ab...
Announcer: Warning! Security has been breached! Warning! Deploying security drones.
Mr. Green: What are you doing!?!
Announcer: Security drones deployed. Please lie facedown on the ground with your arms on your head. The drones will shoot any attempt at fleeing.
Mr. Green: You son-
It happended before you could react. The room mr. Green just stept in suddenly disappeared from the system. No camera feeds, no door controls, nothing. You try to reconnect with mr. Green, but no luck. His signal is dead. Your scans of the network yield no results. For almost an hour the network was dark.
An hour later, the system went back online, just as it was before the break in attempt. Shortly there after, mr. Greens signal came back.
Mr. Green: Red, come in!
Mr. Red: This is Red. Where are you?
Mr. Green: On the third level of the complex. They have some weird cell complex here. I think I am the only one here, but the guard units are buzzing around frantically.
Mr. Red: I am pulling up the schematics of the system. I am going to get you out. Hold tight!
Mr. Green: Hurry, will ya? I do not want to find out why all these cells are here.
author: ghostonline
title: Terminal escape
comments: I would get the EXE uploaded ASAP, you aren't going to get ratings until you do. The faster the better.
Just uploaded an executable version for Windows. Have fun!
Cool idea! It definitely needed more time, though.
Cool game, definitely has potential if you add some more features and variation to it!
Cool game, definitely has potential if you add some more features and variation to it!

It's not a bad idea, but it's too bugged to be playable. On the second level the guards would pass through locked doors and in level 3 Mr. Green reached the end and then he just stood there and the game didn't move on. And like you said, the guards don't really do anything. It has a lot of potential, but these are critical bugs.
Great idea, unfortunately quite buggy. I had one guard stuck in an reopened door and one other ignoring closed doors.
The command system seems quite authentic but could be more streamlined to make it more convenient to use for the player.
It needs more commands.  As for now, you only have to relay, scan, connect and unlock.  If there were more variety of controls, it would make a much better game.

description:
This is my 2nd ever attempt at an LD entry, and this time I am quite very finished!  HOORAY!  Please enjoy!
Tall Butt is an implementation of the ancient viking game Tablut!  Hooray vikings!
See Rules.rtf for instructions for playing!
If you have a small screen/resolution, hit F11 to shrink the game!
Source requires Python and Pygame.
author: Luthwyhn
title: Tall Butt
comments: Follow the link, then go to File -> Download Original
For the Windows version, you play the game by running TallButt.exe
If you have Python and Pygame installed, run the Source version by running TallButt.py
As mentioned, please see Rules.rtf for instructions on how to play!

Oh, and another note:  The AI is pretty weak... what can you expect from something developed in such a short time?  It's PARTICULARLY weak at attacking.  Switch yourself to be player to and AI to player 1 for a slightly more challenging game!

I really liked this, I've never played Tablut before, so I'm giving 4/5 innovation just for reviving a "dead" game. I had to keep the rules text open while I played(something in-game would have been nice), made tons of bad mistakes, but the AI let me win anyway. Pretty much the only additional thing I'd want is better presentation.
Interesting gameplay. Lol @ "See Rules.rtf for instructions for playing!" RTF! That is so retro.

description:
Someone was very frivolously experimenting with some plants, now his poison ivy has mutated. It got mega growth rate and developed a hunger for flesh, human flesh.
When the military used nuclear weapons, everything became even worse, now it can assimilate other plants. Mankind has only one chance of survival: escape from earth!
Includes:
All overgrowing plants.
Water-system for plants.
Energy-system for buildings.
Material Harvesters (harvesting the plants).
ESCAPE Rockets.
Scrollable Map.
author: Rialgar
title: Planet of Plants
comments: More visual feedback would be nice like how much power is available to buildings in a network. I wasn't completely sure how all the buildings worked. Felt lots of tension when the plants get to the mainland. Nice premise.
Good idea, and a neat interpretation of the theme. :)
It took me a little while to work out what each of the different icons on the map represented and how to use the buildings correctly.
Seems like you tried to make it too complicated and it suffers from a lack of polish.
Its an interesting concept (harvesting your enemies) and a nice game.

I think it needs a speed up button though. Plot aside, except for the water level, I'm not sure why you can't just surround yourself with flamethrowers and harvesters (and ignore the rest of the level).

I found myself extremely confused as to how to play. I tried to harvest the plants in the circle in the first level but that didn't work because of the wall, and only after I dropped all of my turrets did I see it coming in from the sides. I clicked on 'Impressum' not knowing what it did, and it quit me out of my game in the middle of my level. :(
A little polish and player handholding could have helped understand it right away.
I actually quite enjoyed this game, although I couldn't figure out the right strategy to win. And I'd be willing to bet that this game started out as an idea for a different theme, didn't it? ;-)

description: Arrow keys to move, try to get the yellow dot to the green dot without getting captured by a red dot.
author: Jason Morales
title: Maze Escape
comments: Sweet idea but not explored far enough if you ask me. A similar game with more interaction would be very cool! I really liked avoiding the red dots while navigating the maze.
A bit simple, but fun to play nonetheless!
Well, more luck next time, this is really too simple :)
Gives me flashbacks to pac-man. With less fruit and bigger mazes :P An okay, simple little game.
No big fan of maze games but the chase mechanic works quite well. Good job on finishing your first entry!
The zoomed in view was useful for escaping the red dots, but avoiding them was easy to begin with as they wander around the maze randomly. A little more polish could go a long way.

I played three times without having to go near the red dots, so I just kept my eye on the minimap and move to the green dot; not very challenging.  It is a shame, because the chase thing could spice up the game a lot.

description:
You are a fish that can change colors and phase through things.  People want to catch you.  Don't let them.
This is a pretty simple arcade-style game.  I didn't have the time to provide sound effects, and there's relatively little animation.  Regardless, it is pretty fun and serves as an effective proof of concept for a potential polished version down the line.
This was my first game jam, so I wanted to keep things simple.  My goal was just to complete a game, and I'm pleased I was able to do just that.  Next time I will try to stretch myself a bit more.
author: zamza
title: Go, Fish!
comments: Good game, but lacks sound. I had fun playing it, but I was having issues with the phasing. Keep up the good work =)
Cool, solid game. my high score was 8192 :)
It was kinda weird having the top of the water being on the left of the screen.

Nice little game. Weird how you can run into 2 different parallaxing nets, but I guess that's how games work. Nice simple graphics and gameplay. Maybe you could have some sort of indicator onscreen (C=Blue etc)
Nice to see something I had not seen before. Go fish.
I could tell I was having fun the moment I realised that I was restarting without paying attention to my score. Nice job; would be really good with sound.
Quite good job... For it's class of simple avoiding games it lacks only some sounds and music (and the color phasing adds that little extra needed spice to make the game stand out a little.)

Interesting concept. Took me a while to get a hang of it. I would really have liked to see the difficulty ramp up (I kept dying in 2 seconds when I was getting used to the controls.) It doesn't seem to get more difficult as it goes on. I think it could be improved with Guitar Hero like difficulty -- start with one color, then add another color every 10 seconds. Having 5 colors after a while would be intense, while still being easy enough right away to get the hang of it.

Thanks for the feedback everyone.  I agree it would be better with sound, but I ran out of time and I'm not the best with sound design anyways.  I'm gonna work on my art and sound and hope to be more competitive next LD.
BTW the game does get more difficult every 1000 points up to 10k points, but it doesn't get really hard until 9k.
Nice work, you made a pretty well-rounded game :)
The colour phasing mechanic enhanced an already solid concept of a game without adding any frustrating layer of complexity! Easy to pick on, and fun to play! Kudos for this entry!
Pity there was no audio. Pretty solid little core idea and game. Looked like a nice old arcade machine with Galaxian styled colors.  :-)

description:
Game instructions are on the linked page, but just in case...
Controls : WSAD or arrow keys to move, mouse to aim, left click to fire.
Get to the helicopter landing zone (marked on the map with a smoke flare - visible on the intro flyby) to escape.
Don't get shot by the enemy soldiers.
author: Beerman
title: Get to the Choppah!!!
comments: Oh man, super sweet intro! It was weird to me that the trees could be walked through, and it took me a bit to actually find where the choppa was. Also, if you just run fast, their bullets can't keep up ;)
Can't play this game =( I am on Linux...
Seems like you bit off more than you could chew. Game didn't quite work but I can see what you were going for.
Heh, just a little, yeah. Never done anything with Unity before, so it took me so long just getting things working there wasn't much time left to put an actual game in there. Next time...
Sweet camera movements! The player was very very slow which made maneuvering a pain, and the game itself wasn't all too interesting in terms of gameplay, but I really liked the lights of the alarms.
i was impressed with the intro and alarm lights, but the gameplay was disappointing. pretty easy to win if you walk through the trees along the edge :D
Would be nice to see at leas your health, to know how is it going with your character but very good idea.
Simple but effective use of lights. Controls were a bit sluggish. Really cool for your first Unity project.

Would you mind posting a Windows exe version of this? The standalone Unity player for Windows works on Linux with wine, but as far as I can tell there is no way to make the unity web player work on linux
I'll try and upload a windows build for you sometime tonight.
OK, windows version added above. Hope that works for you!

description:
Fortress IX
There is a secret facility in the mountains of Bavaria where the wiliest and most dangerous Allied prisoners of war are sent. It is referred to as Fortress IX. You have just become the warden. The prisoners will do anything to escape. You must stop them, or the Kaiser will have your head.
Controls:
z - shoot/start
x - send dog after prisoner
right/left - cycle targets
up/down - cycle areas
author: r
title: Fortress IX
comments: I really liked your take on the whole escape bit. The graphics were great, and the music wasn't too bad, but the whole thing sorta crumbled when I realized i could play infinitely by bashing up and z and automatically kill anything that would attempt escape. Maybe if there wasn't auto-targeting, it would have been more interesting. That, plus there wasn't a readme or in-game description of the controls, but they were pretty simple to figure out so that's alright. The intro glitched out on me, though, the bottom half of the text was cut off.
I couldn't run the game.  It shows the main screen one or two seconds, and then closes itself without any error message.
I posted a version without sound, the main theme is still included as a .wav

I love how the graphics take me waay back to my childhood memories (uhh, this doesn't sound right, considering the game's topic, but you know what I mean, right? Right?!:P). Game feels a little too easy and too slow-paced. Aother than that, it's a nice little game, feels like an old classic, which is very good!
The no sound version has the same problem for me :'(

description:
Once again, the file is huge by regular flash standards, in the vicinity of 10 megs.
For that reason I've included a zipped projector file (exe) for the Windows users. If any Linux and Mac users out there could put together projector files for their respective systems I'd be happy to provide hosting for their entries through the voting period :)
Instructions:
Mouse clicks for clicking through title screens, cutscenes and the like.
WASD/Arrows for movement. In the first two scenes, they have the same effect, in the final scene they are both used.
Enter is used in the final scene.
I've dropped several LD names in the game together with four different endings depending on performance and final outcome.
I hope you like it.
Edit: fixed a nasty bug that made it impossible to win, but possible to lose. We dislike that.
Edit2 (source only): Deleted and re-created the source repo on github with lower quality sound files and without the Audacity source files. This reduces the size by more than 75%. If anyone actually wants the source files just comment :)
author: TellusE
title: Flee your Fate
comments: A bit of Warioware in there! Neat little games. The graphics and goals were confusing at times, especially in the last game. The second one didn't seem winnable, but that may have been the point. But it did suit the theme nicely and I liked the multiple games tying together the theme.
Loved the innovation is this game. Loved the ideas. Keep it up.
Great voice over and nice graphical representation on the last level.
Love the ideas in this game, although the scrolling text is a bit slow.
I don't think your windows version works.
Neat idea. The progress trhough the story, combined with the minigames is also well done.
tneslond: I just ran it through my system again without issue. Can you describe what kind of problem you encounter?

That was really great. Awesome story and voice acting. Seeing names from LD people made me smile. The minigames were challenging enough to make me replay a couple of times and try getting the best ending. Well done!
Nice presentation, but i was usually quite confused what I am supposed to do :) First minigame ended for me in few seconds before I could do anything, cop just got me before I could ran away.
Full marks for audio and innovation. Stringing together a bunch of mini games to tell a crime drama was a brilliant idea.
That's a heck of a lot of monologue there, Raymond Chandler. It was cool that it was different, but maybe a little too much.

I didn't beat any of the games. They seem extremely hard, although I feel like I came close on the second one. I played through the game three times and the first and third games always lasted a couple seconds for me.

Text scrolled way too slow, but I had fun doing the minigames. Played through twice and had the same result each time; lost all 3 minigames. A bit more feedback for the player might have gone a long way in helping understand the games. :)

description: I think I took the theme in a different direction. This is a game about games and doing things. Made with Flashpunk, Pixen, bfxr, and GarageBand.
author: benedict
title: Escape(ism)
comments: Love it too! Nice idea, but not so fun, I don't know why :(
I have no idea why, but it was actually okay! XD
Ohh... artsy. Nice approach to the theme! :-)
Brilliant. Very unique interpretation of the theme.
The "escape" room genuinely made me laugh out loud.

Nice idea, but it takes tooo long for spike hit animation and would be better with a knockback, so the player can keep playing. Escape room is the highlight of this and make a nice twist on theme. It's kind of short without resolution though, unless there is something to do in the black room. Graphics are very simple, perhaps too simple.
I really really liked this game, and if it was longer, I may have loved it. I could have stayed in that escape room forever...
It's not a game but rather exercise in patience and frustration due to the long wait after the spike hits you. Let's say the artistic idea is there, but as a game it fails.
Nice, but it could have been longer. Hitting spikes takes MUCH too long though.

description:
Hi All,
This is my entry to LD21. Currently Windows only.
Your goal is to get the little triangle to the exit at each level - ESCAPING from where ever it is.
Lay a path with the mouse, and press SPACE to follow it! You can lay more than one path, but the number of nodes is limited.
Beware of the rotating lasers!
Hope you like it! :-)
Written with Visual C++ using ClanLib and OpenGL.
Graphics are mostly hard coded, title and ending in Paint.net.
Music in Fruityloops and sound effects in sfxr.
YAY!
Daniel
author: zdanielz
title: Escape of the AMAZING TRIANGLE
comments: Amazing game! Lots of fun to play. Does not explore the mechanics fully, there is much room for a post-compo version. Also I feel I cheated on a few of the screens. Graphics good but sparse. I'm especially impressed at how you made an entirely different game than what you usually do. It is inspiring for me for next time!! Good work!!
It would be nice to not have to redraw the lines cause you made a timing mistake. Would make a nice flash if you fleshed it out
I liked it, but nothing about it felt 'escape' to me (except the name ;P). It's a nice puzzle game though!

I wish that when the user has no more nodes to drop, the line stops drawing to the cursor so it's immediately apparent there are no more moves. Also, is there a way to undo a single node? I couldn't find a way on my laptop using a trackpad.
I enjoyed all of the timing-related levels and figuring out how to best use the moves you were allocated.

I like the simplicity of the concept. The music is great. Later levels get a little repetitive in that precise timing gameplay become more luck based. At least it escaped, yay! Would love to see more gameplay concepts other than spinny death lines.
Thanks everyone for the comments! You all have great ideas - I think I might actually make into a complete game at some point! :-)
@kavs: I agree - it's not much of an escape game... but it's a game! :) There's no way to undo a node, but it is a good idea...
@Rudy: I was totally planning to add more enemies and death things, no time... :(
Lots of fun!  Music reminds me of Tron, which is a nice plus.
There is room for more path related mechanics, this has some potential.
This is pretty good! I enjoyed it.

Minor complaint: I almost didn't play past the first level. I mistakenly assumed that I had to click to advance screens, so I wasted my node, but didn't realize why it wouldn't let me play. Even after I understood what happened, I still accidentally clicked when moving between levels more than once, and had to press R to restart the level.
I wished for more levels, because the later levels were increasingly more fun.

description:
Escape!
You've been accidentally injected into your beloved spouse.
Escape before re-expansion!
Pod will point toward the mouse cursor.
Left click to increase speed.
Right click to fire blast.
Charge your blast by converting flesh, simply drive over it.
Black areas are "open" and allow the greatest speed.
White blood cells are out to get you, you are an infection!
Too many white blood cell attacks will clog your engines,
trapping you inside your loved one.
Can you make it out before you re-expand and rip apart your loved one?
author: byte56
title: Escape innerspace!
comments: Interesting concept. Somewhat confusing on exactly where you're trying to escape to, as it seems you can go anywhere. also hard to follow due to everything being very small, so I kept hitting stuff when I was trying to save time on arteries.
Interesting, yet bit confusing - it really is TOO small.
Yep, I was going to put in some kind of zoom functionality, but I didn't have time :) Thanks for the comments.
I can't run it. It keeps crashing with those messages: http://pastebin.com/PY6FK0Ba
Reminded me a lot of microcosm (for the good old SegaCD). Also that nurse is probably by Umbrella Corp, judging from the way she handles syringes :P
Sorry Laksen, I use a pretty big texture in there. I'm afraid you won't be able to run it with your hardware.
I have the same problem as Laksen....
ahah really fun on this one destroying more flesh and bones than blood cells, but yeah it's realllyyyy microscopic!
Aw man. I'm hitting that crash right after the intro :(
It's quite small (as mentioned in another post) but I laughed a lot. There isn't another game quite like this in the competition. :P

description:
As the first person to land on the forbidden Planet 21, the last unexplored Planet in Space, you are now faced with the less enjoyable task of getting off of it in once piece.
Hints/details/eventual postmortem: http://bit.ly/pvNIkf
Web: www.whiletruefork.com/LD21/EscapeFromPlanet21.html (requires Unity plugin)
Mac:www.whiletruefork.com/LD21/EscapeFromPlanet21Win.zip
Windows: www.whiletruefork.com/LD21/EscapeFromPlanet21Mac.zip
Process twitter feed: https://twitter.com/#!/whiletruefork
author: whiletruefork
title: Escape from Planet 21
comments: Very cool theme and graphics.  Love how you can damage only certain thrusters depending on how you collide with items.  Good job.

Being written by a guy who calls himself "whiletruefork", how could this NOT be awesome? Surprisingly though, it did not cause excessive lag or crash my computer - very misleading and disappointing ;-)
good fun! I found it really difficult though, especially with the thruster damage mechanic. I couldn't escape!
the damage is a great idea, I just wish it didn't cripple you *as* much, since I'm really clumsy and impatient I hit a lot of stuff :D
Beautiful graphics and style, very well done. Losing entire thrusters is just way too punishing, though. Still, quite fun!

I love the graphic style, and the sound and music worked perfectly for the game. But I have to agree, the thrust controls felt rather unforgiving, I got 200k after a few tries though, so it's still fun, but still too unforgiving for me to feel like trying again and again until I can beat it.
This is really nice (I love how everything's on wires) but I agree that the thruster damage mechanic is a bit too punishing.
Very good game, although controls might be a little more responsive, game could be played faster then. Nevertheless, this is really good. Congrats!
Awesome graphics, awesome idea with the thrusters, basically everything everyone already said.
Very good presentation, both audio and graphics and old cartoons imitation or something.
Hmm sadly its kind of too slow for my taste... Makes it little bit less fun for me.
The visual effects are very pretty.
I liked the wires holding everything up, but the ship seemed a little slow to respond to commands.
I love the old sci-fi asthetics. Nice!

description:
Escape From EchoMonica Park is a 3rd person, 3d adventure/puzzle/arcade game. You play a hipster that must escape EchoMonica Park, and its denizens, before their loud, obnoxious and low quality music makes you puke. The faster you get out, the better your score. The more friends to rescue, the better your score. Don't get too close too many times to the plebs and their ear-blasting music or you'll puke and lose!
(Tip1: the unity web player has the most recent update because we realized you can't see the score in the Mac and Windows builds due to color blending.
Tip2: the Mac build is much larger than the Windows build because when Unity deploys for the Mac it adds the Unity dependencies...I think.
Tip3: Pressing spacebar does a dash/shield. In our rush to publish, we forgot to list that control mechanic...)
author: cislunar
title: Escape From EchoMonica Park
comments: Recruited some friend then wandered round the edge of the map a bit, but couldn't find any obvious exit point... Like the cubic style, but the player movement didn't seem to align with the level orientation sometimes, so I didn't feel like I had control.
I get an error when I try to run this that says "mono : failed to load dll".
I... think I won? I just ran around the level border boosting and then I got a credits screen.
I never really felt like I was escaping, unfortunately. I like the idea of proximity, but would have loved to see more aggressive enemies.
@ Surrealix : I've never made a mac build before sorry.

description:
Game made from scratch in 48h for Ludum Dare 21. All legit.
This was a weird theme for me since I've been working on a game (off and on) for about 13 years called "Escape". You can play it at http://escape.spacebar.org/ but that is NOT the Ludum Dare entry. I wish. This game is called "Escape Cod" and it's kind of like recursive fish pinball.
Play with the arrow keys and spacebar (you may need to click in the window first):
http://escapecod.spacebar.org/compo.shtml
Features and benefits:
- Pleasant pastel title screen
- Frantic pun-based gameplay
- Sleeping with the starfishes
- Three ultra-new tunes, one eponymous, with lyrics
- Almost believable physics using real-style maths
Win screen unspoilered by screenshots.
Soundtrack: http://escapecod.spacebar.org/escape-cod.zip
Timelapse w/cam: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ic_VnAkxCmc
author: Tom 7
title: Escape Cod
comments: Just thought I'd say I really liked your game. Recursive fish pinball is a brilliant idea.
Nice song :)) and a very nice idea, but getting the ball out is terribly frustrating. It sticks to walls like it's made out of glue
Getting the ball out is a bit random, I was struggling with the controls a bit. But the idea is great.
Your intro music touched my heart. Inappropriately.
The most fun I've had with a game where I play vomit!
The purple spiralish fish were a bit unfair but a fine game overall.
cool and wacky concept! a few of the fish were really frustrating, especially the yellow one, and the controls felt somewhat random.
Good art, good music, interesting and unique gameplay too. I enjoyed this quite a bit.
This is a lovely wee game. The controls were a bit finicky, but I loved the idea, and the visuals and the music.
I didn't feel like I really had much impact on whether I got out of the fish or not. I knew action was required, but it was basically "wait for fish to turn properly"

great concept, a little frustrating to play (i just wanted to reach into the screen and strangle the damn fish as it swims the wrong way).. great music. Overall despite the frustration very enjoyable to beat

This is the best recursive fish pinball game I have ever played. I wished for a less random game mechanic, and I hated that damn purple angler, but I enjoyed this very much anyway. Loved the theme song!
Odd.  At first I had to do nothing to escape, the ball would fall off due to gravity.  In the cases I had to do anything, it was way harder than it looked :-)
The music is awesome!  And so is the general idea.
A really nice game @_@ amazing music!

Great idea and great game. Although, I also felt like I didn't have enough control and had to hope and wait. Unless there was some way to influence the fish's direction by bumping in to the walls in some specific way that I haven't found (I finished it twice).
I've expressed much MUCH love for your games. I think it's your intro screens... I fall in love with them. I actually want to commission you to write me a song - they're THAT awesome.

The game itself was fun as hell too. I liked the fish-eating-fish-increasing-levels thing, although I didn't QUITE get to grips with how I was exactly controlling what was going on... it was all a bit trial and error.
Fantastic stuff though. You certainly know how to pack your games full of charm.
Extremely twisted.  This was one of my favorite games in the compo, by the way.
Confusing controls, but the concept was neat. Really polished. Also, fabulous intro song. :D Great job.

description:
48 hour jam!, posted it, didn't realize I needed to do more, here is link to post. Was uploaded in 48 hours to drop box.
Download it for the 30 minutes of music alone!
Source Code included.
author: Forest 2012
title: Escape
comments: This is meant to be a 48 hour entry, it was completed and uploaded within the 48 hours, just didn't create this entry (my bad).
I like it, but there are an LOT of spelling errors in it for a text based game.
The backgrounds look good I think, but sadly the music didn't work for me at all.

I got it to show the main screen by adding the JMF jars to classpath, but I got a java error indicating missing mp3 stuff. DOwnloaded the jmf mp3 codec and put it in the classpath and I'm back to the gray screen.

Just a quick update. Working on a post competition version with corrections to content and media. Will contain a Macintosh run script (the game runs fine on Macintosh from the command line) and also a Linux version. Be gentle on the virgins! :-)
Music didn't play, so I'll rate n/a for audio.
I felt like I was missing one giant inside joke, which from your comments on IRC I think I was. :P

40 Mb! This is gonna be one long dial-up bill :P The art is... special. Music didn't work, but I listened the MP3s separately. To be honest, one polished piece vs. three average would have been better.
If the music is not working you may not have JMF installed correctly just java? The MP3's are in the media/audio.

Was my first ever time entering the challenge. Sorry is some of the content / humor is a bit obscure thristhart. Lots of messages and things to friends and stuff e.g. Hot Latte made by Jeddly, Muzzy's Leatherma, etc.... Some MMO humor in there as well.
I tried, but I could not get this game to run.  Sorry, :(
Was unable to get past the title screen. None of the clickboxes (atleast I assume they were clickboxes) worked nor did the window close button. Tried to use KB but nothing happened either =/

description:
Coin carrying monsters are invading your homeland. Build towers, walls and self-aiming cannons to stop the flood of creatures. Don't let them escape!
controls
========
arrowkeys - move the paddle
1,2,3 - build option
spacebar - construct and release building
author: headchant
title: Don't Let 'Em...
comments: I like the idea, there's a lot of potential there. It's not super balanced and not much replay value when you just need to find the winning strategy, but with more depth it could be really fun.
Nice, this is the best game I've tried so far
I'm going to pass on rating this because on my laptop's intel graphics, half of the gameplay sprites seen in the screenshot are not showing up or are showing up pure white.
Good idea, it's quite playable, but it's terribly inbalanced... i couldn't do anything from the start, but then suddenly i got to the level i could just spam hundreds of towers and that's it.
Nice as a concept, shows potential (but reminds me one indie game, can't rememeber name, which combined tower defense gameplay with space invaders...)
Good game, although I agree with Shigor on the balance statement. Could use a little more strategy, but nice anyway. Graphics and sounds are quite nice, btw.
Needs some balancing, but a very neat idea.
Not a whole lot of balance, I beat the game in about 2 minutes after making a lot of money, and placing five dozen turrets around.
Very unbalanced.  Once you have enough to buy even one tower, the game is over.  The tower it is either too powerful or too cheap.
Other than that, I liked the idea, although remained me too much of tower defense.
Nice! One of the most fun games I've played from this LD!

description:
Built with LOVE, bfxr for sounds, and Renoise for some simple music. Gameplay is super simple - you're being chased, try not to die.
The .love file should work with new versions of LOVE (http://love2d.org/), I'll try and package some platform specific binaries as well.
Was hoping to get some nice 'splody effects in there, but work forced me to restrict the amount of time I could spend on this.
author: pdehaan
title: Chasteroids
comments: I like the audio quite a bit (and survived 109.7 seconds).
Pretty neat idea! And pretty fun... It did wear out a little while in, as I basically could have gone forever. Perhaps a difficulty ramp-up could have helped.
Still smooth, functional, decent graphics, and fun.
The frame rate started stuttering after a minute of play. Still it is a fun concept, and well implemented.
Great concept! I liked it even better when I realized that the asteroids don'T hurt you and I started to "hug" them while avoiding bullets. I agree that the difficulty should ramp up as you go along.
Too simple (both in terms of difficulty and gameplay), but it works.
That was a hoot! Love the retro vector graphics. The physics were good. Music was good (if a bit repetitive). Probably my favorite game so far. Nice job!

Very nice work. Nice idea, solid implementation, nice music. As others have said, some difficulty ramp-up would have been welcomed but as it is it still provides a nice experience. Liked it very much.

description:
Ninja your way thru some bads.  You can upgrade your character after you die and have another crack.
Left click attack and move.  Space is escape!
I didn't add UI to show the costs so:
Damage costs 2.
Health costs 2.
Speed costs 4.
You can add and subtract without losing points to try different styles.
Hope you can find some time to play (and maybe vote on!) the game.  I worked very hard on it.  Didn't get everything in that I wanted, but with hindsight I'm quite happy with the result.
Misc:
Sorry about the windows-only.  I think they are making an html-5 converter for these tho so maybe one day soon...
Excuses:
I went to a barbeque.
I was doing it all through an internet connection from a my phone.
I'm no good at Game Maker, even if it is designed for kids.
I have work tomorrow.
I am a massive noob.
author: markengley
title: Catastrophic Weekend
comments: Wow the transparency really massacred that drawing.

Love the sketchy art style! Could do with a little more user feedback, I wasn't sure whether I had to keep clicking to hit or if picking an enemy once was enough. Like how you can level up after each failed attempt, quite addictive. Speed seemed pointless because the enemy come to you though.
Game Maker doesn't run in a virtual machine and it's unfortunate, because I like your visual style.
Would have loved to see more enemies. ;]
Hand drawn menus! YAY!! I really like the idea of upgrading your character when loosing. A bit more gameplay (e.g. levels) would have been nice.
Controls are pretty much awful.  Neat art style, but difficult to play as your guy tries to run away instead of kill any of the 18 dudes on top of him I'm wildly clicking on.

Very nice artwork! It was satisfying to level up my character, it could have used more fleshing out all around (graphics, gameplay mechanics, the addition of sound) but overall I enjoyed this one, nice!
Thanks for the kind comments (and the *cough* gently worded feedback) everyone!  It's much appreciated.

description:
I'm new to this so my only goal was to have SOMETHING that could technically be called a game by the end. As a result there is no art, no instructions and some important info that should be on screen on each level is not :). However I spent a lot of time on this and will upload it anyway.
Move the Big Green Dot (BGD) from where it starts to the hole in the side of the window without touching one of the moving red dots on the way. You can do this by either left clicking to create a point that the BGD will move towards if it can, or right clicking to create a point the BGD will move away from whenever it can. You have a limited number of each points which varies from level to level. Middle clicking on a point removes it.
author: Mjiig
title: Ball Escape
comments: Can you compile it statically? Newest Ubuntu doesn't come with allegro5.
I've been trying... Couldn't work out how to do it. If you can spread any light on that it would be a great help.
Okay I found out how to do it now :). I was passing the wrong arguments to pkg-config.
Fun game, I like the mechanics of it.
It's kind of hard to tell that that 1px black line on the side of the screen is a hole.
And it's a bit frustrating that the ball can't orbit a green dot into the hole, but has to bounce into it, this sort of thing should be explained or something.
Love the Linux support, with 2 binaries even. Wow. :D
This is cool - I think you're on to something with this mechanic.
I like the concept and the mechanic is really cool, but being on a laptop I have no middle click and so find it hard to complete a level if I mis-click.

Interesting concept that could be taken much further. Needs more gameplay description in-game. There is very little control of what you can do with few dots so levels are very repetitive and trial-erorrish. But, hey, you finished it!

I can easily see this being expanded to include more complex challenges, maybe the exit point on different areas of the screen, maybe even a mobile exit point. I could finish plenty of levels by repeatedly clicking and 'drawing lines' of green dots, not sure if that was intent.

description:
Prisoners of a war of words, many women and men of letters need a guiding hand to escape from camps of genuine, physical terrors. Not every prisoner can be saved... you'll just have to try your best.
CONTROLS (game doesn't mention all of them, thanks Tulrath for reminding me of this in the comments): Letter keys to select and deselect prisoners. Backspace to deselect all prisoners. Space to pause. Click to move prisoners around (Ctrl-click to deselect them after click). Arrow keys to move camera around on the couple of levels this is required, or move mouse to the edge of the screen.
Game is a Flash .swf, so will probably run in your browser. Thanks ChevyRay for FlashPunk, a pleasant and powerful framework for a little game like this. Apologies to fans of good pathfinding - you won't find any of that here.
author: Devenger
title: 26 Prisoners
comments: It took me awhile to figure out that you could un-select a prisoner by clicking their letter again.  Once I figured THAT out, the game got a lot easier.  Very challenging :)
Cool game, its challenging and fun!
Took a few minutes to work out what I was supposed to be doing, but it clicked and suddenly I had a challenging game on my hands. Very neat implementation!
very challenging game, but a very cool little puzzle game.
Wow, I would love to see a post LD version.  Give me about 50 levels, a level editor and a better tutorial and you have my moneys.
Good intuitive (to me, at least) interface.
Won with 11. Will try for more later.
Really fun little game. Well made, slick, just generally good.
One of my favourite LD games, I have even downloaded your source and have been playing around with making my own levels I enjoyed it so much!
Your game is awesome, but I am just too dumb to play it =(
This is a great game. Love the game mechanics especially. Very polished.
I can't say anything. This is a proper game and it has everything it needs. I just wanted to say thank you!
P.S.: Maybe you should extend it and make a bigger, sellable game.
Finishing the game is pretty straight forward, especially the last level where I just made a run for it, finishing it with a decent score is where the challenge is.

Nice idea, well made and good use of the theme. I got a little frustrated by lv6 though and game up there.  The use of unique letters for each prisoner was cool - but it made the deselect key a bit arkward to reach? (Also, the game would have benefitted from a 'select all' key)
"Here, you cannot save both of them." - Well, I could! http://dl.dropbox.com/u/10650964/_trash/LD21/devenger.jpg ;-)
One of the best games of LD21 I played so far, good job! (Although it's a bit too hard for me.)
Fun game! sound was annoying, and graphics very simple, but the mechanism was great and pretty challenging! way to go!

Really smart game! The level designs were good, it was awesome you were able to write such good instructions and include in-game hints. Controls were a little hard to get used but work pretty well. One suggestion... it would be nice to have a key for "deselect all" (maybe ESCAPE, heh heh).. i often accidentally selected people while trying to select a group. Also, a little bit of music would be great. If you like the music I did in my game I'd be happy to try to compose something tense/mission-impossible sounding for you.

Nice concept, nice implementation (one time one prisoner went in a wall and got stuck btw), sadly I suck at this type of game (but my game is similar in a way, I know it does not make sense). Good level design (well I did not pass level 4). Very nice work.
Very original and nice and fits the theme better than most too.

Solid mechanics and good execution. Difficulty ramp-up and learning could be gentler (but that might just be me). Hated that I had to sacrifice people to escape, so +1 for creating that emotional response.

description:
Program your robot to escape the tests, drag and drop the instructions into the memory slots to give step-by-step instructions on what the robot should do. Get from start to finish while avoid being blown up by mines. There are 16 levels, see how much $$$ you can get before the end. Progressing through levels unlocks some more instructions and gives extra memory slots.
Tested and working in the latest versions of Firefox, Chrome (Although it should work on most older versions fine too). Doesn't work well at all in any version IE.
For the smoothest gameplay play it in Google Chrome.
author: Jonneh
title: "EscapeBot"
comments: This game is awesome, great job!
Nice game, awful music! I didn't feel like the puzzles became harder in the pace that they should though.
Awesome! nice puzzles, i i hadnÂ´t to vote 500 games i would keep playing it. Congratulations, but the music made a hole in my head.
Great game! The music gets a little annoying after awhile, but the gameplay is amazing.
Game is really fun, but like others said, the music loop is way too short. Unique gameplay though, love it.
I really like the concept (although I have to agree that the puzzles don't get hard fast enough). Excellent game.
This stands out from the average entry. A bit liberal take on the already loose theme, but it's worth that sacrifice.
Some of the upgrades and instructions are unnecessary because memory slots are plentiful. This tones down the difficulty and variation.
The music does get annoying quickly, I think this game could do better without it.
Pretty fun, wish I had more powerful instructions and there were a number of bugs but fun.
Great and innovative game, atleast i havent seen this done much before.

Pretty good for 48 hours, but the levels didn't really seem tha tdifficult until the very last one. Not to complain, given your time constraints, but it would have been much more interesting if the puzzles went further than "turn this way, move x squares, that this way, move y squares, so forth and so on." And yeah, the music loop was pretty bad, nothing you can't fix by muting but even then what would be the point of including it at all. The graphics are pretty solid, though, and the interface ran quite smoothly.
I think the levels are too easy (it is possible to win with just advance and turn) except maybe 16.
Bugged on first load (control panel was in the middle of the screen!). Reload and was ok.
Seem to precaculate when "play" is pressed resulting in a long delay for long sequences (even the music "freezes").
A mine did not explode on level 16 after the first one was destroyed by a laser.
It seems to get easier in the later levels.
Pretty cool, nice graphics, a bit too easy?

description:
ESCAPE THE FLOOD
=================
Use your godly powers to help the tribes escape from the treturous floods through 8 scenic earth levels.
INSTRUCTIONS
=============
Select from the top menu to:
- Move your tribes people (Once you have selected the tribe button, click a member of the tribe to select him/her and then click on the terrain to make them walk there)
- Move your camera (Mouse + WASD / cursor keys)
- Raise Earth (Click on the earth)
- Lower Earth (Click on the earth)
For more help see:
http://www.digital-glue.com/competitions/ld21/help.html
AIM
====
Get the required percentage of your tribe people to the portal exit before the flood water causes your tribe to perish.
Contact
========
Twitter: digital_glue
Web: http://blog.digital-glue.com
author: RipX
title: ""Escape the Flood 3D""
comments: This idea is quite interesting. Too bad you didn't have more time.
Impressive prototype for starting with only 14 hours left. Reminds me of "From Dust".
Very good idea, but really needs better controls.
@matthias_zarzecki As you see..I managed to get in a bunch more levels, energy bars, different walk speeds and recovery rates for tribes people etc as we all had a 12 hour extension ^_^
@Hanoran Thank you... yes, it was very inspired from this game, my friend bought it the other day for xbox360 so this was an attempt to create a simplified version in 48 hours lol
@Lattyware Yes, I kinda agree but if you keep playing controls do get easier ^_^ (I wish I'd had time to make the camera collide with the ground).

It's very hard to control the camera and the people. I wish that you've made the people bigger and easier to click & select. It's hard to see too when you zoom out. The idea is very interesting though but, the game is barely in a playable state imho.
Good work on this, using 3d in Flash10 takes courage.
Overall it seems like a promissing start.. Were there supposed to be enemies?
@elbowroom - Thanks, Nope, there were never to be enemies. The rising flood water is the only thing detrimental to the survival of the tribes.
cool idea, interesting implementation, although controls are wonky. gameplay is a bit eventless.
would love to see an extended version :)
@matthias_zarzecki: It just runs slow on my computer, so I have plenty of time, too bad it's too slow.
My CPU craps itself when running this game. Can't run, can't rate =X
Would love this game to control a bit smoother, cause it kinda feels like a lo-fi "From Dust" (which is a good thing :p )
Nice concept. It would have been great if you developed it further.

description:
THE SKY IS FALLING
Philip Buchanan
The Sky Is Falling, and you need to find refuge to escape from the chaos. Leap across the remanants of the world (using the arrow keys) and make it to saftey. This entire game was written in the final 13 hours of the competition. It took half the time of my previous entries, and works better than all of them combined.
Run the executable in the system directory.
It's only going to compile for Windows. Sorry!
Edit: Once you start falling, you'll need to quit and restart the game to try again.
Edit2: To save your sanity, I've now included a version that has a reset button ('R'). Everything else is unchanged, and the original is still there for you to play too.
author: Surrealix
title: The Sky Is Falling
comments: Wow, this is incredible for just 13 hours. It would have been nice to not have to restart when you fall, but aside from that, I'm blown away (no pun.) The graphics are good, the physics make jumping a challenge. Definitely flesh this one out if you can.
Why didn't you make an automatic restart when you fall ?
Thanks for the wonderful comment, wbobeirne. I wish I'd had the full time for this - it could have become quite a polished game.

LudumDareisCool - There are two reasons there's no automatic restart. I was so busy frantically coding that I never played the game for long enough to find this a problem. And when I did sit down to play it for a decent amount of time, it was too late to add it!
If there's enough interest, I'll probably keep developing this title somehow.

I think you should try and find out if you can be allowed to add a restart button to your entry. They've stated I believe that you can address big completely game-breaking bugs, as long as you don't alter any features. and you can argue no respawn is quite game breaking. Please find out if you can add it, it would make a huge difference!
I get a crash on startup. Looks like a segfault of some sort. Windows 7 64-bit Home Premium.
I don't know if it's my lack of skills, but i found it very hard! uhuhuh

Shiny! Very pretty! But for the love of all things good if you are going to make a game this hard at least give us a restart button that's easy to click, like 'R' or space. Also, my guy didn't want to run backwards. Perhaps making the jumps easier at first and then ramping up the difficulty would be nice, and a score (distance traveled) is always nice as well. Adding a story would be nice, re: Bastion.
BurnZeZ - I'm not sure what causes that. I'm on windows 7 32bit, so maybe it's a 64bit compatibility thing. I'll see if I can find a machine to debug it on.

bushmango - Those are some neat ideas to expand the gameplay. I've been thinking about how to flesh it out into a full game, and a storyline would definitely help. Obviously a difficulty curve/tutorial/scores/etc would come with more time. The run-and-jump gameplay doesn't seem to lend itself to much expansion though.

wboberirne, LudumdareIsCool, RichMakeGame and bunshmango - I've now added a version to the zip that has a reset button. I felt a little guilty changing anything, but I understand everyone has 500 games to rate, and nobody wants to spend a lot of time waiting for the game to restart over and over.
I loved this, and the level of quality for 13 hours' work is insane :D
Augh. Did anyone else get the feeling that the jump key didn't register even though you clearly pressed it?
The controls weren't too responsive, but the concept is great.  hitting derbies which fly upwards helps, but they're too tricky to aim for.

description:
A Scratch game written by Mini Troll (age 9 1/2) and Papa Troll (age 39 3/4). Playable on Scratch website, downloadable with full scripts.

title: Spotlight Search Deluxe
comments: Interesting choice, using Scratch. Well done, Mini Troll!
Scratch, wow, didn't know it was still around. The game idea is good but the keys don't respond well.
Even if the game is not great, I love what you did : develop a game father & son together! I hope I could do that one day!
A fine game, didn't really like the random wandering spotlights and the controls were a bit funny but good.
Nice game, but I think what you did there is even better. Involving your kid in game creation process is sooo cool, I just wanna go and make myself a kid right now! ;P Congrats!
My son watched me make some of my entry, but mostly he wanted me to do other things (with him and his toys).  Someday!

Controls (bad keyboard handling, waiting for key pressed message instead of checking if key is or is not pressed, I'd thought that Scratch should support this basic mechanic) are completely killing it. The loud game over sound almost made me to break my speakers with shock (was it intended? :)
Better luck next time, trolls (but you're doing good, sooner your little troll starts the better :)

author: teomat
title: Slimecave
comments: I dislike the way the sound is using. It gets noisy while jumping around and walking (and I dislike this kind of noise). Also I don't think this has not much to do with escape... It has something do with it, but not much... But, with a bit of polish (and better level design), a good game may come out =)

Yeah, the fact that the sound plays even while midair completely disconnects it form being footsteps, and turns it into this weird background noise. Level design was pretty good, but a death animation would have been nice - oftentimes it was hard to tell I'd actually died, because it doesn't even pause for a second to tell you.
Neat little game, very endearing character art!

Controls are decent, I guess triple-jump is sorta fun. A little too bleak, even for the atmosphere you were possible going for. Sounds are a little annoying. It does need more variety and is quite easy, most hardship from not being able to tell things apart. I guess I like the idea of being chased by hordes of slimes.
Weird jumping and the sound doesn't fit.  Also, next time please pack up the game so its is playable directly.

Walking sound shouldn't be played mid-air, and in general the audio isn't that great. Also, at first it isn't clear that player has to jump off the walls but levels seem to raise difficulty rather slowly.

It's a fine entry - perhaps a little too short, and it's only /horrible/ flaw is the lack of an executable. Not everyone's keen on installing stuff to run a game, no matter how hot'n'awesome the stuff is. So next time:

description:
Escape from the Ludum Dare monster! Run across the source code of the game. Make it to the finish and he will be too full to eat you.

Space to stop the character
Here is a video of the gameplay.
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hWL4XhBxYuI
author: none
title: Run Escape
comments: I love the idea! It's genius!
This idea is really cool. I love how when you lose you press *escape* to restart - very clever. But when I try to run it on 64bit Windows 7, it crashes before it even loads a ui :-(
I developed it on Windows 7 64 bit. Do you have XNA 4.0, C# 4.0 and DirectX 9 installed? I know another person having an issues with it crashing before it started and that fixed it right up.
oh man landing on the "{"s is so hard! Great game though, I found it very amusing and had fun playing it =)
Very meta! As AndyBrown says, some of the platforms are too skinny to land on. The game should be more forgiving... but still, this is hilarious!
Awesome idea, making those escaped characters escape ;).  If I modify the source code files do the levels change?  Could make for some really cool modding :P

offwhitefox, yes, you can put in your own files. They just have to end in .cs. You could actually delete, or change the extension on the .cs files in there currently if you don't want to play those ones.

Regarding the {, I realize they are hard. It was worse when there wasn't sound. I was thinking of putting a buffer on the Y axis when landing so that you could re-jump sooner. Or maybe made it so the jump was high enough that you could skip over it if you timed it right. Yes, I should have done that I think.

Thank you guys for the input. I know this was just a quick game, but I am really grateful for it because as I make more games, it will be easier to see these types of pitfalls so that I can get rid of them and make a game fun.

Crashes instantly on Win 7. I noticed you said there were some requirements - would it be possible for you to package them along with the files so that I can just install them and go? I think that could help a lot of people.
I like the idea, but it's terribly hard to time the jumps properly.

Has adding the XNA, DirectX, and .Net dependencies to the games been the standard? I thought about it when I was packaging but I thought I would just link to them because I assumed (wrongly, I think) that most people that were playing games on here would have them installed and those that wouldn't would go to the link. However, I am all about user friendliness. I will look into seeing if I can add them to the zip.
In the mean time, the links for the required external dependencies is at the bottom of the readme.
this is definitely 5 stars for innovation
This looks clever! It crashes for me on startup though. :(
Haha, nice one. I'll go with YBG: Whoa, this is so META :)
