comments: It's a fun little game! Too bad I was so busy with my own jam entry that I couldn't help you out with the sounds more than the laugh and the music loop :)
It's beautiful, but it must be really huge because it's only showing one or two frames per sec on my fairly powerful newish computer

I just held down spacebar and couldn't be touched. Even tried intentionally hitting cars and owls. My only problem is the small things that trip you up that you can't see until it's too late. Great art.
i like the evil laugh! agreed with dramble, too easy if you just run down the middle.

A very interesting take on trying to escape. I also agree with the above that the only things that tripped me were the small objects so low to the ground that they were almost impossible to see until hitting them.
Although I never got more than ten seconds in on a run despite thirty or so tries. Has potential but nut very fun.
Can't play on Linux =( And I like walking skeletons =X

It was pretty typical Jam for me. I did the game during the first night and even thought I noticed the errors like the collision box doesnÂ´t keep with the character when jumping I was too tired to fix them. But have you noticed that if you want to get good score you have to collect those roses. Alternative is putting something heavy on space bar and leaving it for 20 hours. SamEcircle: I didnÂ´t had time to optimize the game so at the moment it uses all kinds of effects that make it laggy on some computers. wally2069: Have you tried it with full-screen (press F) so u might be able to see obstacles better.

First time I played I got hit by a car from behind and thaugth this game was a car surfing simulator, eventualy I realized I was just dead. It is a pretty good game, but I feel a little let down that I can't car surf in it.
The graphics are awesome, but I can't really dodge the cars very effectively. Maybe it would be better with a little warning just before one shows up?

KevinWorkman: Some people are saying that it is too easy once you get used to the rythm. You can see the carlights before the car comes. Thought now I am adding sound effects to the game. Hamster_mk_4: Hahah, car surfing game would be awesome. First I made the whole scene stop after being hit but it is much funnier this way thought not as logical.
Matthias_zarzecki: Thanks grey with some spot colors has been a thing for me. I made this mod for Max Payne back at day: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e342Ijnq9k4
Fun little game... But I think the way the skeleton falls isn't the best... I would rather see his bones over all place =)
Nice atmosphere but I just find the visibility too low to play this game. Also it has a really low framerate on my terrible machine, but that's not your fault.
I upgraded the game little bit, things I still need to do:

description: The idea came from many nights playing video games as an escape from reality. We've all had moments where we just wanted to take a break from real life but sometimes you just have to challenge it head on.
author: neonaxil
title: Reality
comments: I can't get past the first part where they sit on the couch.. clicking everywhere and hitting all the keys.. am I missing something?
This does not appear to be playable, but its a nice idea.

I like the walk animations and the drawing. I managed to get a couple different endings but I also got the game into a few weird states. Overall, I like the idea and dialog, but could use some polishing, plus music and sound.

Since it seems that I can only go endlessly to the left or to the right and whatever I do "game" ends after I walk to the next blue couch (or if I run away from my imaginary friend too fast), I'm either completely missing something, or...
Interesting statement. Played like reading a poem. Good for a chin stroke but not that entertaining. I liked the leg animation a lot.
I agree. Nice dialog, but not much of a game. When the 'snow' started to appear, I died almost instantly every time I tried it. Didn't really see the point.
Pretty. First time I loaded it it got stuck after the intro screen. Played it through a few times to try the different scenarios. It's nice.
I'm stuck after the intro title...now I'm sad

I probably don't get what you mean with the game's story.  I got two endings in which I got caught by the "snow", but in one ended up sad in a couch and in the other I saw a field.  What should I understand from them?

description:
This is my first entry for a game programming competition! Hope you enjoy playing it as much as I enjoyed making it!
Be guided by the light as you play!
P.S.: You may need Game Maker 8.1 Pro to play with the source code.
author: stefanmielke
title: Prison Lander
comments: Very nice! Simple and fun. But it crashed after "dogs" level.
It actually ends there (there's a sound for a "gun").
But I think it isn't THAT clear (the sound is not exactly of a gun)...
I liked the mechanics a lot. I've wondered about a game with similar visibility issues, but you've pulled it off pretty fine.

If I had to put a finger on something, I'd mostly put it on the difficulty. I never got past the "Lasers" level (although obviously did - well done XD), and every time I actually progressed it was more a question of luckily pushing against the proper part of darkness :P
None the less, a really good entry. Well done.
Very enjoyable game. The mechanics worked really well with each other and it was fun to play. Shame it was so short would have loved to play more of it.
It seemed as a yet another simple platformer, but the light mechanics gave it that little needed extra twist. Not bad at all.

description:
You are a prisoner, you made a shiny drill, you should use it to escape!
5 different prisons with ai guards.
author: ZenithSal
title: Prison Escapor
comments: Loved the game mechanics...! And also what the NPCs said =)
Cool. I like the idea of using the other prisoners as a 'trap' for the warden.
some interesting mechanics! nice little game!
Hey, funky idea for a game.
Last man on earth and plenty of women, now that is worth exploring.
Nice randomized levels.  Fun text when beat a level.  Some levels seem impossible, which makes me not want to try again after losing.

Nice idea for a game, but too bad the execution lacks a bit. For instance, having only three lives/tries is really unnecessary for such a game. Especially because you sometimes just can't prevent losing the level because you don't know what the map looks like and inevitably will run into a guard. Who can catch you instantly.

description: This fellow is Hobo, He is depressed. You must help Hobo escape from his depression, and help him kill himself
author: MidnightOz
title: Mind Enprisonment
comments: Short but sweet, gave me a smile one my face. Not alot of gameplay. Some levels were a bit confusing. Levels could have been a bit more challengeing. Good work overall.
Fun little game. A few more levels would be fun, though. Also: My ideas! They rock! NOT!
Very short and not particularly challenging, but it was an interesting (albeit somewhat twisted) idea and an interesting approach to the theme.
The controls were a little fiddly at times, but I never had any problems with the levels. The game was also short enough that the 3 second music loop didn't get irritating.
Overall though, it's a complete and stable game with playable (and varied) levels. Good work.
Nice little game. Funny to see traditional platformer roles reversed.

I like the music loop, it seemed to really fit the game and make the mood, and nice twist on the theme! I think a little challenge thrown in there would have really made it stand out a bit more though.

description:
Six room escape games in one! Help a player playing a room escape game escape rooms in a game.
In case the files go down, you can download the game and source to play locally
http://www.filesavr.com/7VKEG86P0WSBU2X

Thanks to oldtopman for the hosting the files.
author: foobaz
title: Meta Abstract Room Escape
comments: I can't seem to find the edit button on this despite being logged in. I'll just put this information here:
Move to the border of the play area to scroll.
You can also drag and drop but it is not useful yet.

description:
McPixel is a minimalistic point'n'click adventure.
There are 6 puzzles to solve, and you have 20 seconds to complete each. If you fail, instead of retrying, you are taken to nearest unsolved puzzle, unless it's the last one.
Different actions trigger different gags, and one of these allows McPixel to save the day.
Made using FlashPunk (highfive Draknek & ChevyRay & Rolpege)
author: Sos
title: McPixel
comments: I liked the special ending really really really much!
Amazing fun - nice that there are plenty of alternative endings.
Hahah, hilarious game, and great pixel art! The special ending was full of win. Well done!
Top notch as usual. "Loved" the special ending.
The first game to actually get a humor score from me.
The amount of content in here is great!
Some solutions took quite a while to find though.
Ok, this is one of my favorites so far. I'm a sucker for point'n'click adventures.
Really cool game, and 6 levels are enough as the multiple endings are awesome \o/ ! Nice pixel art, and nice music! I laughed a lot, and the final ending is... well... surprising ! :P
Absolutely hilarious, I'd say some puzzles don't really make sense but I've played enough point and click games to know better. :D
Wow. This is great. Too bad I can't rate games. This would get a full 10/5 for humor.
You definitely put in a lot of effort :) One of very few games (including games outside of this competition) where I had to get 100% completion.

I didn't figure out a couple of the puzzles, but started to understand after a few runs through. :) Excellent art, funny results (albiet sometimes unpredictable, but McPixel does what McPixel does...).
100% completed and liked it! :) Good humor and big thumbs up for music.
Special ending is super hot hot hot
Took me a minute to figure some of it out, I guess I'm out of practice when it comes to adventure games! Funny game!
I can't stop giggling! Of course, this is the funniest entry I played so far.
Main criticism of course is the theme (rescuing the situation is NOT escape :-P), but, who the fuck cares?
haha excellent, graphics are great, audio matches them very well. I think it could have followed the theme more closely but beyond that it's real fun to play. Awesome!

This game was amazingly good and fun! The puzzles were interesting and hilariously fast-paced! It definitely solves a problem that some people have with puzzles games... that they take too long. Having the scenes all end in explosions is hilarious and keeps things moving fast, along with the great music. 5 stars for sure!
I only deducted one point for the loose interpretation of theme but otherwise an amazing piece of work. The secret ending is too fun to describe. Well worth the extra effort.
The twenty second solve or die mechanic was great and well worth using again.
You actually made a point and click adveture fun WTF! I loved it.
Loved the audio, the humor and the graphics, although I think the link with the theme is kinda weak. I had lot of fun discovering the gags and special endings. A quite good entry indeed.
The special ending was nice, but the unexpected gags themselves are more than enough reward. Truly a good feeling to "figure it out".
It did take me a while to understand that choosing an action ends the scene, even if 20 seconds is not up. Once I caught on, it was extremely fun.
Awesome AWESOME game! Gags were funny, loved the ending too! I like how it's not immediately obvious, forcing you to just be a bit random and try out things!
Too bad I missed some scenes because I mouseclicked too much...

description:
I don't really like how it turned out. Theres tons of stuff I'd like to add, but I have no more time left. Like bosses and better graphics and better everything and more weapons, you get the point. Yes, I realise its a bloody mess of objects. The names went from 'objBox' to 'lolman' in a few hours.
The game is pretty easy, I should hope.
Anyway, I had tons of fun making this game. I'll be sure to participate next LD, hopefully with a C# or Java game. :P
Controls:
Left/Right - Move
Up - Jump
Spacebar - Place bomb
CHEATS ON - J
CHEATS OFF - K
Over and out, Naarkie.
author: Naarkie
title: Luis the Thingemebober
comments: It was a little buggy sometimes but nothing which made it unplayable. The attack method was quite different which I liked, and it was fairly enjoyable.
Obviosuly the main complaint is that it should have been called Luis the thingemebomBer ;)
Loved the audio, that and the zany graphics gave this game a brilliant feel. The mechanics weren't bad, too :)
Voice-over is nice, "owie" is just lol. I usually complain about "too hard", but this time - too easy.
Loved the audio.  The game was a little easy though, I won with almost 300 health.
It's a little rough around the edges, but the voiceover more than makes up for that. Nice.

description:
This is my painstakingly produced FPS title.
You must shoot your way through the caverns and collect the keys to open the final door, before the lava rises and you become toast.
I didn't get time to take out all the developer hacks, so you might find a few still in there.
To build the source, you will need to get the latest version of BEPU physics.
author: speciesUnknown
title: Legendary Lava Escape
comments: Wow! This game maybe isn't the best looking, but it was really fun and simple. The sound effects were nice, and the controls were very tight (aside from a bit of lag when turning). It fits the theme very well too: escape before the floor becomes lava.
The lack of lighting/shadows makes the game pretty hard. :-/
Yeah, I'm disappointed that I couldn't get the lighting done in time. It makes it hard to see where you are going.
Can't run the game in the virtual machine (it says the video card is not compatible) and I don't have a real Windows XP.  Sorry, can't rate it.
Really nice for just 48 hours! The sounds and environment were good, just the lighting killed me too many times D: Me gusta the flying moustaches, also.
It does require SM2.0 to run, I'm not sure I could really have made the requirements any lower. I used the XNA 'reach' profile which is designed for low end DX9 hardware.

A good proof of concept, but does not really bring any new mechanics. It works, which is a lot for an FPS, but it feels very unpolished. Perhaps it would have been better to start out simpler. It's not really central to the theme though. Sorry this felt more like a rant; technical achievement doesn't get a category :(
The lava was too low and made it difficult to tell where the platforms end. It also added to the falling time which made it take longer to try again. The death screen was also kinda painful to read.

description:
If you've played Lesbian Spider Queens of Mars by Anna Anthropy (http://games.adultswim.com/lesbian-spider-queens-of-mars-twitchy-online-game.html), you might have wondered: what happens to the captured slaves when our dear Queen walks over them? The obvious answer is that they are abstracted away into a cage offscreen, instantaneously, in the manner of many videogames. The disobvious answer is that the Queen uses her spider-venom to shrink them down to a portable size, so she can carry them around freely, as if they were mere diamond gems. This game is based on this assertion to some extent.
All art assets were made in the standard Game Maker sprite editor.
ALERT: Contains adult themes, weird sexual nonsense, dubious arachnid biology and female nipples.
author: L
title: I'm Being Eaten By A Spider Queen (And I Don't Like It One Bit!)
comments: Absolutely amazing. My only complaint, if you caould call it one, is that I wish there was some way to skip forward the text. I love every bit of it other than that, though. Absolutely ludicrous in the best possible way.
Wierd wierd game, but so cool - great job!
Great!  Just Great!  I love Lesbian Spider Queens of Mars so this is a great and interesting spin-off puzzle game
Could not open the mac app. Running Tiger 10.4.11
cant fast-forward the intro... pressed ESC in hope for some menu ... program shut down :( ... have to watch all the intro all over again now ... makes me a sad panda
First game I've played with an 'Insolence' meter. Nice.

Don't no anything about the game it's based off I'm afraid. Tried playing it a couple of times but didn't understand if mashing the arrow keys or not really made any difference. Pity! I liked the text describing the action and graphics where pretty!

Hurrah i reached the dubious ending, i'll admit it took a fair few goes until i realized what i was doing, but i loved it, i struggled to find the line of text i was on sometimes and then it was gone. maybe i should of lowered my resolution, anyway thoroughly enjoyed it.
Awesome! Very different. I felt quite naughty after getting the biologically dubious ending, haha.

description:
Made in Java, should work on most machines. A classic game of "escape the guards, turn off the lights, run along corridors". The lighting engine is *very dirty* and works only because it rounds off floats in a weird way. Most of the time was spent on that, sadly...
Music made in 5 minutes in Ableton Live, sound effects voiced by yours truly.
Tested on linux/mac os, should work on Windows.
(EDIT: I made a complete package of the whole game in a single jar that should work if you have Java installed and if the previous package did not work)
(EDIT2: I know you need to download to play, but the game has to be seen while moving, the screenshot cannot show the greatest part of the game. So if you needed just a little bit more incentive to actually try to play the game, here it is ;) Thanks in advance!)
author: MacTuitui
title: Evasion
comments: I liked the guard mechanic, but got stuck on the fourth level. Fun game, liked the use of lighting.
Heh, I couldn't get past the level called "you can do it!" :)

Cool mechanics, although one thing I noticed was that you can't tell what you can see when the light's shining on the same place. Take your screenshot, for example--the faint gray is what the player can see, but you can't tell that you can't see around the corner into the room with the light in it.
It's a cool game, though. The simple mechanics are fun, once you get used to them.
Nice! I like the graphics style, and the lighting system is really neat.
Reminds me a bit of the game 'Frozen Synapse,' but more stealth-y.
A little bit like Monaco :) You ought to continue working on it and add different kinds of missions, items, skills and so on. Could turn into something really cool
Press any key. Escape. Game exits. :)
Good concept, simple implementation. Neat lightning. Lacks detail and graphics.
Sadly java2D does not like blending at all... If I were to continue this, I'll use OpenGL to get a lot of fancy effects for free!

description:
This is a short game made entirely in Blender and using the Blender Game Engine.
Currently you need Blender to play this game. (You can get it from http://www.blender.org/ or http://graphicall.org/blender  It should be possible to create a standalone version. I will try.).
Open the file in Blender and you are good to go.
Press 'P' to start the game-mode.
Use the arrow-keys to rotate the platform. That will move the ball.
And you need to keep track of your mouse-arrow sometimes ... Be prepared ;-)
You can always ESCape ;-)
------------------------------------------
Edit 1:
Grab an easy downloadable version here:
http://code.google.com/p/manuel-bellersen/downloads/detail?name=Dont_ESCape.blend
Maybe the online-version works for someone: http://urfoex.blogspot.com/2011/08/ld21-entry-dont-escape.html
------------------------------------------
Edit 2:
I added a binary for Linux 64Bit:
http://manuel-bellersen.googlecode.com/files/Dont_ESCape.7z
It *should* work...
------------------------------------------
Edit 3:
Just added 2 binaries for Windows, one for
32Bit ( http://code.google.com/p/manuel-bellersen/downloads/detail?name=Dont-ESCape-32Bit.exe&can=2&q= )
and another for
64Bit ( http://code.google.com/p/manuel-bellersen/downloads/detail?name=Dont-ESCape-64Bit.exe&can=2&q= ).
Have Fun!
------------------------------------------
Edit 4:
I've written a little Post-blabla:
https://plus.google.com/116768004614082942458/posts/SMSc1gZFYky
And if you need help on how to play level one you can find a little play-hint in comment #6.
author: Urfoex
title: Don't ESCape
comments: My First time using Blender & BGE for a game.
I like that to you need to know how to control this game to get to the help screen :P Level 2 is pretty rage inducing.
Unique mechanic, next time have someone package a windows exe for you
I've put up 2 Windows-binaries. One for 32Bit and one for 64Bit.

description:
Cosmic Heist is an arcade-like game which might look like a shmup, but is really focused on flying (you have no weapons).
It was created with C++, SDL, OpenGL, Boost, GLEW, and my own personal code library.
author: Kevin Wells
title: Cosmic Heist
comments: Great game! The controls with only 8 directions are working surprisingly well. I really could steer the small ship between swarms of moving enemies without collision.
There is a lot potential to make some bigger game with this postcompo - especially with the focus on flying.
Man, the music is really messed up (in a good sort of way), and so are the sound bits in the menu... feels very alien and oppressive (hmm, kinda fits your nickname:)).
I liked it! Man, I thought the controls were relative like Asteroids, not absolute, at first.  And the asymmetric ship had me confused which way I was pointing too.
But once I figured that out, I played this quite a bit!
Absolutely love the tones on the menu buttons - I sat there dragging the mouse across them for a while.
Excellent audio. Game's too simple for my taste, but it works pretty well.
"HOW DO I SHOOT HOW DO I SH- oh wait i can just evade them!"
I like it. simple and fun. managed to get to level 19 on the first try.
Heh, this is similar to my game idea - fly a ship to a target and avoid enemies...
The controls work well, and I like the menus.
I just get the following with the Linux version. Any ideas?
bash: ./Cosmic Heist: cannot execute binary file

description:
It may have no sound whatsoever and be low on graphical detail, but it's high on weird!
...that's a good thing, right?
This is a very short point-and-click adventure game where you escape from a series of screens.
I expect the responses to this game to be... interesting.  I had to cut pretty much all the non-placeholder graphics, animation, and sound for time, as well as the last level (which I thought to be the cleverest- maybe I'll expand on this idea later), but hopefully I got the idea across well enough.  In place of all that stuff is a bizarre ending that I kinda had to think up on the spot.
I originally wanted a subtle, kinda artsy thing, but when I realized that I suck too much at art to do anything like that within the time constraints, I went in the complete opposite direction and abandoned all subtlety.  I tried to go for funny in a "what the hell did I just play" sort of way... though I didn't have the time to put much thought into that aspect.  Did I succeed at all?
author: Gjarble
title: Beyond the Fourth Wall
comments: Oh, artsy it is. I like the idea.
Even though the graphics were obviously rushed, they still had nice style. This works really well. I wish there were more screens to escape from.
I listed your game as an example of how to get a good theme rating (from me) in a blog post I just wrote :)
nice, I liked the idea, not seen that before so full marks for innovation! graphics were rushed and no sound though ( at least for me? ). Good entry.
This is one of the more interesting ways to play with the theme. Well done.
A good series of mini puzzles that clearly involve escape in its most interesting form. A great job worth playing.
Despite what you said about sound and graphics, I quite like this one. Nice puzzles and some interesting story.
cool idea! took me a few tries to get past the scoreboard but yeah, nice idea done well.
Very fun to play - I also like the odd ways of getting through each puzzle, the weirder the better :)

Thanks to everyone for the kind words (and to JohanAR for the shoutout)!  The response to my game so far has been far better than I expected- it's definitely given me enough confidence to expand on this game for a later time.

description:
Boingo the sheep has lost his way and been captured by evil wolves. Help him to escape their grasp and find his way back home! Featuring 5 levels, lush graphics, 1ups, intro, exit, and more. :D (And I made it in under <16hr w00t)
Moved to Jam due to breaking the "original music/sfx" rule. Even though they were free and legal they aren't original. :(
Ah well, been fun. :D
author: G4JC
title: Boingo's Escape
comments: Very impressive graphics. The controls are a bit buggy; it seems that whenever you land on something that isn't ground, you stop moving horizontally. However, using music that was not created by you during the competition - even though it's public domain - is a violation of the rules. You might be able to remove it to avoid being disqualified, but modifying your game after the submission deadline gets you disqualified too, so I would consult someone who knows the rules better than I to find out what to do.
The graphics were nice at the beginning, but the gradients felt a bit overused towards the end. Gameplay was fun, but whenever you landed on something you would stop moving right, which was annoying.
Also, I thought your game fit the theme very well.
Yep this should be in the jam.
Couldn't get past the start menu and f1 only said arrow keys and space bar so no idea what I was supposed to do.
The above horizontal bug was very frustrating. Nice environments. Also kind of annoying that you have to jump so high for such a small obstacle, semi jumps would have been nice.

The intro music was definitely way cooler than the music that played during the actual game.  It's cool that you made all the different level graphics, but I doubt many people will get a chance to see it all.  It may have been a little too leet to fit, but that made it pretty hilarious to me :).

description:
Welcome to Attack of the Chasers!
My hardest game yet :P
Use the mouse to control the player and avoid the obstacles!
author: Benn
title: Attack Of The Chasers
comments: So hard xD (also playing with a touchpad >__>) I stopped at the level in the picture. The tip with the shorter clicks for more control would have been nice to know a level earlier :p
Funky controls. They are just in the sweet-spot of "not immediately understood" and "interested to master".
Huzzah, a winner is me! That was really difficult...!

Very hard, but still fun. After beating the game I still didn't have a full grasp on how to move correctly though- Also apparently, if you leave the end level running for awhile, the chasers push through the walls and kill you, so perhaps I didn't really escape after all?
Was indeed quite difficult - but a really tight little game, good work!
4 for humor as the being unable to get past the 5th level was hilarious
Nice game. I enjoyed slingshotting around corners. Very satisfying.
When you get the arc just right... very rewarding! Cool idea!
I really like this game, it's a simple well-executed idea and the controls add a nice level of skill.
Resetting the chasers after you've been sent back to the start would make this less frustrating and more consistent.
So frustrating to control.. yet i can't stop.

Very nice and innovative concept! I had fun playing that. And yes it can be hard but that's what makes it so rewarding when you beat a level. The graphics could've been a bit more harmonious (the 'X' and 'O' markers don't quite match the rest of the color theme) but that's a very minor thing. Overall very nice!
Playing with a touchpad was actually easier than I thought. Very strong entry!
Wasn't as hard as I thought. I only had minor trouble in the last level. The controls were interesting and different.

The controls are super super weird. I've played through the game twice now, and I still can't figure out how it works exactly. In any case what I mean to say is that the controls are quite difficult and non-intuitive. The chasers seemed like a bit of a random element. Whether they hit you kinda seems up to chance, although going fast will of course help.

description:
Here's our first Ludum Dare entry : "Action Time".
It's a platformer/shooter focused on cool features like rewinding and replay and shooting bad guys (plus awesome stuff like WALLJUMPS, SNOWBOARD, BASE JUMP AND SHOOTING BAD GUYS !).
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
You play as "Roberto TNT", an action movie star on the set of his latest blockbuster : "Action Time".
Try to record the BEST ACTION SEQUENCE EVAR !!!1!
If you are not satisfied with your last moves you can rewind at any time by pressing the right mouse button to record it again. When the sequence is over you can sit back and enjoy watching your last play-through.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
TurboDindon Team - turbodindon@gmail.com
- art by Raz - razorx59@hotmail.com
- other stuff by Bigj - jeromefait@yahoo.fr and blemish - baptiste.martin@gmail.com
Art : Photoshop
Dev : Gamemaker + GMPhysics
Level design : Visio
PS: Sorry for the remaining bugs and the short level, time was running out...
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
* Update > Here's a youtube video if you can't run the game (linux, mac etc.) : http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ziJHIFve09A
author: TurboDindon
title: Action Time : Escape from the dangerous explosive complex
comments: Very nicely made, superb graphics quality, good sound effects, smooth movement and a decent shooting system.  The health and rewind mechanics don't feel right at all though, but its still fun to play.... until you beat it, which is unfortunate given how short it is.
This is a very sexy game. I am surprised you had time to make three different game modes.
Holy crap, this game has like all of my favorite mechanics, PLUS JETPACKS AND SNOWBOARDS. Incredible.

Looks amazing! However, I couldn't really play because most of the graphics were bugged, including the main character being completely invisible. Also the bomb timer was unreadable. For another thing, please, *please* allow WSAD movement for a game with mouse aiming!
Thanks for all your comments ! Glad to hear you liked our game :D

As you said the game is too short and a bit b0rked sometimes, we've probably spent too much time on developing gameplays and integrating art rather than  fully tweaking it (weird collisions, not enough feedbacks on hits and rewind).
This is our very first LD so we'll try to fix this in our future entries (longer game experience, more reusability of similar gameplays, less different gameplays but more polished...)
tgisola : hehe cool :D Our next one will probably feature HANG GLIDING, DINOSAURS and AWESOME EXPLOSIONS!!!!

Hempuli : ouch, it might come from the surfaces in gamemaker (or probably our crappy lack of coding skills, yeah well...). Maybe you could try with updated video drivers ? It fixed the issues on some computers. And for WASD movements we've planned to use it (as the "controls" screen says) but we just ran out of time and panicked, frustrating as it can be done very quickly :| I'll upload a new post-LD version later, with wasd and various bug fixes if you're interested :)

awesome! it is a bit rough around the edges but it's fun, charming, and so much game play variety. can't believe there's snowboarding, sonic springs, skydiving battle, time rewind, and a miniboss all in one LD game!!

Heh, using the arrow keys and touchpad was terribly frustrating... The game is amazing though, I can't praise the artwork enough. There was some bugs, but they didn't really affect the experience. Sad that it didn't had music!
Still, you guys really did a splendid job here, congrats.

The graphics are oozing with polish and quality. Gameplay wise I would love this to be more polished, longer and I would like some music! Anyway it seems there is nothing more awesome and manly then shooting jetpacking thugs in the face while doing a backflip on a snowboard. Good job guys!
FANTASTIC art, great execution. The level design is really badass. Snowboard backflips ? check. Jetpacks ? check. Rocket Launchers ? check.
It's very spectacular. I wish players were more encouraged to use the rewind feature to build stylish sequences, but it's already great in this form.
*EDIT :An epic music with wobbly guitar would have been a nice addition too.
Great! It was so fun, loved the snowboard sections, feel badass picking off enemies one handed while riding down the slopes :D
I like the concept, but the framerate was simply too low for my machine. WASD also didn't work. The graphics were awesome and the mechanics felt good for how much I could play.

description:
Edit: For future reference, I'm horribly disappointed in this game. It taught me to never try and half ass things. I hope it does badly in judging.
The fixed version was originally created within the submission time, but I wasn't sure, so it's separate. It contains lag fixes, changes to enemy spawning, and the laser now actually works!
UpRunner is a climb the tower platformer, where you have to escape death by way of giant spinning spikes. The tower is randomly generated, and contains rockets and lasers to hinder you. There is currently no endgame, aside from getting a 7 digit score. Go climb!
author: Flyboy
title: UpRunner
comments: Cool game! It's slightly buggy, but the rockets and lasers are pretty nice and I love the running animation. Makes me wish I'd added guns to my own entry.

I liked it, although on my first playthrough I only got one laser and it didn't manage to even hit me. I like how the little dude's legs spin as he runs. Climbing to escape spinning blades is also quite fun.
I love the ledge grabbing feature, and the random teleporting makes for unique gameplay! I also like the part when I win and it says 'unknown variable y'. This game is the best! :D
The little dude's got an eyepatch.  Sweet.
Made it to 250 something before it generated platforms I couldn't jump to.

description:
Escape from the clutches of the malevolent Shotgun Man in "Shotgun Man Will Shoot You" (now with twice the Shotgun Man)!
My first Ludum Dare is finished! Made with the Allegro library in C++. The music is all in MIDI format, so playback may be affected by your computer. All libraries and files needed to run the game with Allegro should be included.
author: kirbytails7
title: Shotgun Man Will Shoot You
comments: The game randomly glitches and stops refreshing, so I can't see anything :/ Couldn't figure out how to avoid being shot either...
Yeah, couldn't play it either, sorry.
Whatever that creature is I keep wanting it to get shot.

Nice gameplay, well done for having music, but I cant say it appeals to me. Graphics are cool. A classic health system would be much better than the death condition you currently have, which is just annoying.
The title is great. Simple. Sufficient. Explains the game.
Thanks for the comments! If anyone has any details on what sorts of glitches are happening, I'd like to see what can be addressed.
The game's a bit too hard and the amount of times you need to mash escape to put on the jetpack is a bit excessive but aside from those things I like it!

Hey! very nice game, I like the drawings and music. The only thing I think I will recommend is to check the bounding box collisions or whatever you are using to detect them. You used C++ I think, right? nice work.
nice game ! Try to help the player move by autorecaling him if he's not just in front of the path. I died a lot of time just because of this.

description:
Controls:
Arrows: Moving
X,C: Shoot (Yes you can kill creature, and yes it does help)
Sorry... Just sorry...
First Ludum Dare and I make a game about... well... don't want to spoil the over tone.  I guess if you really want to know...  At one stage of development you were just killing people... for no real reason.  just because you could...
Anyway; now it's a little better, your escaping your own inner darkness...  Or are you feeding it?
author: hellsuggestionbox
title: Psychosisfree
comments: I lasted a whole minute once.
Highest score I could get was 49.8 and that was me walking in a straight line. :D
@snowyowl: It was even worse at one point...
@accidentalrebel: Killing things helps, as it slows down the darkness...  I only realized afterwards you can't get to the text that tells you that without killing someone
it took me a few goes to realise I could kill people, I generally shot them a few times and when nothing much happened I kept running :). but eventually I got it :). pretty clever!
Although is a bit dark I loved it. People are a bit hard to kill though, lol. Quite a good entry.

description:
Pick up all the prisoners and let them escape!
Move with arrow keys.
author: kumber
title: Mass Escape
comments: Simple but very cool and nice implementation.

I don't like that it depends more on good luck than skill because sometimes two guys come at the same time, or they come too quickly one after another and it's hard to reach the door to "cash-in" the ones saved.
No community? Man, you've let me down. Though it is very fun!
Why are they so suicidal? ;o. Must be a mean prison. Anyways, it's fun, except after the three prisoners are taken... Then what?
@BlueShaman: when you take three prisoners, the gates at the top will open.
@Kouta: What do you mean with "no community"?

@nitram_cero: At the beginning I wanted to time exactly the falling, and to lose a life for every prisoner's death. At the end I was running out of time and so decided to let them down randomly; also, I felt it wasn't fair to lose lives randomly, so I changed to losing points.
@Kouta: I understood, maybe; this is my first LD and I rushed to make the game (forgetting everything else). I think I can write a little postmortem now!
I got to 9 saved before I stopped playing. I like the idea of loading up and running for the gates, but there are a few things that I wish you had time to adjust. ;)

description:
In Chains is a 2D platformer. I created it using OpenGL, GLEW, SOIL, and OpenAL-Soft. The game is very short, and the ending isn't much, but I hope you enjoy at least the little bits that are there.
(Warning, the source code is very messy!)
author: xRedx22
title: In Chains
comments: Loved your artstyle, the writing on the wall in room 1 is a nice touch :)
Also nice use of quicktime events in a platformer, don't know that I've ever seen that done before.
Also, if you were having issues with a startup crash, I updated it now so it should work.
Nice little platformer. :) The event-based dodging was clever! I escaped only to find that the air before me had become an invisible solid.....
Sorry, I never quite finished the ending, I just kind of put that image there and added a wall.
I'm glad you liked it though.
yes, the art is great, but due to weird bug I couldnt even get the key to unlock the door in level 1 (it was teleporting me over entire platform, and I couldnt get close to key no matter what)
Makc, that could have something to do with the game being synced to framerate instead of time. Unfortunately I can't change it now...
Great entry. Reminded me of a childhood full of Atari 2600 games. Yeah, I'm old. :(

description:
Illusion is an simple platform game with the focus on narration.
Software used: Scirra Construct Classic
Graphics using: 90% MS Paint/ 10% Paint.NET
Fonts: Fixedsys TTF (Included with the game)
Sorry, the game does not contain any sound since I don't have any experience with music.
The narration may sound a bit silly/unusual since this is my first attempt at any sort of narration in the game, also English is not my primary language.
Thank you for playing my entry! :)
author: abhilash2863
title: Illusion
comments: I finished it, because I wanted to know the end, so the narrating works.
A bit slow on display, but well integrated as part of the game. Good job !

Nice, reminded a lot of The Stanley Parable if you've ever played it, only yours is a platformer. I think it would have been cool if the player character didn't say anything, kind of let the player fill their shoes.
Fun! Like Zemmi, it reminded me of The Stanley Parable too.

Due to the character gliding after jump it quickly changed to excersise in frustration. Either my reflexes just aren't what it used to be, or it is too hard. Hadn't finished since I really hadn't nerves to force myself to try for the hundreth time

Good game, but the controls felt a bit stiff. They would probably work better without the acceleration/deceleration when you start/stop moving. The game was a bit short, but I liked the story and the ending. :)

description:
This is my first LD ever, and while the game isn't anything worthy of too much praise, I had a great experience and learnt a lot for the next one.
Lessons:
1. Study up on tech BEFORE the compo starts. I spent a good chunk of time doing FlashPunk tutorials and things just to get my game going and it wasn't until Sunday where things really pulled together.
2. Keep it simple. I over-scoped bigtime on my game here and had to hack together gameplay at the very end. There is so much I wanted to do, but just no time.
3. Learn how to make music. I can do the art, coding, and effects just fine, but I am hopeless with music. For the next one!
Software:
FlashDevelop IDE
FlashPunk library (thanks Chevy!)
Photoshop
Ogmo level editor
Send any feedback you have to @bkavs or the e-mail on my website at www.kavs.ca.
Thanks!
EDIT: Some players are getting stuck inside collision when they change zones too close to a wall or water tile. It's rare, but try and 'zone' at least half a tile away from collidables. Also, it sometimes goes funky if you change zones too much (primarily around 1-1 and 1-2). Sorry. :(
author: kavs
title: Escape Paradise
comments: I really wanted to make the spiders wander (they have a full spritesheet to support it) but I just ran out of time. If I had another 6 hours I would have made them wander, animated the player, and added some game music... but such is the nature of LD48, I suppose! :)
Thanks for the feedback and I'm glad you have a deep appreciation of my beatboxing. Untz Unts Untz. <o/
I got stuck in a wall moving from that room in the first screenshot (with the spider) to the left. Still, a nice little game.

Ah shoot, I thought I removed all instances of that happening. :(  I should have added an 'escape' hotkey for the compo that places you right in the middle of the room. Would have taken 3 minutes and prevented that from happening for LD.
Sorry to hear the time got the best of you, the game definitely would've been improved by some more challenges and animations. Still, very cute game and great work.
As mentioned, animations would be nice but I found it to be, short, simple and charming as-is :).
In-game music is the only way it's really lacking, IMHO. A little more challenge wouldn't hurt either but I thought having to gather food was enough, possibly perfect for LD.
I especially liked the visual theme and look of the character :).
I quite liked this! A bit thin on gameplay but it was surprisingly pleasing to wander around the island looking for supplies :)

pretty fun! but, I'm sad that this is the second 'stuck on a desert island' game I've played this compo where you can eat dodgy mushrooms, and there's no trippy visuals. Son I am dissapoint :P anyway apart from that well done :)

@wbobeirne, yeah, I would have loved to add some more challenges or at least moments where the player has to think. I have learnt a lot about pacing from this LD, so hopefully my next one is a bit better.
@jedi, if you watch my timelapse you'll see me fighting with myself to do the character animations. I feel like I'll never do them justice, so I just postponed it... indefinitely. ;)

description:
You are a ball of plasma trapped in an elemental maze. As you explore you can find different elemental modes to aid you in escaping unscathed from the numerous monsters out to get you.
Keys:
Arrow keys: movement
Esc: Exit
1 - raw mode (default mode. Gives you more health)
2 - light mode (enemies notice you more, but after 5 seconds you get path finding to nearby objects of interest)
3 - plant mode (slower movement but decreased damage from enemies and increased health regen)
4 - lightning mode (take damage over time but damage nearby enemies)
5 - water mode (enemies lose all friction and have worse control (doesn't work well, don't use))
6 - shadow mode (enemies less likely to notice you, but you take more damage)
7 - air mode (you move a lot faster, but are extremely vulnerable to damage)
Tested in both linux and windows. You need python2.6 (or greater but not 3.0), pygame and python_openGL to run.
Can download pygame installer for windows easily, but I found for pyOpenGL I had to download setuptools and run from the command line
To run the game, just run the "elemental_escape.py" file.
c:\python26\scripts\easy_install.exe PyOpenGL PyOpenGL-accelerate
Known issues:
-Framerate is quite low (I think due to locking inefficiencies between movement and drawing threads)
-Water mode allows monster to go very fast due to poor drag model.
-Sometimes you (and monsters) can cut through the walls at their ends (not a big deal but not perfect)
- breadth first search for path-finding (light mode) is inefficient. Maximum path-size is probably a good idea so the light-mode only checks for nearby items.
ToDo:
- Text to the screen for detailing keys to use, powers from the modes, that you've won the game, or lost the game, etc.
- Better graphics (including animations), sound.
- More than one kind of enemy, more interesting escape from them.
Tips on playing the game:
- Monsters are less agile than you are. If you quickly dodge them effectively they can't find you.
- You always start in the bottom-left of the maze, and the exit is always at the top-right of the maze.
Also just a warning: I should've said this earlier so sorry to those who put the effort in and were disappointed. I did this game in very little time and I'm not really very experienced in game programming. The main problem is that I got it working and then didn't tweak it to be actually fun. So this game isn't really very good and I am aware of this. Only download if you're willing to try a not so good game and give it the rating it deserves.
author: triorph
title: Escape from the elemental maze
comments: Whoops. I said tested only in python meant tested only in linux.
Are your files still hosted? I am getting a could not connect message trying to download your game.
After I went through a lot of trouble to get python and all dependencies running on windows I found it wasn't worth my time. This is one of the worst entries I've tried.
Sorry Server went down. Should be up now.
A pity I haven't figured out to start it yet. Have to check the pyopengl lib again.
Have you tried building a windows exe with py2exe or similar?
Download still failed for me. Server is up atm?
Sorry, this is unplayably slow for me. It looks like around 1 fps, and the collision detection completely fails, so it jumps between inside and outside of the maze.

Based on the appearance of the graphics, there's no reason it should be anywhere near that choppy. I haven't looked at your source, but I don't think you should have separate threads for moving and drawing. I think pyOpenGL might be overkill for this. Maybe a regular old pygame game would be good for next time, if you decide to use pygame again.
Anyway, I'm not frustrated. This is Ludum Dare after all. :)
I strongly recommend using py2exe to package games up for a windows release!

Can someone tell me why Python devs are so against making executables? I am not a python dev, so I don't know what I need to get this to run. No instructions of any kind... You've got the least ratings of any of 699 games right now, and this is why.

Well, I got it to run, but with it constantly jerking back and forth and having such a poor framerate, I couldn't stand to play it for very long :( Congrats on getting something mostly working, though!
I tried to make an exe using py2exe, but it's having a couple of problems I don't really understand.

description:
Another day at Pleasure Resort - where no one ever grows bored. But wait, how long have I been here? I barely remember what is outside these walls! Should I escape?
Pleasure Resort, where you can escape reality - don't even think about really escaping, though!
author: ToxicLogic
title: Escape from Pleasure Resort
comments: The boredom meter fills up pretty fast, and you can just enter/exit your room over and over to survive dying of boredom (not sure if intentional). I liked the idea though, pretty funny
Got a bit confused why my boredom meter kept going up and the controls felt a little strange. Did complete the game so It must have been enjoyable :)
How can bread increase boredom ? Bread is cool! Bread is life! That's a very bad start! ^^

But except this bread mistake, I really enjoyed this game, even if I don't know why. Maybe it's because is fun ? Myabes it's because the music is pretty cool ? Or maybe it's because I managed to moonwalk
Thanks for the comments, guys! Glad to hear that people are enjoying it overall.

@Pierrec Haha! Well you're right in the sense that "bread is life", but that's why it's boring. Not to mention, EVERY game uses bread as a powerup, so I thought it would be fun to reverse that stereotype. :p And I'm glad you enjoyed the music - it's the first time I've taken a stab at composing a song.
That pit, and the fact that I couldn't hesitate for a second. Liked the sins thing =)
Nice idea, and well done. But why are oranges boring? No (real) word rhymes with orange, so it shouldn't be boring! :)
Bread and water would definitely be a boring meal, but a small explanation about what is/isn't boring might ease confusion.
Music and graphics were both good, and the boredom mechanic was interesting, but I thought it was over a bit too quickly.
Thanks for the feedback. I put a list of boring/exciting things at the bottom of the web page and just added pictures to make it clearer.

Interesting mechanics, took a couple of failed attempts to get the hang of it. Enjoyed exploring and the variety of rooms, but slightly confused by a few doors that seemed purely cosmetic. I would happily have played it for longer :)
@Jacic: Strange, Orange should rhyme with Stonehenge /pun

I think the game delivers, i'm not terribly fond of it (that's just my personal taste about games, not something you could or *should* fix), but everything was very well executed. Especially the Music, it's a catchy melody. The sound fx could have been better (that's why I gave you a 3 in Audio, and not a 4).
Very well done. The Albert Einstein quote was a nice touch.

description:
Please note that this entry uses WebGL, which is not supported by IE. Works best with Chrome and Firefox.
You have been captured while trying to find the plans of the Nazi reich. In order to escape from Castle Puzzlestein you will have to use your brains instead of your brawns. Unlike the guards in the more well-known caste, the gauards here are quite slow. They will move only when you move. They will however try to catch you if they get a glimse of you.
Plan you actions ahead. At the far right of the screen is a palette with your available actions. Next to the palette is a container for your queue of actions. Either click these actions to add them to the queue or drag them in. The order of actions can also be rearranged. Remove actions by using the right mouse button.
When you are satisified with your selection, you may start playback of the queue by using the playback buttons at the bottom. This will play each action in the queue in sequence. If a guard catches you, the playback will stop.
Your ultimate goal is to reach the exit from each level. Good luck.
UPDATE:
I've added an updated version of the game, fixing some of the problems with the competition version. Please don't vote based on this version. These are some of the changes:
* Added minimap
* Grid on the floor
* Rotate avatar towards enemy on collision
* Change movement speed
* No more horizontal scrolling in sequence list
* Added an easier introduction level
* Added loading bar
author: stigrv
title: Escape from Castle Puzzlestein
comments: Really great entry here! It was a very innovative, cool idea, and I had fun playing there was too.
Only complaint is it was a little confusing to work out what was going on (even though I read the controls) but it only took a few minutes to work out.

Had to upgrade my display driver to play, so I'm glad it was worth it! This is a really cool idea - turning a 3d action game into more of a strategy game. Yet, I still jumped a few times when I turned and there was a guard right there! Also, way to go using WebGL - I've worked with it a bit and it's not the easiest. (And since it's relatively new, there's not  as much of a community to help you out.)
I found it very hard to judge how many arrows I needed in advance to go down a hallway. Some kind of grid markings would have been nice.

A very interesting idea indeed. At first it was a little confusing, because I kept going straight and found a guard, but when I figured to turn to the corridor on the right, it was all fun. I agree with FireSlash on his/her thought - also, the view could be a little wider: I usually kept turning one field too early. But it's fun, and quite an accomplishment, using WebGL! Congrats!
Soâ�¦ played with this a little. Very interesting concept, and I'm really intrigued this is pure html5. I found it a little hard to play. Some thoughts:
- It seems like your character could move quicker.
- If the wall pattern were different, it might be easier to estimate at any one time how many steps "forward" were needed to get to a particular place.

- The game (seeming to) start out with that long straight section like that doesn't appear to be the best introduction to the engine. I want to try out various things, turn left and right and see what the buttons do, but if I do that I'm kind of thrashing back and forth in this thin corridor. (It took me a surprisingly long time to realize I could turn right from the start.) Then I run into:

- Is it correct that you can't remove items from the queue once you've placed them? I couldn't figure out how. This means that if you make a wrong" turn and have to correct yourself you've got tons of clutter in your deck of "moves".

- The interface in general seemed a bit odd. The use of the slider (or even if the slider *has* a use) is not obvious. The pause button is hard to use effectively since you don't know straight off what item in the move queue that, say, "3/10" corresponds to. Dragging things into the move queue would often cause scrolling (actually sometimes horizontal scrolling, which was weird) and cause me to lose my place in the move queue. If there were enough items in the queue new tiles would often not drop where I expectedâ�¦ I'm on Chrome on a Mac btw.

These maybe aren't fair sorts of criticisms for an LD entry, I don't know. This is still quite impressive both as a 48hr game and as an html5 game, and I did keep playing a good bit longer than I expected. It mostly feels though like a prototype for some other game that you might make later and I eventually gave up because I couldn't get the interface to do what I wanted. I'd actually be sort of curious to try a version of this with some cleaned-up UI.
I like how the nazi killed me with his crotch.

description: Controls are numpad + space.
author: alfie275
title: ESCAPE
comments: After defeating the first guard/policeman the background turned white and a fight with another guard started.
After defeating that one the game crashed.
besides that, the fighting system seems like it could be fun.

The combat system is pretty cool, but you definitely need more instructions, as I sent about a minute trying to figure out how to fight a brick wall. Also, the leveling is a bit broken, because once you fight about 10 guards you can kill them all by just holding down attack without taking any damage.

lol at fighting a wall at the start. I realized it tries to explain combat, but I just thought I was doing something wrong. I can see how combat system could be cool if polished. Graphics are very bleak and could use variety.
Pretty fun.  I also encountered the error teomat described when I entered a battle within range of two guards at the same time.

description: It is a simple game. Try to escape the game by reading notes and hide yourself.
author: McTwist
title: ESC this game
comments: I get some eror about procedure_except_handler4_commom in DLL msvcrt.dll
hmm, same I got some error about something AddToStreamEx- sorry
Works fine for me. Fun game though I wish there was more levels
Way to short, it needs more levels to be engaging. The first levels tutorial things is pretty good but the rest of the game is missing. Good start.
@Bartje321 and @RichMakeGame: I looked over it and I might have found a fix. Seems that I copied the wrong dll's, so I replaced them and uploaded it. If it works or not, please let me know.
Fun. The hide box detection is a bit buggy.
Couldn't start. Just some cryptic error on win7 64.
I compiled it on Win7 64 so there is problems with the dll's. I changed it back to the previous version and link the xp version here:
Hopefully it will work. If not, please let me know directly.
With the one up top, it claims that d3d9.dll is "not a valid  windows image" and I'm getting Bartje321's problem in the one you linked in the comments.

description:
Requires Net 2.0, runs via OpenTK, so it might run on mac / linux too with Mono (untested). More info in readme.txt
Update: Since the game is now really too hard as I hadn't time to do enough recipes, I made a list on following link (for those who don't want to spend a lot time finding them out for themselves):
http://dl.dropbox.com/u/19916467/Recipes.txt
Other hints:
HOLD space to attack anything in front of you including those pesky cats (they'll try to run away after first hit).
There are several different endings, one good, few not so good and one (not so) hidden.
author: Shigor
title: Enough time for escape
comments: So... anyone dares to escape AND survive? :)

Man the screen sure is busy with stuff. Maybe a bit too much. I ran around for a while collecting things but never figured out any recipes. Perhaps if you could provide maybe one or two recipes to start out?  I really like the art style for the game. It reminds me of attack of the paper zombies (probably because of the graph paper).
Very cool looking game, I only wish I could figure out how to win. And that damn cheetah! It would be nice if we had a little more direction of what to do.
Too much stuff on the screen and if a animal hunts me im doomed

The recipe system totally killed the game for me. I tried several items, and then stick and stone, and it told me that "I have to invent something else first". But the graphics and the gameplay are very interesting.
The Windows link goes to Recipe.txt now...?
Sorry for the link, fixed (I really don't know how it got there, must be lingering aftereffects of the sleep deprivation)
Very well done, lots of depth. Perhaps a little oversaturated with objects when you first get into it. Combat is a bit clunky and collisions are "weird". I escaped the easy way :)
Great idea and graphics style, but I couldn't make any recipe.

I really like the charming, animated-notebook-paper feel of the game. There's just too much going on though, both in terms of gameplay and especially what's on the screen! The same game with a sparser (or more spaced-out) level probably would have been more fun. Per-pixel collisions probably would've helped a boatload as well.

You added color to some things, which was cool, but it seemed pretty random as to what had color and I felt like there needed to be more (or less). I'd have expected what was colored to fit into a category. Like, just the HUD has color or HUD stuff and items you can pick up are colored, background and animals are not (or something).
The collisions just seemed - weird. When so many trees and bushes and junk were overlapping and almost-overlapping on the screen, figuring out were you could walk was a bit of a guessing game.
I managed to invent a firestarter but that's it. Despite having _plenty_ of flammable inventory and environment, I was just told there was nothing to set on fire, which was quite frustrating.

Actually after writing that I realized I needed to go back and BUILD the firestarter. So I did. I had to get more rocks (guess I used up the ones I had on a non-functional prototype?) and was told "now I can build fire." What'd that do? I don't see "Fire" on the build menu. Where's my fire!?

Ultimately, this game shows promise. It's innovative. If it were simpler and easier to get into, and had sound, I'd like it more. Picking up stuff you can find on a deserted island and combining them to build inventions that ultimately lead to your escape (I assume) has got to be the best integration of theme I've seen so far. 5* there.

description:
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Make A Game presents: "Eggscape"
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
"Oh, I didn't see you there, crushing my path for survival and my dreams of becoming a famous paleontologist.
Do you know how hard it was to find this egg? And how lucky I am that these debris are falling in such a coincidental position that I can climb some of them? It's like someone is throwing them with exact precision. But I don't have time to think about it, actually I can't do much more than panic and run around, waiting for more debris to fall."
We're Make A Game and Eggscape is our entry for Ludum Dare 21's Jam.
This wasn't just our first time competing at Ludum Dare, it was our first time working with flash!
Feel free to follow us at http://makeaga.me or @MakeAGame on Twitter for our incoming Post Mortem!
Contact us at team.makeagame@gmail.com
Have fun!
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
How To Play
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
You don't control the character,  you control the falling debris.
He can only climb the height of one block.
He also doesn't climb down.
And if he gets eaten, it's game over, man.
LEFT and RIGHT to move
UP to rotate
DOWN to place
ESC or P to pause
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
UPDATE #2
Forgot to add a Read Me.txt file to the zip file.
UPDATE #1
Oh hey, working scores! :D
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Things to add post submission:
- Treasures!
- More modes!
- Gameplay Tweaks!
- Fix Character random suicidal behavior! (especially with line piece)
- And many more!
Please read the Read Me.txt file in the zip version for more info.
author: Make A Game
title: Eggscape
comments: It wasn't obvious at first why the pieces sometimes disappeared.

Really liked it! Great graphics. Good gameplay. I was a bit confused at the start because I was thinking of Tetris "Am I the monster trying to get the egg back?". Figured it out after the first death. ;) Great work!!!
You mean if you hit the character with a piece? Yeah, that will probably change in the future.
We should have posted the How To Play text here too before.
An original creation based on a classic: liked it! ;)
Nice concept! I had fun! However I didn't need to use my brain much - there was almost always an obvious thing to do.

description:
In this somewhat mysterious game, you wake up in a dark cave with nothing but your arms and some rope. You collect one additional item to help you through your escape, of which you know nothing.
Most of the game is spent jumping across platforms or hanging/strafing on ledges (you'll notice the movement is slower).
Controls are WASD, and later, Mouse + Mouse Left and your choice of Mouse Right or Space. Remember the right click and space thing--they're a bit unintuitive, but I was in a hurry and couldn't think of a better way to resolve the dismount vs climb issue you'll run into.
Easy on the eyes controls:
W:       Jump / Climb ladders
A/D:     Walk/strafe left/right
S:       Descend, drop down
Mouse:   Aim hook
Mouse L: Launch hook
Mouse R: Climb rope
Made using the ENIGMA Development Environment. Source is in Game Maker GM6 format.
Graphics made in GIMP by whoring the tree bark and walnut textures as well as the Wind distort filter.
I offer binaries for Windows and for Ubuntu x86/x64. If you run neither, and still wish to play, you will have to compile it using ENIGMA, found here: http://enigma-dev.org/
Sorry about that. I just don't have a Mac box.
author: Josh @ Dreamland
title: Cave Escape
comments: Once you get over the game not really liking you attempting to influence your own trajectory, take it slow and you'll beat it. It's all about knowing how the game plays, and it was designed as such. The gems are mostly hidden well, and if you're reading this far you've probably discovered the in-game gem tracker.
HINT: for those looking for purple, when it looks like you've come upon a hilariously cruel dead end, it may not have been so.

I should stress that he probably means "Gem tracker" as in "thing that tells you what gems you have" rather than "thing which tells you where gems are located." Most of the game's challenge is wandering around lost in the dark without a purpose. The rest of the challenge is the horrible collisions and rope physics due to not having quite as much time as I hoped to implement them. Sorry.
The game was interesting, but wandering around in the dark with a difficult-to-use grappling hook is less fun than you might think.

Wrist got tired from molesting the movement keys due to the character's slippery handling.  The grappling hook is a neat idea, but having to blind shot things constantly and never being sure if I was going the right way or not got old pretty fast.  Only found one gem, and the big door-looking thing that shows which you've gotten.
I understand the darkness and lack of direction is part of the point, but with such an open area some sort of distinction to where you are relative to where you're going would be helpful.
Neat, although in need of some balancing.

description: My submission for LudumDare 21 is ' Bob's Escape ' and it took me less than 30 hours to make all assets and code. I am quite proud of this as it is my first game and I wanted to make a strange game with a twisted ending. Well, I hope you are all happy with it and well... Here it is!
author: Tainted_Code
title: Bob's Escape
comments: Game basics feel a little like SMB but the levels make it a bit more original. It would be interesting to see it evolve further, maybe with more different types of terrain and monsters
Thanks for feedback! I may add more levels at most but because of the rush, my code is messy, so I doubt I will be making a full game from it! :P

i tried to rush through this because it looked so simple, but i died a million times. I like the cuteness of the enemies. the hint system with the little signposts is good, the tips pop up at just the right time. other games get frustrating when there is no obvious point to jump to.
The physics feels a bit sluggish but overall a well done first entry!

Quite well done, wrapping mechanic is nice. Graphics seem a little.. square. Big elements are mixed with little ones (mushroom thing head vs their spikes), which looks odd. Sliding platforms are working solid. Music gets repetitive and needs to not restart at death. Collisions do have minor glitches.
Games with wrap around mechanics tend to focus on them, this instead uses it to complement everything else, which is a plus.
Also I like that I don't have to push more buttons to read the helps signs.
I really liked your music (for the first 5 minutes), if you could develop it a bit further into a 1 minute clip, it would be great.
The wrapping was really something, and the level design was pretty good. Good game chap!

I really like this one. I think of this as the "perfect" first-time entry. Everything you expect to see in a good, finished game is there. The graphics, the music, the levels - nothing is extraordinary but they all come together to really get the job done. The gameplay seems well-polished to me and it's very rewarding to stomp your enemies and bounce off a little.

description:
Play as a Japanese Princess in a sinking ship!
Can you get out fast enough?
(Note: Lower score is better)
-----------------------------------------------------------
Uh..... I'm pretty sure my domain name is being transferred right now, so to prevent interruptions I changed the link to direct to kongregate. It's the same swf, you can check the md5 hash. (or, it should be the same. I uploaded it to my website and kongregate at the same time sunday night.)
author: wademcgillis
title: Boat Escapade
comments: This is interesting. The relatively complex layout, the ever-rising water, the need to return to the approaching danger, and the metaphor for marriage in asian regions.
Nice little game! The level design was rather shallow in some parts, but decent overall. Could have used some music...

Not bad.  Time limits give me panic attacks like little else, so the constant threat of drowning was always-present on my mind and marred things a bit, but aside from my initial run where I managed to just muck things up thoroughly (didn't get the double jump in time :/) it was an enjoyable and well-constructed game.  Good platforming, solid controls, even a semi-interesting boss fight towards the end.  Had a few points where zombies just murdered me due to where they were entering the room, but that's the only thing that rose any legit red flags for me.
Quite good platformer - it really could use at least some simple sounds
Pretty complex game. Unfortunately I got lost. Some simpler structure early on in the game would help to teach the player of the mechanics.

Woah a metroidvania style game! The rising water level is a really interesting element - on the one hand it adds a more pressing danger, but on the other it helps you get around more easily since you can swim. A little too hard for me, but I really liked it overall!
Sweet platformer, but it felt like 90% of the rooms were just fillers. Would've been better if the ship was smaller

Ran smooth, was pretty fun. Wasn't really playing urgently at first because I didn't understand the threat. Also, could not win the boss fight, because it ended up spawning a good 20 zombies I couldn't kill fast enough. Still, neat, functional, nice challenge and good take on the theme.

description:
Written in processing (java)
Graphics done in photoshop
author: nickd3000
title: blue man cthulhu escape
comments: A simple one button repeated quick time event where you kick down the door to run from Cthulhu. As soon as the player miss times one of the button, the game is over.
Yeah, this was kind of amusing. Would have benefited greatly from a wider variety of obstacles, not just doors.
Simple one-button entry, mildly entertaining and diverting for a minute or so.
Nice fat plus for Lovecraft reference. And the game is pretty neat, too!

description:
In Amke's Revenge II you play as an audacious explorer lost in a deep, deep cave. Filled with loot, monsters, lava, and Amke himself, the caves are a place of great danger - do you have what it takes to escape?
Features secret levels, a bonus-item shop, and 2 bosses. Music, graphics, and levels created by Overman (Mark Overmars) in 48 hours for Ludum's Dare.
The controls are explained in-game. Warning: some levels require thought. Source included.
author: Mark Overmars
title: Amke's Revenge II
comments: ah, thanks for this masterpiece. i'll open it with gamemaker, when i'm at home.
thanks for gamemaker as well. i'm sorry that i cant vote for you, i'm not a participiant (this time!) i'm still learning with the gamemakers apprentice ;-)

Gameplay wise this game is genius, the boss design was also stunningly good. You sir are a master designer, that kind of gameplay polish requires either: intensive playtesting, or extensive design experience.

First of all: Thanks for giving Game Maker to the world. Without it, my entry wouldn't exist (I know that, because no other game making software gave me that amount of freedom while keeping it manageable at the same time).

description:
This game was made within 9 hours (from Sunday 11:30am to 8:30pm) ^_^
I couldn't participate to the whole 48h LD, so I decided to try to make a game in really short time (I had my Sunday free).
Also, I wanted to try to make something complete within one normal business day (8h), just to see what I can achieve, when I really commit to it.
So here it is ! I didn't have time to add any SFX, that was definitely too short for that... I hope you will appreciate this game anyway!
CONTROLS :
C - Continue your life,
ESCAPE - Try to flee the current situation,
ANY KEY - skip current dialog
Hope you'll enjoy it :)
Note : I'm sorry I didn't have time to include the happy ending branch :) The assets where almost ready (they are in the PSD source file), but I was running short on time to include it... Maybe a later version ? Check http://blog.deepnight.net for any update :)
EDIT : timelapse released!
EDIT 2 : changed the hosting (dropbox had some downtimes, sorry about that!)
author: deepnight
title: A tale about life, death and a looser.
comments: oh I'm sad :( I thought you were dealing the theme as "Escape from your mother's wombe".
Well I'll still try it later ^^
So... is there a good ending? I don't have the patience to exhaust the tree.
Awesome concept! It's like a choose your own ending novel, though a bit more true to life... since your only options are to try to keep doing what you're already doing, or quit.

I think I tried pretty much every option, even the really crazy ones.  I couldn't always draw the line between choices and their outcome -- like I couldn't figure out exactly how not sleeping with a woman got me fired.  Probably just missing something in the conversations, though.
Artwork was great, but it really made me sad :/
Really nice story-game. Please make more after this LD
Emotion reaction was high - has to be good right? Very cool game. Excellent art.

At first, it should have been a quite fun and positive game. But the lack of time made it quite depressing at the end : didn't have time to include all the subtleties I had in mind, nor the happy ending branches...
The timelapse is great ! Add a depressing piano tune and you'll have a fantastic rival for Noah : http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6B26asyGKDo
I especially like "the party" picture drawing : "I met myself And I turn out to be a woman !! "
Fantastic game by the way but the dropbox link is down most of the time ( same  problem for my entry... )

I liked it, great art and interesting concept. However, I didn't read all the way through your post to realize that there was no happy ending. I spent a good 15 minutes exhausting every option only to find that you always die a sad death.

Good concept, well executed. The graphics were simple, but you shaded the pixels to make it look deliberate, and that's pretty good. Waiting through the slides is a little annoying--I'd like to quickly gather the jist of what happens and move on. Other than that, pretty good.
I really like the art style.  Yeah, kind of all bummer endings right now though :)
Because no matter what you do you still end up in the same place
Nine hours!? Fantastic. Nice reductionist approach to choice, and (of course) superb art stylings.
Your pixels are fantastic. This game made me laugh out loud, but it also made me sad.
Minor complaint: I had to keep clicking with the mouse to get it to accept my keypresses
Too pesimistic story. Funny sometimes, but I don't like the concept of such a linear life and that no matter the choice you always end up a f*ck up.
It is quite pretty but a bit too static for my taste. Also the consequences of choices sometimes felt random.
I liked your game a lot.

description:
This is my second Ludum Dare entry.
The goal is simple, pass the guards unnoticed or flee from them and solve some of my extremely easy puzzles and you should be good to go :)
There are an ingame tutorial so the controls should be quite easy to understand.
A timelapse will be uploaded to http://www.youtube.com/user/guywithacam sometime soon.
Please let me know what you think about the game :)
Next time I'll most likely write my game in C++ or Java.
author: HighQuality
title: A Black and White Escape
comments: Somehow I am unable to kill one of the guards or to flee.
F-Secure warns that the game is harmful. I know that some older versions of GM trigger this, but usually GM games give me just a 'suspicious' -warning, so I'd like to hear more on this.
haha nice ending! :D I enjoyed this
You can't kill guards that starts moving, even when they have stopped moving, that's a bug that'll get fixed some time.
When they've lost sight of you they'll eventually stop.

description:
Phew, made it!
Use the cursor keys to move, and the return key to pick up treasure. Alternatively you can click on the on-screen buttons. Try to get to the exit without being swamped by monsters!
author: Craig Alexander
title: Underland
comments: I loved the idea. I'd like to see this extended.
The monsters can go through the solid bits. What are they? Demon-ghosts?

@theosk Yeah, funny thing, when I was designing it the matter of genre wasn't present. I was purely thinking of solving the problem of making an at least somewhat fun game, with limited scope, around the theme. It was only after things started to slot into place that I began to realise that it's sort of like a proto-roguelike.

@Coriander Haha, I didn't have (or at least give myself) time to add collision for the monsters, so I suppose it's an "unexpected feature". The monster sprite could've been more ghosty. Let's call them zombie skeleton ghosts or something.
This reminds me of the caverns section of the old Ducktales PC game. Nice stuff.
Nice job, I like the sound effects and music, they fit well with the game.  Those monsters are pretty evil, but it made escaping all the more satisfying.
Love the concept. Should definitely keep working on this! :)
Extremely short and quite simple. Good art and fitting music, if you've added few more levels, it would be very good entry.
I was cleft in twain by a monster! :O
Nice job, difficult but fun game.

description:
You are a Hero, sent to end the evil reign of the Shoe - but you were caught! Make your way through his labyrinthine castle, vanquish the Shoemaster, and ESCAPE* its terror!
WASD or arrow keys to move, space to shoot.
*Yeah, okay, it's tenuous.
author: Alexbrainbox
title: The Legend of Shoe
comments: I'm missing the link to the game
There is no link to this game
